description:
Y'all, had the falafel wrap last night.  Ridiculously delicious.  Fresh veggies, roasted cauliflower, tzatziki and feta, pickled peppers and a warm + fluffy pita.  Under $10.  

If you're in from out of town, looking for elevated yet unpretentious food with fresh ingredients and enjoy a beer and shot with your fresh-eats, COME HERE!
author: Tyler K.

description:
Pros:  quick and friendly service
           Divey and cute atmosphere 
           Interesting fusion menu 

Cons:  food was ok
author: Bayarea K.

description:
I just went for lunch. I had the chicken and waffles and I would say that it was "okay". The chicken was decent, but the waffles were a bit overcooked. The waitress overlooked me several times as I waited at the door to be seated until the bus person let her know. I felt like he deserved the tip more than she did. 

Overall, it was a fun-looking place. Probably a better spot for drinks than food.
author: Kevin H.

description:
This place was hidden in an alley way which was a little sketchy if you're not from the area. However the food is definitely worth it! The Box Kitchen is connected to The Tempest bar where you can go to eat inside if desired! 

Not being from the area, we asked for recommendations and the garlic parm fries are a must buy and was highly recommended! The perfect ratio of garlic flavoring to parm cheese ratio without the overwhelming taste of just one.
author: Amelia L.

description:
Box Kitchen definitely hits the spot for delicious late-night eats. It was on my list of places to checkout while in San Fran, but we actually happened upon it earlier than expected so I had not yet memorized the menu to decide what I wanted (a regular requirement for someone as indecisive as me) big mistake!

First of all, if you are as hangry as I was- everything will sound delicious so, make sure you have a rough idea of what you want ahead of time. 

We ordered the Fried Avocado Tacos, Garlic Parm Fries, and the burger (in my excitement I forgot to include it in my menu photo, but it had fried onions, bacon, cheese and loads of deliciousness). Everything tasted SO good and really hit the spot. I won't even doc points for the guilt I felt after the mass consumption, because daaaamn.

The cool thing here is that it's right next to a bar, so you can have your food to eat there, or get it to go (like we did). 

I would have given 5 stars, but the wait is a little on the long side with nowhere to sit, especially if you don't feel like checking out the bar next door. But really that was my only complaint. The food came quickly and held its own/didn't get soggy or weird over the 15 min walk we had to make back to the hotel.

All in all, I wish we had this awesome spot in Ottawa, and if I'm ever back in San Fran, I'll definitely be checking it out again!
author: Samantha M.

description: Came here for lunch today. They use the Tempest for their restaurant space. There was table seating available but since I was by myself I decided to sit at the bar. The restaurant being a bar too means you can order mixed drinks with your lunch if you wanted to. I just stuck with a porter to go along with the fried chicken sandwich I ordered along with fries. The fries were excellent. The right amount of crispiness, not too soggy, and not huge steak fries. I made a 2nd order of the fries and I never do that. Good portioned piece of chicken in the sandwich which crispy and the right amount of cooked for me. I'm glad they didn't automatically put hot sauce on it like what other places do.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The name should have prepared me, but I still found myself going back to the Yelp page to scan the reviews to make sure I was in the right place. Also, I wanted to make sure I was really about to place my order at some random doorway off the street leading to a busy kitchen. The street itself feels a little rough, as a tourist only visiting for the second time I'm not sure if I was in a good part of town or not, but upon arriving I did kind of wish I wasn't solo. 

I didn't get the "full Box Kitchen experience," once my confidence was up and I knew I was in the right place I approached the door to read the menu and discovered they were actually taking orders inside of the bar next door, The Tempest. I was thankful for the more traditional set up and I was glad I didn't have to eat my food on the go or outside on the street. 

I choose to sit at the bar, the restaurant was pretty busy with what I assume was their weekday lunch rush.The bartender was very quick to provide a menu and bring me my water. I was debating a beer, but he never offered again. He spent most of his time at the other end of the bar and I wasn't eager enough to try to flag him down. The Tempest had a great selection of beer both on tap and in the bottle. 

I choose the fried green tomato sandwich and fries. The fries were just your basic fries, lightly salted with a good crisp. Nothing much to write about. I have pretty high standards for fried green tomatoes after spending most of my life living in Georgia. The fried green tomatoes on this sandwich did not disappoint! They were lightly battered and perfectly fried. Unfortunately, I found the peppers on the sandwich to be a distraction. They were too spicy for what I was looking for and the quantity of them overpowered everything else about the meal. After putting them aside, I was able to enjoy the sandwich. 

Next time I find myself in the city the Box Kitchen won't be my first stop, but I definitely would come back to try more on their menu.
author: Anne F.

description:
I'm not sure what I like more:

The garlic fries.
The chicken nuggets.
The mac and cheese egg rolls. 
The friendly service, even to drunken idiots at 1 am.
The fact I can eat it while playing pool and gradually becoming a drunken idiot at The Tempest.

Or the smiles you get when you bring legitimately delicious food (not just when you're drunk...I assume) back to the other drunken idiots like a conquering hero.
author: Peter D.

description:
Amazing burger that you order from a small window & can bring into Tempest, the divey bar next door. Perfectly cooked in a fluffy bun and loaded with greens, cheese, tomatoes, etc. 

Get a side of the garlic parm fries -- they were bomb.  My friend got the broccoli and cheese croquettes, which he didn't like that much. But there are a bunch of other things (fried chicken & waffles!!) I can't wait to try next time. They're open late - 1am I believe - and super close to my apt, so I will be a frequent visitor!
author: Tanisha S.

description:
Total great find. 
It's in an alley. Behind a bar and available for lunch or a pick up window.  
Great chicken on a biscuit , waffle and chicken and an amazing Mexican kale ceases salad. 
Also super wide variety of drinks 
Get your stomach and restroom ready for the Mac and cheese egg rolls. They are amazing but wow they are heavy.
author: David C.

description:
Two big "Fuckin' A's" to the place. 

This was my last meal in San Francisco before heading back the OC and am I ashamed? Hell no! Box Kitchen is attached to Tempest and is simply a walk up window, but you can eat everything you order in the dive bar next-door. I went the potato skins and the fried chicken sandwich. 

The chicken sandwich was amazing and huge! The chicken breast was fried and seasoned to perfection. The gravy and the pickled coleslaw brought everything full circle. Good lawd, this was amazing! The potato skins are a drunks wet dream. Bacon, cheese, sour cream, and a fried egg all on three thick potato wedges. 

Both portions were enormous and my eyes were definitely bigger than stomach. Next time around, Box Kitchen, I'm coming for that burger.
author: Nate M.

description:
Didn't actually think the place was a walk up window haha. However it is connected to Tempest so if you wanted to eat indoors, just go into the bar.

Ended up getting the fried chicken sandwich and and the fried potato skins. I wanted the chicken and waffles at first, but my friend literally ordered the last one right in front of me! 

Despite not getting that, I was actually very impressed with the items I ordered. The portions were large and the meal tasted great. The chicken breast was definitely seasoned before it was fried and the potato skins were stuffed to the top with bacon, sour cream and even a fried egg!

I was not let down.
author: Timothy D.

description:
"To defray the cost of San Francisco's health care mandates, a 3% surcharge will be added to all food and beverage purchases."

Heaven forbid you take care of your employees.
author: Michael S.

description:
OMG! Love this little hole in the wall! Came here with a bunch of fwendz ... and lined up for delish food!

Here's what we got: 
(1) Chicken & Waffles - 5 stars
(2) Garlic fries - 5 stars! 
(3) Burgers - 5 stars! Excellent!!! It's one of my favs!

**OVERALL: will come back for the chicken and waffles again!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
So it is great to know that the Tempest Bar is pretty much a restaurant during lunch hours. I am also excited that it I work right next to it and had no idea. 

The location: It is pretty much down a weird alley way. So walk from transit or your house or Uber. (No parking). When you walk in a just take a seat anywhere where a hostess will come to you to see if you want to eat in or to-go. 

The food: Bar / comfort food: aka the best thing ever. A lot of fried options. I had the fried chicken sandwich that also came with fries. SO GOOD. It definitely hit the spot. I was on work hours so no drinks for me, but a beer would have gone so well with it too. 

My co-worker got Clam Chowder that they enjoyed as well. 

Overall: If you are working in the Mid-Market area this is a great lunch option.
author: Chris O.

description:
I love this window which is actually a hole in a wall on the side of tempest!  Haha. 

The setting is awesome.  Perfect while grabbing a drink or two or just to swing by to pick up some food for dinner.  We did the latter.

We went with the burger and fried chicken sando.  The burger was delicious with all the fixings.  I actually really enjoyed the soft bun and the fries were to my liking.  The fried chicken in the sando was perfectly crisp.  No lack of flavor anywhere here. 

They were out of the chicken and waffles so I hope to catch that the next time I swing in by.  Great place to pick up a meal...not good for kids unless you take it to go.

5 solid stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
Box Kitchen is an amazing walkup serving up some truly delicious bar bites and greasy foods perfect for a dive bar! it's also awesome that once you pick up your food, you can head over to the Tempest bar next door to enjoy your eats. The Tempest has a really great vibe in my opinion - coming from someone who doesn't drink too much too!

Shared several plates with my friends. My runaway favorite was definitely the mac & cheese eggrolls. They were crispy on the outside and generously filled with decadent mac & cheese. The tomato sauce on the side was also the perfect accompaniment for this dish! My second favorite were the potato skins. I LOVED the sunny side up quail eggs on top! But all in all, what's not to like about potatoes, pork belly, and a runny egg? Bringing up the end were the garlic fries. They weren't bad by any means, but compared to the egg rolls and potato skins, they were just kind of average, you know?

For my main, I went with the honey grilled cheese sando. I loved the mix of gouda and manchengo which provided a delicious nuttiness that also went well with the thicker peasant bread. The tabasco honey was also delicious and I really liked that they drizzled extra honey on the sandwich too. You literally got bites of sweet, spicy, and ooey gooey melty cheese between bites. Heavenly, just heavenly.

The only caveat about Box Kitchen is that the area may be a little sketch later in the night so definitely travel with friends.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I've always said the divier the better, and this place is no different. I was visiting the city at the time of my visit, and was staying in a hotel nearby - it was walking distance from the shops in the financial district. 

The short line was quick and the guy taking our order was super nice & welcoming. The food took about 15 mins (I got the box burger & my friend got the tempest) and was well-worth the wait. 

Do yourself a favor, however, and remember your ID. People that get food here usually eat in the bar next door, but since my friend forgot hers we ate on the side of the street - no regrets. 

This place was delicious & will probably become a regular for me to visit when I go back to the city.
author: PJ C.

description:
I'm not usually one to leave reviews (and I wish I could give 0 stars), but this experience warranted my very first ever yelp review.  I'll start by saying, the customer service we received was 100% terrible and uncalled for, so much so that we ended up walking away and most likely will never return to this establishment again.  Here's a summary of how our experience went:

As we were standing at the window to order, I noticed that the big chalk sign menu next to us had several items with a 'Sold Out' sign over them.  The 'Sold Out' sign was covering the entire menu item, blocking it completely from view. Since it was our first time here, I was curious to see what we missed out on so that we could get there early next time to order what most likely was a popular item.  Seeing that it was just a magnet, I pulled back the magnet to see what the menu item was and quickly returned it to its place.  Upon doing so, the lady behind the window aggressively began yelling at me and said "um, could you not f*cking do that??"...I was obviously startled and quickly apologized saying I was just curious to see what we had missed out on, so we could know what to come back for in the future.  She continued to say, "it's f*cking sold out, so why the f*ck you need to look at it?" and then told me to "not f*cking touch it again".  Maybe I was in the wrong or being too curious, but it certainly didn't warrant this lady responding in the way she did.  Especially as an employee at this establishment.  Needless to say, we stared at her in disbelief (along with everyone else waiting for their food) and walked away to take our business elsewhere.  I'm still in shock at how this establishment treats their customers definitely will not be recommending this place to anyone I know.
author: Laura K.

description:
Definitely prepare to order multiple items because these are like snack level.

I came here once I knew they had deep fried mac n cheese rolls. Unfortunately I don't think it was the best item I tried that night because the ratio of wrap to mac n cheese wasn't balanced enough. I think I'd prefer the battered ball version over the roll.

The broccoli and potato croquettes were a bit of a heavy let down because they just seemed like a deep fried ball of softness but i was hoping there was going to be some sharpness or gooeness from cheese and maybe a kick of spice from cayene or paprika or something. It was still filling but not as tasty, maybe a drizzle of a sauce could have helped.

The potato skins were the real winners for me! those had good texture, flavor, and they just looked like a fun bite!

Staff here are cool and super friendly which is always a plus.

Fun fact this place doesn't have stinky trash. I know this because there was no seating in the bar next to the storefront (which is where people usually eat their food after they order) and so my friend and I had to eat right outside the storefront where theres a small table and trash right beside it.

I'd come back to try different items.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Came here for early dinner to go. Ordered the Box Burger with Parmesan Fries. Took about 10-15 minutes to make. They offer to bring it next door to the bar or if I will wait to take it to go. 

The burger was huge and greasy. It was good! I wasn't able to finish the fries.
author: Rome N.

description:
This place has no seating, you order, stand on the sidewalk for 15 minutes, then either leave or take your food to a bar next door. Bar staff was friendly but the place was crowded and extremely noisy.

They don't stock Coca-Cola, obviously to motivate you to order at the bar next door

Garlic fries were unbearably greasy and made me queasy for hours

Staff was polite and friendly

The burger was incredible, unfortunately the whole set up is so weird I doubt I will go back...

I'll avoid the garlic fries again but actually that damn burger was so good I might just go back sometime, but call ahead to avoid standing on the curb for 15 minutes.

If they hired a server to walk back-and-forth between the bar and the kitchen, this would be my new favorite burger joint for sure...

Update: giving an extra star due to the pro attitude of whoever replied to my review.  As long as people know it's not a normal sit-down restaurant before they get there it seems like pretty good food.
author: Todd S.

description:
Food is bomb!! Everything was sooo good. 

I was first upset my bf took me to a bar for lunch. And it looked sketchy asf! HOWEVER, if there's a line, it must be good and worth the wait. 

I'm so glad we did. We went during Friday lunch, so we ordered and ate at Tempest the bar. 

Customer service was awesome. We sat at the bar. A guy host seated us there and the bartender was awesome, did not get his name (Caucasian Guy with a beard). 

We got the box burger with salad with balsamic, spicy chicken sando with fries, Brussel sprouts, and the elote, Bloody Mary, and the citrus scream ipa. From drinks to food it was absolutely delicious!!! One of the best bloody Mary's I ever had. 

I don't like Brussels sprouts until recently this year I tried it at EPIC. I was so shocked how good it was. Come to find out the owners used to work at epic and prob got the inspired taste. I really liked it!! The corn was bomb!! That chipotle aioli and cheese.. yum!! 

The bar looks grungy and not that sanitary, but it's a bar.. but the food presentation was good n food was bomb!! 

Lots of tvs for sports. I like their logo too. Kinda cute. We got a couple stickers 

Highly recommend to try the food!! Soo good!!
author: Suiying S.

description:
I love love love... Chicken and Waffles. I have traveled across the United States and often when on business/pleasure I look for:
a) The best steakhouse in town
b) The best chicken and waffles in town

In the Bay Area I've tried many of the noteworthy chicken and waffle spots but I think ...think... (pausing) this may be a spot that I am eager to return to for the dish which I have yet to say about any other chicken and waffle spot in the bay (I still have a couple more places to check out I acknowledge). 

Located inside of Tempest is the "Box Kitchen" . Definitely never would of ventured here but thank goodness for Yelp. 

Ordered the chicken and waffles.
The waffle was the more volume/puffy waffle variety that I liked. The chicken was tasty and flavorful. The butter was delicious.  Finally the syrup (maple?) was very flavorful and went well with the chicken and waffle. Writing this review makes me want to run back there and order another.

The price was around $13 I believe and the portions weren't huge so that might be my only quibble.  Look forward to returning with friends/fam....

I love Chicken and Waffles. When I go to ATL, CHI, STL, NYC, KC, I typically look to eat at least at one Chicken and Waffle spot for breakfast/brunch in the same vein that I look for a noteworthy Steakhouse in the area for Dinner. 
When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the Chicken and Waffle Establishment in the SF Bay Area. They are all pretty good this is just my take. 

Rod's Bay Area Chicken and Waffle Rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen as well (random right?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews. I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places 
#1 is my fave and so on. 
1 Box Kitchen
2 Buttermilk Southern Kitchen
3 Aunt Mary's 
4 Stella Nonna
5 Auntie April's Chicken and Waffles
6 Little Skillet
7 Frisco Fried
8 Farmer Browns
9 900 Grayson
10 Brown Sugar
11 Hard knox café
12 Home of Chicken and Waffles
13 Lois the Pie Queen
author: Rod M.

description: I only got to try the chicken/waffles because it all comes down to the chicken/waffles. And with that said, I absolutely regret not having more time to explore this menu. The chicken/waffles was really good and the flavors were unique, if this dish was great, all the other ones have to be. No sitting, just a window with funny people who are friendly and dish out some kick ass food.
author: Julio H.

description:
The guys are assholes, my friend got an expired id and is clearly over 21, they did not let her in and would not cancel the order. The food we did get wasn't really good either.
--------
In response to your comment, you are clearly misleading everyone reading this. Your yelp page shows pictures of the interior of the bar, pool tables and all - so the expectation getting there is to enter that space which is shown on yelp. 
The response I got from your employees was also terrible and not helpful. Did you really expect us to eat on the curb in that not so nice part of town? 
The burgers we didn't pick up, the fries were not really that good. 
I hope you take responsibility the next time something like this happens (being the same owner of both places)
author: Nitzan V.

description:
Great for late night especially when you've been drinking and are getting the hungers! I recommend the box burger and the chicken and waffles.  

It's a small joint but totally worth the trip for satisfying your belly with fatty foods. There's a cute little perch for you to eat on if you so choose.  Best part is it's open until 1am. However they do run out of stuff!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Laid back little kitchen on the side of Tempest. 

Quick, delicious, reliable. 

The girl at the front is pretty cool, and I've seen her play it smooth even though she deals with constant douchebags. 

Props to her, and I come here all the time, haven't had a bad meal yet. Keep keepin' it real guys.
author: John W.

description:
After seeing so many great reviews for Box Kitchen, me and my friend decided to give it a try.  Overall, we thought it was just OK, and we thought it was pretty overrated.  I ordered the Box burger with garlic fries - the burger was pretty standard and it was good, but the fries were more like normal fries than garlic fries.  They added a tiny bit of cheese and a bit of seasoning to the fries, but ultimately, it didn't taste like garlic at all.  My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and thought it was below average - I tried a bite of his chicken and I definitely agree that it was below average: flavorless and bland.  The gravy that came with his meal was also tasteless.  The mac and cheese egg rolls we ordered to share were probably my favorite part of the meal, but it wasn't mind-blowing, special, or stunningly delicious - it was just good but overpriced.  

If you're looking for a standard burger or some cheap drinks, I would definitely stop by for a quick lunch, but if you're looking for a great meal overall, I would go somewhere else.  There are a lot of other options in the SOMA area.
author: Tim L.

description:
Literally a hole in the wall tucked deep inside Natoma, off main SoMa streets, Box Kitchen complements the Tempest next door, although you don't necessarily have to be a patron there to enjoy the offerings here. You can simply order and grab your stuff to go.

As for the food, it's elevated, super delicious pub grub, whether their delicious burgers, their fried chicken sandwich, or their tacos. All the offerings are listed chalkboard-style out front, and it's as easy as ordering at the sidewalk-level counter and waiting outside. It's worth a visit not just for those tipsy late-night hangry episodes, but for lunch and dinner as well.

Everything is served fast and friendly here, but if you're a bit hungry and you can see all the greasy goodness going down inside, of course it's not going to come fast enough for your gluttonous tastes. ;) But it'll be all worth it once you get your order and you can stuff it into your mouth.
author: Vincent L.

description:
For what it is, they nail it. Fusiony mid-end gastropub food that doesn't disappoint.  And with the Rosemunde-Toronado aspect factored in, it makes it pretty epic.

We ordered the Box Burger, the Tempest Burger, and some garlic parm fries and shared all of it.  Burgers were cooked to perfection and the fries were solid.  Would love to come back here and try more stuff.

Saminda
author: Saminda W.

description:
Came here from LA to get some lunch. Box kitchen is very good. Not the best I've had but pretty dang good. 

Place doesn't look like much from the outside but once inside it has a very hip look, a dive bar. Can watch sports, play pool and drink at the bar. 

THE FOOD:  Got the chicken fried sandwich and Box Burger. The chicken sandwich was good. Definitely quality in taste and freshness. But I've had better. The sauce inside was perfect for a fried chicken sandwich but needs some ranch to go with it which they have. 

The Box Burger was also good. Soft buns, thick patty and fresh ingredients inside. The garlic fries are BOMB! Loved every bite of them. The Cesar salad was also good. Not the best but good. 

Service was also on point. Our server was Rosie. She was very attentive and friendly. 

When in the area again will definitely return!
author: Thomas T.

description:
What I like about this place is the authenticity you feel when you walk in. Basically; you know this is a local place, you know it's not catering to an out-of-town crowd, and you know that the food is better than decent, and definitely hits most everything. 

I showed up for lunch during a trade show and sat at the bar for the adjacent bar...so not sure if this is a double review? Place is awesome for that real kinda bar feel you want in an area like this within San Francisco. I mean, it felt like walking into the normal kinda haunt for a college crowd.   Cool bartender, and cool atmosphere. Drink menu was great and wide-ranging, everything from regular stuff that anyone will want (their specials are hilarious and awesome) to the stuff that craft-nerds crave. Was really surprised to see a stout on tap that I hadn't seen before. 

Food wise; it hits the spot enough to be good, but it's not like the food is mind-blowing. Given the location, you'd think the food was out of place with some of the more eclectic offerings, but it works. I had the burger and have to say it was a darn delicious burger. The fries were good, too. Overall, very satisfied with the place and really darn good...but still can't say I was blown away.
author: Ben S.

description:
Came here after doing some shopping at Westfield. It was just around the corner from the mall. 

I had the following:
1) Fries - good. They season it with pepper and too much salt. A little less salt would be better.

2) Brussels sprouts - okay. I make better brussel sprouts myself.  They taste as if they are just roasted with oil only. They could easily make the Brussels sprouts a hundred times better if they added some seasoning like rosemary or lemon. Also, they put too much oil. Some of them burst with oil when you bite into them or leave your mouth feeling really greasy. 

3) Mac and cheese egg rolls - okay.  I think they would be better without the roll.  Just plain mac and cheese would be better.  The fried dough around it didn't add much flavor.  Also, the sauce it comes with was pretty bland.  I ended up using TJ's sweet chili sauce on them instead which tasted much better.
4) Buffalo chicken ranch sando - a little dry.  Definitely needed some ketchup or some sauce but otherwise it was good.  

5) Box burger - AWESOME.  So good.  It was seasoned just right also.  I usually have to add ketchup to burgers for the moisture.  But this burger didn't need it.   I will definitely come back for this.

It's basically a hole in the wall. There's no seating so you get your food Togo or eat on the street. I think I saw some people bringing the food into the tempest next door. The place is in a sketchy alley with some sketchy people around it. I would prefer to drive there than walk. 

TL/DR: the box burger was amazing!  The fries, brussel sprouts, mac and cheese egg rolls and buffalo chicken ranch sando were okay. Driving there feels safer than walking in that alley.
author: Jon P.

description:
This is a very nice sports bar where you can order really good American food FROM OUTSIDE.

You need to be 21+ to get in, which means if you're underage and you want to eat here the only way is to order outside and eat while standing on the street I assume.

The burgers are great. My friend and I enjoyed it a lot. Try the potato skin with meat and eggs.

The only downside is they give you an approximate time when the food is ready instead of actually calling you or serving it to you. That means you have to go outside the street to check every few minutes if your food is ready.

Yes they have a vegetarian mushroom burger.
author: Tim C.

description: This is a really trendy and hip place. They have a bar next door to a restaurant what a great convenience! They also did I say have an amazing menu I ordered the box burger with garlic fries  it was amazing the bun was toasted and had carmelized bacon cubes and onions. The French fries were crispy and fresh. The service was great never at a bar did I have fine dining waiter service they were quick to take dirty dishes away and refill water glasses the ambiance was really cool and did I say the food was great we also had the cheesecake which I wish the crust wasn't so hard
author: Bettina C.

description: Had this place bookmarked and we happened to be shopping at the nearby Westfield mall and decided to stop in for dinner. Surprised to see it was just a walk-up door/window/takeout stand. Guess they are owned or affiliated somehow to the Tempest bar next door. They have their menu written up in chalk on their door. It's actually quite a few options. I was craving fried chicken as it happened to be national fried chicken day when we went. So I got the chicken and waffles. The bf got fried chicken sando. And we also got the mac n cheese egg rolls and a side of fries to share. Food took a good 20 minutes or so to come out. We didn't want any drinks and we were too far from home and there's no place to sit so we actually walked back to the mall to enjoy our meal. It was so much food for two people. My chicken and waffles was tasty. The waffles seemed to be made out of like a wheat batter bur I liked it. It came with two pieces of chicken, boneless dark meat, which I liked. It could be slightly crispier but good nonetheless. I tried a bite of the chicken sandwich and I thought was ok. There was some spicy spread on it. The bf enjoyed it though. I also unfortunately did not like the fries and mac n cheese egg rolls that much. Fries were a little cold and hard and not super crispy when we got to eat them. Could've used a little salt too. I may get the garlic parmesan ones if I ever go back. The mac and cheese egg rolls is a cool concept. I think I was expecting it to be a little cheesier on the inside. And they must've used like a spicy cheese because it had a kick (and I don't really like spicy). Again my bf really like the egg rolls though. All this food for around $45 so not bad. So fried chicken and waffles is a thumbs up for me. And next time I'd like to try their burger and the garlic parmesan fries.
author: Alison W.

description:
Great hole in the wall.

My friend and I walked over here after winning a the raffle at Orpheum, it's not super far. It's a couple of blocks from the mall. This place is a little hidden because it's a hole in the wall next to a bar off of some smaller streets, but most likely you'd find a line of people at the window.

They have a pretty extensive menu. When looking them up on Yelp, you'll find mostly pictures of the Chicken and Waffles, and Box Burger. The order taker even mentioned the two when I asked what's the most popular. I was trying to avoid red meat because it was Friday (you probably can figure out why), so I wanted to check out the Chicken and Waffles, but they were unfortunately out. So I went for the Box Burger.

It didn't take too long to come out, probably what you would expect at a sit down restaurant. Because it's a window, there's no formal seats available, but they are partnered with the bar next door, so you're welcome to eat in there. Not sure if they ID all day, but just keep that in mind. We were there on a Friday night, so it was tough to grab a seat.

The burger was really good. Juicy patty, a good mix of condiments and toppings, all between two unique buns. I forget exactly the kind that they use, but it adds to the quality. My only gripe about it, is that it is a little pricey.

This is a nice little spot. Make sure you prepare around times of bar-goers if you want to enjoy a little bit more room at the seating area at the bar. The food is good, but it does come at a bit of a steep price, but I definitely want to come back and try more of the menu.
author: Robert O.

description:
I don't understand the hype about this place. It's a food shack. I see a lot of people mention that they ate inside of Tempest but my friend and I decided to take our order to go. 

Came on a weekend during the afternoon. While ordering, only one person was ahead of us in line but somehow everyone (including the people ordering after us) received their food first. Was 3 entrees too much to handle at once?  

Food ordered (~$40): Chicken and Waffles, Hood Fire Nachos, Box Burger

Overall, it was okay (tasted like how you'd imagine it to taste) but there was nothing phenomenal/memorable about my experience.  Avoid Hood Fire Nachos - didn't like the chorizo or the beans.
author: Ida H.

description:
Not sure why this place has 4.5 stars, i think it's from the 'drinking effect'. Like when you can't figure out why a bar has 5 stars... Reviews likely get left after drinking a good bit. 

Got the chicken and waffles today. The chicken was a pounded chicken breast, moist, but unremarkable. Have had many better friend chicken breasts. The waffles were okay. I wouldn't go back. Took a while for the food too. 

Nice people there though.
author: Chris F.

description:
The chicken and waffle were excellent. Remember though - it's boneless chicken, closed to chicken tenders. It had excellent flavor and the chicken was juicy.

The maple syrup added a lot of deliciousness to everything and the waffles were cooked perfectly with crisp and crunch.

I also got fries and thought they were seasoned well - not too salty.

We went around 4:30PM on a Thursday and took our food to the bar and it was CROWDED. Beware of that! The area is popping.

Not "hole-in-the-wall" anymore because it's popular but delicious nonetheless.
author: Sang P.

description: Everything you crave after late night alcohol consumption with the finesse of day time im-going-to-judge-how-this -actually-tastes meals. Box kitchen is certainly a real treat, and they have classics with interesting twists-- like the dash of gochujang sauce in the fried chicken sando-- as well as more clearly bold statement pieces like the pastrami tacos. You really can't go wrong with anything! Definite gem and one of the few late night spots actually open when you need to munch at midnight.
author: Claudia D.

description:
CHICKEN and waffles were bomb. Notice the all caps? Because the fried chicken was the star of the show. 5/5 chicken, 3.5/5 for the waffles. 

Located in a dingy looking alleyway, I came here for lunch. I think it's dine in until 3pm at Tempest, a bar next door. After 3pm might just be take out from a window.

I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and waffles. It felt a bit weird to be eating it inside a dark bar when it was 80 degrees out though.

I will come back some time to try other things on the menu for sure.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Stopped by this joint before a concert at the Mezzanine, and boy am I glad I did! It was close to the venue, so we parked on this street and walked over there, super convenient! You order at the window, and you can take it into the bar next door to it (Tempest?) and enjoy your meal to order drinks inside. On to the food:

Buffalo Ranch Chicken Sando: The fried chicken inside the sando was breaded very lightly and delicious! I don't even know how to describe it, all i know is I inhaled this so damn fast

Box Burger: I was surprised that it was a legit, fat beef patty inside the burger! I thought it'd be one of those tiny little patties, so that was amazing. It was cooked to juicy perfection, not overdone at all. For $2 more, you can add french fries to your burger. 

Can't wait to eat here again, so many things on the menu I wanna try!
author: Evee N.

description:
After a 7 hour drive to San Fran we wanted something delicious to eat. We wanted to eat good food and anything else besides fast food. We found Box Kitchen on Yelp and decided to try it out..

The area the restaurant is in does look a little sketchy but we didn't feel unsafe. There were other customers as well so we decided to stick around and order. 

There is no seating area after three, so you walk up to the window and order. You can take it to go, or eat on the sidewalk as I saw other people doing. We decided to take it to go as we saw that there were huge rats roaming the streets not to far from here. 

We ordered two orders of the box burger, an order of the chicken and waffles, and an order of French fries! The employee working was friendly, took our orders, and told us it would be a bit. We waited about 20 minutes and finally we called to the window! 

We get back to the hotel and indulge in this great food!! The burgers were juicy, big, and so full of flavor!! Maybe the best burger I've had in a long time!! The chicken and waffles was to die for. The chicken had such great flavor and wasn't dry at all. Th waffles I believe are battered with beer because you can definitely taste it!! The food was delicious and so now I see why it has such great reviews! 

It's definitely a must try!
author: Christa M.

description: Hit this place up after a concert at AT&T Park and it was fantastic. I had the Natoma Nachos, the husband had the esquites, and my MIL had the Box Burger. It was served up quickly and every bite was delicious, we will definitely hit this up again!
author: Michelle H.

description: I must say, "WOW!"  For a hold in the wall place that's very unassuming, the food is incredible.  Just short of being a food truck, Box Kitchen is located in an alley and you could almost miss it, but don't!  We went there twice during our stay in San Francisco.  The burger, any burger, is a must.  One of the best burgers in my life.  You order and wait for your food.  They give you a time and are spot on.
author: Cricket M.

description:
I actually don't give out very many 5 stars but this place is as good as it gets. Box Kitchen is just this window next to the Tempest and you can only do to-go orders. 

I recommend phoning in ahead of time since sometimes there is a long line around 12-2 am. 

My go-to late night foot spot. 

You can't go wrong with these orders:
1) potato skins 4.5/5
2) chicken and waffles 4/5
3) box burger with garlic fries 5/5

A little pricey for the portion size but sometimes it's ok to indulge in terribly unhealthy food if it gives you a food orgasm.

The place is in a sketchy alleyway on Natoma and I've definitely witnessed some muggings and car break-ins but just gotta be alert I guess. Anything for good food, am I right?
author: Alicia L.

description: We landed at night, and the food at kitchen box is a good choice if you are hungry at night.  A pity thing is that many homeless are near by and asked for changes.
author: Badie G.

description: I saw all the great reviews so how could I not stop by. The Mac and Cheese eggrolls were carbalicious. The burger was fresh tasting and cooked to perfection but very messy. Fries were OK but not great. Grilled cheese was very cheesy. The chicken and waffles was the highlight. The waffles were crispy on the outside and perfectly flavored. The chicken was white meat and pretty crispy. The Sriracha Maple Syrup had no noticeable heat but was still delicious. This is not health food folks, but perfect for the late night bar scene. Be warned, it is take-out only unless you eat at the bar next store.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
This place was a few blocks away from the main highway.
I ordered the chicken and waffles option and was very please with the beer flavors in the waffles. 
The Tabasco butter was also great.
The vibes in this place was laid back and I truly appreciated that.
If I'm ever in the San Francisco area, I definitely will return!
author: Jazzy D.

description: So it's midnight and you're coming from a ballgame or in my case a concert and everything is closed...except Box Kitchen. There is a line eight people deep so it must be good food. You are not going here for ambiance because it is quite literally a hole in the wall. An opening just large enough to exchange money for food. 5 stars for service- this guy was smiling and kind to all of the partiers stumbling up to his window. Some pretty creative choices including a caesar salad sandwich and broccoli croquettes. Yummy garlic fries that I probably shouldn't have eaten right before bed. Taking away one star for grease and some creepy clientele. But otherwise a pretty awesome choice for late night grub. Solid 4+.
author: Kristin E.

description:
Great lady at the door that took our orders, super personable and was very accommodating when I asked for four different condiments (don't blame me, it's a southern thang!) Thanks Ali! 

We got the Box Burger and the Buffalo Chicken Sando. We both liked the burger the best but we asked for medium rare and the burger was definitely on the medium side. Oh well, it was still juicy and tasty! 

You. Must. Get. Their. Banana. Pudding. It is SO GOOD and only $3. A perfect portion size for one and you know I didn't share! Not sure if this is a permanent item on the menu but I hope it will be! 

Overall, will definitely come back but might try other things on the menu.
author: Kat L.

description: Best little hole in the wall spot (literally!) My boyfriend and I went out to grab some late-night munchies food and this place was AMAZING! We pretty much sampled at least 2 different items each and ALL of the food was tasty, not overly salted or greasy. Despite stuffing my face, I did not feel the least bit heavy or guilty the following morning. This is not usually the case with most late-night joints in SF. The only down side was that there was no where to sit and it would've been awkward if they did because it's in an alley next to some bars and whatnot... so be prepared to stuff your face in your car or at home.
author: kaylita S.

description:
Wanted to add a review for the Box Burger.  It was great. Order one with everything on it and you won't be disappointed.  One of the top burgers I've had, that's for sure.

The garlic and parmesan fries were ok.  Kinda lacking in both the garlic and the parmesan departments.
author: Nick D.

description: The chicken was amazing and the waffle was delicious. Really enjoyed the Mac n cheese egg rolls to. Wish the guacamole was put on the side for the potato taquitos. It made them a little soggy, but will being coming back for the all the other food options
author: Ricky D.

description: Good food! You order to-go or you can eat at the bar next door. It's called Tempest Bar. Fun and lively ambience. The mac n cheese egg rolls were interesting. Not sure I'd order that again, but worth it to try once. The "fried chicken sando" was delicious! The garlic parm fries were amazing! Definitely a great place to check out, and to grab a drink at the bar next door. Great business for both :)
author: Kirby P.

description:
Food is extremely overpriced and not even mediocre. Cashier was extremely rude and didn't bother to confirm our order before sending it out. $13 to be yelled at and surrounded by hobos while you eat.

Anyone who gives this more than 2 stars is delusional.
author: Trevor W.

description:
Wow this place is definitely my newest favorite late night food spot! They have so many unique but delicious combinations of food. I ordered the croquettes and potato skins. 

The croquettes were really good and the potato skins had this delicious sauce on them. I would highly recommend giving this place a try!
author: Helen z.

description: The croquettes, mac n cheese in egg roll and the tempest was super delicious! Would come back to eat all those again. You can bring the food into the bar and the bar has a wide variation of beer and even a margarita on the menu. A very casual bar environment with a pool table and loud volume.
author: Xi-Er D.

description:
Their burger is amazing. 

Box is next to the bar Tempest. You can call-in or order via a window outside - there is no seating specifically for Box. It is located off a small street in SF called Natoma. 

I like their other items as well (brussel sprouts, mac n cheese rolls, fries), but I always come back for the burger.
author: Michelle B.

description:
We were craving burgers after a round of beers at Fort Point so we decided to trek over to Box Kitchen. When we got there, we discovered that it was a literal hole-in-the-wall with limited seating in the bustling bar (Tempest) next door. 

Rating Breakdown:
2/2 Stars for Taste --
We ordered a Box Burger and the potato skins to split. YO. Those potato skins though! Perfect, thin potato skins fried to a crisp and topped with thick chunks of pork belly and quail eggs. Everything fried. A true work of art. Topped with some lemon aioli. The Box Burger paled in comparison. Yes it was juicy, but it was merely GOOD. Those potato skins were LIFE CHANGING.

0.5/1 Stars for Value -- 
It's kind of pricey for the quantity you get. I think $10 for 3 potato skins and $11 for a burger -- typical by city standards but objectively not ideal. We weren't super hungry so splitting two orders was just fine, but I can see myself easily spending $15-20 here if I were looking to eat a real meal. 

0.5/1 Stars for Customer Service --
The guy taking the orders was very nice. After placing my order, he just told us to "come back in 20 minutes". They don't call your name or anything, you just have to wander back from the bar every 5 minutes or so and ask if your order is ready. Then you have to get carded again (I'm an Asian girl that will look 15 until the end of time.) when you go back to the bar -- it's a whole thing. Once you get your food, you have to secure a table in a packed bar where every few minutes you have to scootch your chair around so the people playing pool don't whack you in the face with their sticks. If you don't want to deal with the whole seating situation, you can always squat outside and eat in the abandoned sketch alley. Flickering street lamps provide the best mood lighting.

No bonus star because I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. 

TL;DR: Try the potato skins. Seating in the Tempest next door or squat on the street.
author: Abby W.

description:
This place you can either order to go or you can order and then take your food next door to the Tempest. We chose the latter. 

Food was a 4.5.

We ordered mac&cheese egg rolls (5), the Baja fish tacos (4.5) and the avocado tacos (4). 

I recommend the place and definitely suggest going next door for a beer!
author: Chava S.

description: Best place in Austin. Hands down. I've been there from the initial location to the new one and it keeps getting better.
author: Asher F.

description: Got the Avocado tacos and they were pretty good. I felt like it would have more flavor with some source of protein. My friend got the chicken and waffles after looking at the yelp page. If I ever came here again, I think that's the next thing on the menu I would try.
author: Cortney T.

description: Really good fried chicken sandwich and a side salad. Fresh and light really unbelievably good. Great atmosphere and  local vibe.
author: Pete M.

description: Absolutely incredible burger, really cool guy taking our order at the window if I ever find myself back I. San Francisco I'm definitely finding my way back to this spot! Highly recommend getting a bite to eat and heading over next door to the tempest
author: Jaime F.

description:
Usually I don't eat fast food. But it was evening we have little break from night club for eating some food. Since it was late there was not a big choice there to it. I find this nice place and give it a try.
I am very picky about food. First thing I like about place is how clean they keep kitchen. Second thing is it smells good. Usually fast food kitchens reuse grease for days in a row, which crates specific smell. I don't feel it there. Service lady was very tired but it does not effect how fast she service us. And at last burgers, they are very good. they are hand made not bought as a stuck in costco. Very juicy and fresh made, thick and nice texture.
Good job.
author: David K.

description:
For us, this place turned out pretty disappointing. It is basically a street food window where you have to order and pick up your food outside and seating is available in a dive bar next door. Offering very weird service and overrated chicken and waffles, this spot just didn't live up to our expectations that had skyrocketed after seeing their yelp ratings. 

Chicken was overly breaded which made it very hard and taste right together. The breading didn't taste any good either. 

I'd say don't bother stopping here unless it's too late at night and you're craving chicken n waffles real bad. There's better places out there.
author: Satyam D.

description: Box Kitchen is the best place for late night burgers in San Francisco. The burgers are juicy, and nicely seared on the outside. The buns and high quality and the fries are on point.
author: Jason R.

description:
A solid 4.5 stars for me!

TL;DR delicious unique American food but a little sketchy alleyway, no place to sit (but we made do!) and a little pricey for what you get 

FOOD: We ordered a box burger with fries on the side and chicken and waffles for 2 people for $27 total. A little pricey for a window facing out towards an alley. 

The box burger was about the size of my palm, but an inch and a half thick of the juiciest, most flavorful, and tender patty I've had... possibly ever? I'm not the hugest gourmet burger fanatic, but I love beef, and this one was pretty amazing. 

The chicken and waffles was good too. I don't usually like waffles much, but the chicken was crispy, juicy, and flavorful! The portion was particularly small for $12 though. Maybe average for SF prices, but still not totally worth it. The syrup was delicious. Not too sweet and it balanced the chicken and waffles well. 

We felt pretty full sharing both! Even though the portions seemed a little small at first. 

SETTING: Not the nicest. It's a little sketchy looking and hard to find, in a small alley-like street with just a window poking out. You can take your food into the connecting bar next door, but it was really crowded at 6 on Friday night, so we opted to walk a couple blocks to the Westfield mall and eat in the food court. (If you get it to go, they put it in a nice big brown bag with handles free of charge!) It made eating more comfortable! I wish your only options weren't the sketchy alley or a crowded loud bar. The food is too good for that!

Overall, I'd come back!! Don't let the setting scare you! But if you want to sit down and enjoy some nice food, maybe bring it to the mall.
author: Rebecca T.

description:
Pretty dam solid spot to visit for lunch, The box burger and the chicken and waffles were instantly must try's. The brussel sprouts was also very good, let me break down what was sampled and how it all faired

I have past this place prior, literally a hole in a wall, no seating outside, take it into the Tempest bar and sit down inside to finish your meal.

The fried chicken and waffles was excellent, by far one of the better chicken and waffle spots in the city, chicken was tender, juicy, piping hot and decent flavor. The waffles were crisp of first bite add some of the syrup to make the dish complete, definitely must try

The Box Burger was also exceptional, they ask how you want the burger made, I asked for medium well, added and egg, minus the bacon and avacado, still burger was solid. Decent in portion, came with thin fries, not the best I have had but worth a try if you are in the area.

Sampled there corndogs also a good must try, topped with diced jalapenos, even after 20 minutes the dogs were piping hot in the middle, toppings were good, no need to dip this in ketchup or in mustard, again a must try

the buffalo chicken sandwich was not my favorite, the flavor of the fried chicken was just that buffalo sauce infused into the chicken, if you do like that flavoring this is the sandwich for you if not stay clear, it was tender, decent portion dish also comes with garlic fries

Wash this all down with a beer on tap or with a glass of water, sampled there ridgeland churro beer, odd tasting beer not like anything I have had before, I would stick with your normal go to beer like a hef or any other domestic, but if you are interested there are several other choices on tap

the restaurant is primarily outside but you can sit in the Tempest and order and eat there if you would like to sit down

food **** wow for the fried chicken and waffles, ok for the box burger
service **** sitting at the bar, service was decent, bit slow but only one person working the bar
price $$
ambiance **** hole in the wall for the actual restaurant but the bar next to it was very interesting, very divey, markered up, chalked up in regards to what beers are on tap
author: Clarence A.

description:
Haven't been here at night, but Box Kitchen was a great place for lunch! You might need a nap from how filling everything is, though.

Started off with some elotes and had the buffalo ranch chicken sando, upcharge to garlic fries, as my main. The elotes were alright (should have gone with the mac & cheese eggrolls!), but the sando was pretty tasty. There's a bit too much slaw on there for my liking, but take some of it out and voila - an extra side salad!

Service is friendly enough, and I find everything here to be pretty affordable for SF. I kind of wish I had opted for their Box Burger, but hey - that's what return visits are for, right? Especially late at night...
author: Jerry C.

description:
FOOD IS DANK (and heavy so you can easily be satisfyingly full). You order and pick up from this little window and there are only maybe ~12 items on the menu but I can't wait to try them all. 

What I've tried so far:

1)Box burger: my favorite item. The patty is full of flavor and juiciness, the toppings and textures are very savory.I don't even remember what was in the burger because everything was so good. 
2) Brussel sprouts: wayy too much sauce. the brussel sprouts itself had great flavor and texture (soft baked(?) and not bitter) but that sauce was so salty I couldn't finish it :/ hate it when foods get lost in the sauce
3) Garlic fries: flavor nation. it had cheese and garlic that's a winner. can be a little soggy
4) Fried chicken banh mi: good concept, good sauce, but the fried chicken was a little dry and flavorless (very chicken tender-like) and the jalepenos were spicy. Well-toasted bread though
author: Lydia Z.

description: Pretty seedy location, but their burger was amazing.
author: Jessica X.

description: Delish... Hood lil under spot... Be safe... Little to no parking..m definitely call and order ahead..
author: Dubl A.

description:
This is exactly what I crave if I spend time at tempest next door. 

Their food is so good and would do very well if it became a restaurant. It's like food truck food but better. 

The team that staffs this place is also nice and funny. They make it too easy for me to spend all my money here.
author: Jackie W.

description: Pricey but worth it! Had the chicken sandwich and the box burger both were amazing and highly recommend.
author: Jose Miguel G.

description: Best burger I have ever eaten. What else shall I say? Maybe that the potato skins are from a different planet? Just the best food...
author: Benjamin D.

description:
Perfect for a fast late night bite! It's a small window beside Tempest and you can't miss it with the colour changing spotlights outside of it. There is a good selection of fun easy to eat items that are elevated beyond what the baseline offering would be. I had the mac and cheese egg rolls which were a delight of textures with the outside being crunchy and the inside being perfectly creamy and smooth. The mac and cheese by itself would've been a hit but putting it in the egg roll shell was a real treat and also made it easy to share. There was a dipping sauce that came with it too but it shone on its own without it.

The staff is super friendly. They also accept credit cards so not to worry if you don't have cash. There isn't any seating but there is a little ledge outside so you don't have to precariously juggle your meal while you eat either.
author: Emily L.

description:
Box Kitchen is a great to go if you are somewhat incapacitated, but it's only okay otherwise. The food was decent AKA good but stingy on the cheese (3/5), and the customer service was not great (2/5). At Box Kitchen, you order at a little window, then wait outside for ~10 min while they prep your food. You are also able to order food from Box at the Tempest bar, which is right next door. 

In general, most entrees were in the $10-15 range, and there were some sides or appetizers for $6+. One thing that disappointed me a little bit, is that the menu online is more extensive than the actual menu at the restaurant, so the things I wanted were not available the day I went. I think they might rotate the menu day-by-day, so the selection on the day you go varies a bit.

Our food was pretty reasonable. We ordered Honey Grilled Cheese Sando, the Buffalo Chicken Nuggets, Parmesan Garlic Fries, and a Coke. The grilled cheese was actually very tasty. I was a little wary of the honey being used instead of butter, but I really liked it. It added a nice sweet flavor. The one thing I didn't like about this sandwich was that it didn't have much cheese. It seemed like they only put cheese on 1/2 the sandwich. Then, the "parmesan garlic fries" (menu board said) were actually just garlic fries. I saw 2 shreds of parmesan at the bottom of the box, but that was it. The chicken nuggets were good. They came with some little veggies and buffalo sauce on top. You can also get them with honey mustard instead. Finally, we ordered a coke. When we were walking away, we realized the coke wasn't in our bag and went back to retrieve it. The cashier insisted that we had never ordered one and wouldn't give it to us. I am 10000% sure we did order one, so I thought that it was kind of a scam.
author: Kristin A.

description:
I got the box burger here and it was really juicy, which scores pretty high marks in my books. The Chicken sandwich, on the other hand was a bit dry. I was originally going to come here to get the chicken and waffles, but unfortunately, they didn't have it at the time that I went (I'm not sure if they rotate the menu around, or they only serve it on certain days).

Be aware that there is no seating here, as the place is more of a street vendor type of restaurant.

Definitely would come back and get food from here again at some point if I'm ever in the area!

Photo I took of my food:

https://www.instagram.com/p/BYZ_051hscy (box burger)
author: Ed W.

description:
Box Kitchen was a surprise the first time that I went there. Built into/as a part of Tempest, you can order from the open window next door to Tempest late at night. There is a decent selection of different foods available (check out the menu photos), and my go-to's are the Box Burger, Chicken and Waffles, or if I'm not super hungry I'll just grab a plate of fries to share with the table. Not as large a serving of chicken as other chicken and waffles I've had in the city.

After ordering your food, you're free to wait around out front or head back into Tempest and wait for however long they told you. Once your order is up, they'll call your name through that same window. Just grab your food, and head right back on into Tempest.

Then one time my friend was in the city, so we decided to go to Tempest for lunch. During the day, they actually use Box Kitchen as the kitchen for Tempest, and serve you on proper plates with proper cutlery. This was pretty mind blowing for me, as someone who only had gone to Box Kitchen/Tempest at night time before that.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Great burgers - but the Chicken Sandwich was even better! What a hidden gem.

No line for food on a Friday around 8:30pm. Our order took 15 minutes. The bar was very crowded, but we were able to get a table for four after eyeing the crowd for about 10 minutes. 

THE COST: $37.48 including tax/tip for a Chicken Sandwich, a Burger, and Potato Boats. A bit pricey for a burger shack off the sidewalk, but a great value for dinner for two.

* Chicken Sandwich - 5 stars
Recommended by the cashier; this was amazing! Best chicken meat I've had, super moist & soft. 

* Burger - 4 stars
Very good, just not as amazing as the Chicken Sandwich.

* Potato Boats ($9 for three) - 4.5 stars
Great, mostly for the pork belly!
author: Ziyan C.

description: Djsksmsnsnsndb!!!!! I LOVE THIS PLACE. Whoever sat around a table and decided to open up a bar/burger joint with such a distinct style-- THANK YOU. One of the most unique places I've been to in the city for sure. I came in at my lunch hour and was seated immediately, my food was prompt, service was great, and my food was even better. The MUSIC was so good!!!!!! I can't wait for my friends out of town to visit me so I can take them here. The chicken sandwich was super super good. I would make a small suggestion to add pickles either to the sandwich or as an available add on side. Not to be dramatic or anything, but I plan on bringing my own pickle next time just so I can have the best possible sandwich experience
author: Tilly D.

description:
This place hits the spot.

Me & my boyfriend wanted a quick bite, so we explored our options here on Yelp and came across this place. 

Here are the things we tried:

(Appetizer) Mac and cheese egg rolls: 5/5
So good! You have to try this if you come here. It's so unique & a really good starter. It comes with a side of marinara sauce, but I liked mine plain. 

Box Burger: 5/5
The absolute best! We heard all the hype about this burger on Yelp so we decided to give it a try. All the flavors went so well together. So glad we tried it, because it's one of the best burgers I've had! Try it with a fried egg - you won't regret paying that $2 extra :) 

Chicken and waffles: 4/5
It comes with 2 pieces of chicken & 2 waffles. The chicken was yummy & crispy, but I wasn't too much of a fan of the waffles. I would order this again just for the chicken though.

Garlic Fries: 5/5
I've had garlic fries from AT&T park and many other places, but these garlic fries are my new favorite. It's not drenched in garlic like other places. It's the perfect amount!

Box Kitchen = a hidden gem
author: Kearra B.

description:
Was in town to see Aladdin. Found this place on Yelp and decided to stop by for lunch. It's next to a little bar down what looks to be a little alley. Since we got there before 3 pm, the little door/window was not open yet, so we sat in the bar to order. 

Hubby had the Box Burger. Took a bite and it was delicious. He loved it. I had the Honey Grilled Cheese. Honey and cheese? I was skeptical at first, but I went for it and I'm glad I did. It was amazing.
author: Cortney G.

description:
Hands down best "find" of the trip! Crazy delish, super friendly service, reasonable prices and comes complete with authentic dive bar aroma! 2nd best part of the experience was watching people's faces as they trepidatiously entered
A must visit for all!
author: Elayne L.

description:
Late Night, Grungy, To-Go food BUT! Omg those Fried Avocado Tacos were the. effing. bomb.

Nachos were bomb.
I know this isn't Michelin Star Status, but what it is, it is awesome!
author: Michaela M.

description:
Positioned right next to the Tempest, with no seats or anywhere to eat their food, you know what this restaurant is for---the hungry drinkers coming out of next door. 

But in all seriousness, Box Kitchen is awesome. The prices for the food are a tad high, but the food quality is awesome. And best of all, they have so many "I'm craving this" type of foods, like all the fried dishes they have.  

I ordered the Box Burger, and was not disappointed. It was sloppily put together, and super oily, but the flavors were just awesome. There were bacon and pork bits on my burger, and the patty was super juicy. It was a savory and meaty burger, and that definitely satisfied my craving for a quick but substantial dinner.
author: Michael Y.

description:
I will definitely come back to Box! A coworker and I came here yesterday for lunch and it was just excellent. 
Good music (pandora was on point)
Friendly service that actually noticed that we were people and not just customers
Delicious food. We got the Brussels sprouts, she got the chicken and waffles, and I got the Box burger.
Brussels sprouts are doused in a sweetish soy based marinade. It gets a little strong when you get to the end, but they were really good. 
I tried a bite of the chicken and waffles. Chicken was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was also great. Nothing too fancy about the dish, but very well executed. 
The burger was fantastic. The bacon shallot gastrique was bommmbbb. I would love to see that on more burgers. 


The vibe is a little edgy, but fun. Also it is a little off the beaten path, but worth the trip.
author: Graham H.

description:
I know "long reviews" are helpful but here's what you really need to know: 

- They have Mac n Cheese egg rolls that will blow your mind. 
- Box Kitchen is attached to an awesome dive bar you can bring the food into. 
- The prices are affordable and all the food is damn good.
author: Salim Z.

description: During lunch time, Box Kitchen is served inside the bar next door. I got their chicken and waffles and really enjoyed it! The chicken was crispy and tender, and the waffles were sweet and fluffy. Definitely cleaned off the plate :D
author: Sharon W.

description: This place is divey in the best way. Order your late night eats outside by the kitchen and bring your tray of food back to the bar. Good luck finding seating though! I came hoping to try their chicken and waffles. They were out so I had a chicken sandwich that was crispy and delicious and elote that was out of this world! The bar had good vibes and fun people.
author: Maya P.

description:
This place was a real let down. We checked out this place in yelp and it was labeled as a one dollar sign, only to find out that wasn't the case. Only a few items were one dollar sign worthy. Also there is no outdoor or indoor seating, the only seating is the bar next door. 

A friend and I ordered the Hood Fried Nachos, Garlic Fries, and Elote. The Nachos were $12 and not even close to being worth it. They were too salty and the chips were stale. All the toppings such as the black beans, cheese, chorizo, and jalapeños were on top and not layered. They did not satisfy, I couldn't even finish them because they were too salty. The garlic fries had little to no seasoning, they were basically French fries with sprinkled garlic and cheese. As for elote, which my friend ordered, was decent but not $7 worthy. Over all the food was a 2/5. 

The service was decent they were quick with the food and the server was really chill and relaxed. He seemed a little impatient though. Service was a 3/5, average at best. Overall I would give this place a 2.5/5. I would not recommend this place.
author: Matthew S.

description: The box burger was delicious! It was cooked with perfection in mind. The bar was dope price for drinks was the same as the food ...
author: Amber K.

description:
TLDR: really good bar food. greasy, but that's what you want anyways, right? :)

First, you should know this is a window-in-the-wall type of place. There is no official seating; however, there is a bar next door you can eat at. Unfortunately for those who are underaged, you will have to take your food to-go.

I ordered the grilled cheese with garlic fries and they were both bomb! The garlic fries were really garlicky, which I loved.

However, the food does take a bit long though.
author: Jamie N.

description:
WOW tasty AF! Seriously - so good for grab & go American food served out of a window of a kitchen on the side of a street in an alley! (Lol!) The wait time is about 20-30 minutes, which the guy taking the order (super polite and friendly - great customer service!) let's you know upfront. 

We ordered the Box Burger w/ garlic fries and the chicken & waffles to-go. Both were absolutely delicious, greasy comfort food. The chicken & waffles comes with two sauce containers full of maple syrup. 

We actually tried sitting inside the bar 10 feet away that you can bring food into, but it was super packed by 6 PM with all the happy hour goers.

Not sure if I'd go out of my way to come here again, but I'd definitely come back if in the area.
author: Melanie W.

description: It's a rare treat to see bar food done this well -- and for the same kitchen to serve some of the best lunches in the city. The clam chowder is my favorite anywhere. The salads are generous and tasty. The daily specials and the sandwiches are great. And the sesame Brussels sprouts? Incredible.
author: Alan H.

description:
I stopped here on a quick trip to San Francisco. Husband and I were looking for something different near Union Square (and less busy). This place popped up on Yelp so we started walking there. It's not far off the main square but we were a little leery since it's kind of down an off street, sort of like an alley. 

We didn't need to worry! They take your order and the window in the street, and the employee was extremely friendly! Our food was ready quickly -about 10-12 minutes. We got the veggie burger, chicken & waffles, and brussel sprouts. All of it was AMAZING. I'd say top two items were sprouts and veggie burger. Would love to come back on next visit to San Francisco!
author: Ariel S.

description:
DISCLAIMER THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE FOOD AND NOT FOR THE SERVICE: This is a little hole in a wall located in an alley. My friend and I was very impressed with their garlic fries. As you may know, some just slap on a little garlic, a speck of Parmesan cheese, and touch of parsley and call it garlic fries. Their fries are drenched in it. We also had a burger and I'm not sure what it was called but it was delicious. The food was just the right fit for a night in the town. I will say the lady that took our order was very rude and she seemed as if she didn't want to be there. I'm not sure if she treated everyone else like this but we didn't like it one bit. 

FOOD: 4
SERVICE: 1
author: Alma J.

description:
This little hole in the wall window is a savior when drinking next door at the Tempest.  Quick, easy, affordable, everything you would want in some pub grub.  I've eaten here a few times and everything has been great! For the prices the portions are just right and leave you satisfied while chugging down some craft beer and playing pool next door.  I think the menu changes every few months - I've seen some updates with the sandwiches in the past, but prices have stayed pretty affordable (yay!). 
Go. eat. drink. enjoy.
author: Kelsey B.

description: Best burger in San Francisco!!! It's located in the heart of the city on a small street, so parking is hard to find and unfortunately there is no-where to sit and eat your food, but the food is amazing and makes up for everything else. A must try if you're in the SF area.
author: Israel Y.

description:
When people think of a "hole in the wall" place, what usually comes to mind is that the place is small, serves good product, and is not very known about.  Box Kitchen is a window alongside a building, located directly next to a bar.  LITERALLY A HOLE IN THE WALL!!!!  It's understandable why their name is "Box Kitchen" because the location consists of the window (box) and the kitchen behind that window.  Nonetheless, their food is BOMB'DIGGS!!!!

Box Kitchen is located in a small alley-looking area.  It is open late which is ideal because I don't know about you but my friends and I are usually hungry after an event or concert hosted in SF.

They have a unique menu consisting of burgers, wings, fritters, tacos, elotes, fries, etc.  Keep in mind that the later in the day it gets, the smaller the menu gets because once they run out of certain ingredients for something, that's it for the day.  People rave about their burgers but I am here to talk about their elotes!  Their elotes don't come on a stick.  They come in a tray and you eat them with a fork so they are different from other restaurants/places, right off the bat.  The corn is cooked in their chipotle lime butter and elote spice, topped with their garlic aioli sauce, radishes, and queso fresco, and is garnished with cilantro.  I know this is isn't the traditional way of making elotes but man oh man is it a tasty way!  The corn is cooked perfectly.  The toppings are not too dense and don't overpower the flavor of the corn.

I have come here a couple of times.  The quality and flavor of their food has remained consistent.  The workers are very welcoming and energetic.  Their food does take a few minutes BUT is worth the wait.  I think this place is worth a try the next time you're in the area.  I hear their box burger and chicken sandwich are good so Box Kitchen should be expecting a couple more visits from me haha.
author: Rossel C.

description:
I love this place. I've taken numerous friends here in both states, drunk and sober. I've tried the kale egg burger, chicken sando, potato skins, garlic fries, and Thai chicken wings. Everything is deliciously greasy and horribly unhealthy, but somehow you just can't bring yourself to care. 

My vote is for the chicken sando and garlic fries; the garlic fries come in a huge box that you can slowly work through with a friend, and they are the perfect level of crisp - just don't try to breathe on anyone after. The chicken is crunchy and paired with a creamy sauce, and you have to be careful you don't finish it within a couple bites. The potato skins which come with cheese, pork belly, and quail egg are also so good, but they're accompanied by a good serving of guilt. 

I haven't tried some of the more daring things on the menu, but I don't think Box Kitchen ever gets things wrong. The wait can get a bit long, especially you stop by at 2am with a bunch of other drunchy fiends, but this little hidden stand in a sketch alleyway serves up some of the best late-night food out there.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Took my family including all four kids here. Walked from Union Square. BEST BURGER in San Francisco and you MUST try the Mac 'N Cheese Egg Rolls!

No seating, to go only. Not a place you want to hang around unless you like dive bars (next door). Zero atmosphere and literally a hole in the wall to order through. But, were you coming for ambiance or unbelievable food?!!
author: Michael D.

description: If you are in San Francisco you must try Box kitchen food. I tried the honey sandwich with fries and the honey mustard nuggets and were delicious. It's connected with "The tempest", you can buy your food and then go to have some drinks there. If you want to see NBA, NFL or NHL games this is the right spot to do it. Beer in The tempest was also great, they made their own and it's has their own personal touch.
author: Peto M.

description: One of the best burgers I've had in a while. The garlic fries are bomb! They open their side kitchen at 4:20 pm everyday I would recommend eating here and getting their amazing burger
author: Anthony M.

description:
SO RICH SO GOOD

Stuffed Potato Skins
- i don't know what cheese they put in there but it was UUHHHMAZING, there was also stuffed with tons of goodies and packed with flavor!

Grilled Cheese with Honey
- WOW, such a good combination (salty cheese, sweet honey, crispy/buttery bread), but i feel a little hesitant to pay this much.  Try making it at home!

Burger
- super juicy and thick and everything you could want or expect out of a burger

you can bring your food over to Tempest and eat, such a good option for late night food in the area!
author: Tina A.

description:
Their fries are the best fries I've ever had!! I had their buffalo chicken sando with their garlic fries and couldn't manage snapping a photo of it before devouring them!! So glad we found this place. 

When we were first arriving we had a hard time finding it as it's not well lit at night. But am I glad we did! So delicious!!!
author: Gaby H.

description: the whimsical pairings and combinations of food really work here. Box Kitchen has a mix of comfort and out-of-the-box going on for a reasonable price, so if you can push your comfort zone a little and come out with a big smile :)
author: Jennifer Y.

description: The food was okay here on a cold late night I should of told them well done on the burger but the fries were dope this was a one shot Johnny tho the bar next door to it looks cool tho!
author: Rolin S.

description:
Yum!

Grilled cheese, add tomatoes. Delish! Garlic parm fries; would ask for extra Parmesan in the future but freshly prepared and still decently warm by the time I got home.

Chicken and waffles, sooo good. Spicy with the kick of Sriracha is EVERYTHING. Syrup may have hints of honey, good batter used for waffle. Basically this is a popular selection and well worth your trials.

Ordered to go; dine in is a seat yourself inside the neighboring/attached dive bar. We were just hungry and not heavy drinkers but the bar was pulling a decent crowd as well.

Would return if in the area.
author: Reggi W.

description:
Food was really good. 
The box burger was delicious. The fries were cooked perfectly. - 5 stars 
Fried chicken sandwich- 4 stars 

There is no place to eat at dinner. The place is literally a hole In the wall, and it is not somewhere I would bring my kids. We didn't want to eat in the bar next door, just not our thing. So, we walked to the mall and ate in the food court. 

However, I would come back here to pick up some food to go as the food was worth the trip.
author: Tamara A.

description: This place was not as good as the ratings put it out to be. First of all the place is just a window, so the pictures are very misleading. Additionally, the food is very average, it's nothing special, but definitely not worth $13 for an artisan sized, but averaged tasing burger
author: Anmol J.
