description: The chicken sandwich was super tasty. My wife had the box burger and it was really good, as well. This is surprisingly gourmet food for 1:00 in the morning. Lots of flavors. Cool spot near most hotels.
author: Karson K.

description:
Great hole in the wall place. There's no seating so be prepared to either sit in the sidewalk or take it home. 

I tried the brussel sprouts, honey grilled cheese, nachos, and chocolate chip cookies. The brussel sprouts were spot on. I would definitely get these again. The honey grilled cheese was good with great bread and honey, but could've used a bit more filling (aka more cheese). The nachos tasted fresh, which is pretty rare, and were overall pretty solid. The cookies were ok, but nothing amazing. 

Overall, this place is solid, but a bit overpriced. I'd definitely go there again, but only when I'm not super hungry, and would only order one thing.
author: Kavita P.

description:
Came here for lunch with a friend just before noon on a Thursday and got a table right away. I can't remembering anyone having to wait. Food arrived within 10-15mins of ordering, and drink service was prompt.

By the numbers:
Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Ambiance: 5/5
Value: 5/5

We both ordered the Box Burger with fries, and it was excellent. Note: it's a dry burger, so if you like mayo/mustard, you'll need to ask. Despite this, the burger was very juicy and delicious. Nice bed of arugula, tomato, patty, and a sautéed onion/bacon relish on top. Fries were golden and seasoned well.
author: Navi O.

description: Short line but getting to the cashier takes forever. There was only 3 people in front of me but took more than 20 minutes that my friends and I just went to eat at the mall instead. The menu is pricy as well
author: Jonathan S.

description: High quality tasting burgers without the price tag! The only negative thing I will say is the location, it's literally an alleyway. My family had to eat at the curb because the inside is 21+ on the weekends, there were a lot of homeless people, drunks and a prostitute. I'll order it to go next time lmao
author: Analee M.

description: This place looks like a whole in the wall but their food was so yummy. I got the burger--great flavors and nicely cooked. My sister got the chicken sandwich which also had really nice flavors. The bar tender who served us was super welcoming and accommodating. Nice atmosphere and great staff!
author: Kaylynn C.

description:
It's a cool thing. 

Burger was amazing
Fries just so-so
Mac and Cheese Egg Rolls we're not good
The Tempest was a great little dive bar. 
Bartenders were top notch

Go. Experience. Enjoy.
author: Robby M.

description:
Let's get right down to business and discuss the food first:

The food is cooked to order and fresh ( your order won't be ready in 5 minutes and I don't mind waiting a little extra, as long as they cook it right). Fries are succulent, not soggy but not too crisp (must be a good potato choice), and the burger is nothing short of perfection. Zero complaints on food and service.

What an incredible find! Just note that I rarely give out 5 star reviews. In my opinion for a 5-star review to surface I need to see the following three requirements:

- stellar customer service or above and beyond patient staff

- exceptional food quality

- outstanding cleanliness 

While the overall experience was excellent, It's tough for Box Kitchen to get 5 out of 5 because of the way they have things set up.

First of all it's important to note that Box Kitchen is not a restaurant; it's a Kitchen. You order your food in an alleyway inlet. There is no place to sit, other than taking your food to the bar next door. Kind of a cool "speakeasy environment"; not complaining here, just explaining the process.

I think they'll attract a larger audience and get even better reviews (if that's the goal) if they change the dynamics and get a much larger space. But I feel flattered to be someone who knows about Box Kitchen and highly recommend to anyone who wants a high quality burger among other extremely tasty menu items.

Great job so far Box, you're on your way.
author: Brandon O.

description:
Pretty weird spot nestled up right next to Tempest. Menu is posted on the door and just about everything is a highlight on the Yelp. Just depends on your taste I guess. 

Ordered a good amount of food and enjoyed it all. Best thing to me was the Mac n Cheese egg rolls which come with some type of tomato soup dip but I asked for hot sauce and they happily obliged. Tapatio. Smackin. The Box burger was pretty good too. Bun was over toasted but didn't over shadow burger. Also order the Buttermilk Chicken Sando and that fried chicken was off the chain. Fried to perfection and the accompanying condiments on the Sando were on point. Also ordered the potato boats with the pork. Those things were good with a decent amount of Ranch on top. All the food was good.

No seats, tough parking, next to a bar, sketchy block and peeps around, long wait but worth it for a hole in the wall.
author: John M.

description: It is a creepy place! The music is creepy as well as decoration. Definitely not a family place!
author: Kasra M.

description: What a great little hole in the wall, literally a hole in the wall! This place had quality food, big portions, and great service. If you're in a rush I suggest calling ahead, but if you want to relax and grab a drink order your food and go next door to Tempest.
author: Bri D.

description: Their food was okay. Def. not worth the hype and the price. I like a nice place to sit and eat my expensive burger at and they don't have a place to sit. You have to go next door to Tempest Bar, which is super loud and not very clean. We asked the chef to cut our burger and sandwich and he was very rude. Won't be coming back!
author: Naghma A.

description:
Oh my god. I might've just been really drunk (thanks Tempest) or super hungry or both - but the Tempest 5.0 was so goooooooooood.

Egg, cheddar, fried kale and aioli all between an English muffin. Never really thought of putting kale in my breakfast sandwiches. Really want to start doing that now! It was all salted so perfectly. For $7-8 it's really not that bad. Your pricetag starts going up if you want sides like garlic fries and whatnot. STILL REALLY GOOD. I had a bite of the Box Burger which was equally as good. And I'm sure the rest of the menu is great too.

You really don't expect much from such a small hole in the wall, but it's awesome. You can take your items into the Tempest or even order from there (during the daytime? I'm not sure - I was there around 7/8pm and no service besides behind the bar).

Looking forward to trying more of the menu items! The chicken-in-waffles thing I keep seeing on Yelp better be around when I visit next!
author: Shanise M.

description:
This is my first time here at Box Kitchen. I looked it up here on Yelp and thought I should give it a try. 

The staff was very friendly. I got a chill vibe from the place and people working here. The alley is a bit sketchy, but it wasn't too far from the main street which was nice. It's near the University of the Pacific on 5th St. 

We ordered two Box Burgers, one Chicken & Waffles, and two orders of Garlic Fries. We waited 10-15 minutes for our food. Since there isn't anywhere to sit outside (the bar is 21+) we took our food to go. We ate it on our way home, & the food was delicious. The Box Burger was really good. I really enjoyed the honey smoked bacon (at least I think it was bacon lmao). The Garlic Fries were not too garlicky which was great. I took a bite out of my brother's Chicken & Waffles, and the waffles were alright. The chicken was really crispy and the maple syrup was really good. 

It was a bit pricy, but the food was great. One thing I would say is that you should specify how you want your meat, because I got medium rare (which I'm okay with that) and my mom got one with a big chunk of raw meat. However, the overall experience was great. Definitely worth trying!
author: Damaris H.

description: Walked a mile in the rain just to experience pure culinary projection on a paper plate. The choices change time to time but the potato skins with bacon fat and quail egg are heaven. The food made me say ho lee chit.
author: Mehal M.

description: If you're in the mood to pick up a great burger and fries and head out on a picnic or stroll along the coastal trail to Baker Beach, look no further!  Great burgers for to go service!!
author: Frank S.

description: Great dive bar food! The waffles from the chicken and waffle dish is cooked to perfection! Although the chicken was just a filet.. but still a chill place to hang out
author: Steffi M.

description:
My friend and I were planning on stopping by after a late night movie at the metreon but totally walked almost all the way home before we realized WAIT WE FORGOT THE POTATOES! And yes, we walked the five long downtown blocks in the freezing cold in the cutty alley way to box kitchen for the potato skins. And yes it was worth it. Who came up with the idea to put pork belly, greens, a fried quail egg, and crack sauce on a crispy potato skin? They did and they're geniuses.  Unfortunately that was all we tried because my friend wasn't that hungry and I didn't want to look like a fat ass. 

Tip: Grab a drink or two next door at Tempest while you're waiting for your food, they'll even let you bring it in to eat!
author: Linz C.

description: It's alright. The food prices seem to be kinda high for what they serve. It's nice that you can bring the food into the tempest which is next door. I had the buffalo wings which were interesting and my friends got the parmesan fries and the nachos. The nachos had chorizo on them and some stuff that made it taste okay, but it felt as if they were trying for more.
author: Kalani R.

description: This place is pretty good, however I would not say it is by any means stellar or anything special. I've been twice now and the food was definitely a lot better the first time around. Both times I've ordered the chicken & waffles. Let's start off with the pros: the waffles are delicious and the sriracha syrup is delicious! Cons: they really don't give you too much chicken, and it's a LOTTTT of dark meat. The line can also get pretty long, and be prepared for a minimum of 12-15 minute wait outside as they don't have seating for box kitchen, just next door for the tempest bar. Not bad if you're at Tempest, however I wouldn't say it's worth going out of your way for by any means. Another tip: very very very limited parking if you're coming on a car.
author: Sofie L.

description: From out of town and decided to try this based on the good reviews. Terrible decision. They ran out of chicken and waffles, the Mac and cheese bites weren't anything to write home about, the burgers are cooked medium rare and they don't tell you that beforehand. The people working there aren't the nicest either. You will be harassed by homeless people the entire time you're waiting in line, ordering your food, waiting for your food and after you get your food. I wouldn't recommend this place to even my worst enemy.
author: Bryan D.

description: Would not recommend this place. I'm from out of town and decided to try this based on reviews and the pictures. PICTURES ARE DECEIVING. The food is not served on a plate and it looks nothing like the pictures. They cook their burgers " medium rare" but they do not tell  you that. Its pretty raw and not edible. Don't go here at night unless you want to be harassed by drunk homeless people. To top it off the employees are far from friendly
author: Leah T.

description: Dive bar atmosphere with great food and prices. Good service and made friends with a few cool locals at the bar. A bit disppointed alot of the menu was unavailable but it was due to a recent fire which was out of their control. Just something to keep in mind if you wanted fried dishes like the chicken sando. I ordered the meatball sandwich with a caeser salad as my side and it was giant. The sandwich was delicious huge slabs of meatloaf topped with thick cut bacon, lots of melted cheese, crispy onion straws etc. The salad was light and flavordul especially for a side salad and a good pairing after the coma inducing meatloaf.
author: Sean G.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! You get high quality food you'd normally have to pay an arm and a leg for (and likely go to a fancy/pretentious sit down restaurant for) at a very affordable price and a really cool location. It's literally just a window in a wall (hole in the wall) but its right next to a bar where you can bring the food in to eat. As for the food itself, it's absolutely fantastic.
author: James A.

description: Chicken & Waffles were bomb af, would definitely get 2nds if it weren't for my financial situation . Definitely recommend!
author: Hieu T.

description: It was in a little back alley and you have to order from a bar called tempest. We got the box burger and buffalo chicken sando. The box burger was soooo juicy and great, highly recommend 5/5. The chicken sando was okay, 3/5 because it was a little dry. We got the Caesar salad side which was good and the garlic fries were delicious but a little too oily. Overall, 4/5 and we would definitely come here again to eat.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Best service ever. He referred me by my name once he found out what it was. 

I feel like he's my buddy. Like we can go hang out drink  whiskey together. Actually tequila cause I hear Mexican music.

Pastrami tacos and garlic fries are on point!!
author: Huy H.

description:
Box kitchen is a hole in the wall place, literally a hole in the wall. The place opens up to the street with a door that displays the menu, and a little window to place your order. It's right next to a bar called the Tempest which you can sit at if you don't feel like eating on the curb or taking your order to go. 

On the plus side, they do take both cash and card. I went with the box burger and some garlic fries on the side. The burger looked smallish, but looks were deceiving, and it actually filled me up when I had a pretty big appetite. The burger itself was very juicy, and also came with some bacon, lettuce, tomato, shallots, among other things.

We ended up eating inside at the Tempest and ordered a couple drinks. Not a bad place by any means at all. I really enjoyed the juicy meat, and the garlic fries were delicious!
author: Kenny L.

description: Got the burger with fries.  Fantastic burger!  Cooked exactly as I ordered (medium).  So many places ask you how you want it, but it always ends up well done.   Relaxed atmosphere with nice staff.  Will come again if I'm every in the area.
author: Michael O.

description: More divey/sports bar type of interior feel. Amazing food. I got the box burger, which was a classic great burger. Would definitely try that fried chicken next time.
author: Tim Q.

description:
The food is amazing. Box Kitchen is the definition of a hole in the wall spot and it does not disappoint. It's not your subpar burger or sandwich, it's top notch food served at a fair price. 

They do not provide seating but you can take your food to the bar next door and enjoy it there in a great atmosphere.
author: Tigran A.

description: Soooooo delicious. I got a fried chicken sandwich and I think about it all the time (visited SF back in May). The wait was a little long but worth it and there's a bar next door that you can chill at while waiting. The fries were so good too. Dying to go back!
author: Gia K.

description:
Great for late night snacks. Yummy and surprisingly affordable! Heaven!

Can greatly satisfy your cravings and definitely worth your money.
author: Althea C.

description: Hole in the wall place that can definitely satisfy your drunk cravings. I came here with my friends before we went bar hoping and we ordered the wings and the potato skins. It does take a while for your order to come out so feel free to walk around for a bit, or grab a beer next door to kill some time. The wings here are good - super crispy, but they are a bit underseasoned, and are on the greasy side. Also, no sauce on the wings, so buyers beware. The potato skins are loaded with toppings, and with 4 in one order, it is definitely satisfying. Similar to the wings, these skins were dripping with grease. Don't forget to grab a handful of napkins before you walk away from the food pick up window.
author: Austin W.

description: Decent food - tried the chicken and waffles etc. With a decent bar beside where you can bring your food in
author: Alfie L.

description: I also don't understand why this place has high ratings. I was visiting SF and stopped by and got the box burger. I started feeling nauseous a few hours later and needed to throw up. My stomach was hurting all night. I thought maybe it might have been just me but my friend got the same thing and felt the same way. The burger was huge and looked good but it wasn't amazing. Got ripped off, never again
author: Heidi R.

description: Really really wanted to eat a waffle around 11pm on a Friday so headed to Box Kitchen where my friend and I proceeded to split the best grilled cheese of my life (not a waffle but a good choice anyways). Thick whole grain bread + Brie and then the whole thing is drizzled in honey and cut into slices. So good!! We ordered from the little takeout window and then ate the grilled cheese while standing in an alley - maybe not the ideal environment but it's fine. The sandwich was about $9 so kind of expensive - so the price + the alley maybe makes this 4.5 stars instead of 5, but I'd definitely wander by again if I had the craving for late night food.
author: Hali M.

description:
The. Best. Burger. In. San. Francisco.

seriously not exaggerating. everything is good here. Prices are super fair and service is fast. Chicken Sando is good, the poutine on fridays is amazing. Love the Brussel sprouts. Fries are great. Seriously tho, best burger in SF.
author: Adam M.

description: Looove this place! Cool vibe drinks r cheap and food is yummy. It's connected to the place next door to it
author: Uriae W.

description:
I came here twice when I visited SF for a long weekend! The food is delicious and probably one of the best burgers I've had ever. 

The burger was very juicy and packed with flavor. I got the Box Burger and also tried the truffle fries (which were pretty good too). I wanted to come back to try other things, but the burger was just so good I just opted to get it again and again.

The service is super friendly and the wait isn't too bad!
author: Kevin L.

description: The box burger is really juicy and flavorful and the fries are bomb! I haven't had anything but the burger because it's always what I crave. The location is in a random alley way close to metreon but it's well worth a visit.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Got a burger and fries, and a bottle of water.  It took 30 minutes to get my order even though there were only about six people waiting.  Was rather disappointing-they made my fries plain even though I had asked for garlic, the top of my bun was overcooked and crunchy, and the burger and fries were barely warm-it's like it was sitting for a long time.
They also put a 3% surcharge on the prices per the bottom of the receipt (for employees "He"[sic) - I assume it's supposed to say healthcare.  But adding a surcharge which isn't mentioned ahead of time is shady, and doing the whole healthcare surcharge thing is douchy-just raise your prices!
Overall, I spent over $17 for a burger, fries, and a water.  They were barely warm, and I had to wait 30 minutes for them.  I doubt I'll be back.
author: Eric K.

description: Great food and great customer service.   Will be coming back for super delish late nights eats.
author: Faeza M.

description: Speaking only about the food, hands down one of the BEST burgers I've had in my entire life and I LOVE burgers. Great flavors, huge portions, never get my medium rare preparedness wrong. But okay those loaded potato skins are just completely out of this world. CHUNKS of fatty pork belly with the quail egg on top and that SAUCE is perfection. I have nothing to say about the location and service as everyone else has that covered.
author: Alison M.

description:
Was in San Fran for the weekend and was desperately searching for a good place to eat where I can actually park and walk up to order my food. Finally came across box kitchen and I must say, the FOOD IS OF THE CHAIN!!! The service is quick , walk up to the door/window order your food and in less than 20 mins I had my food. 
I had the buffalo chicken sandwich, it was amazing!!! I will DEFINITELY BE BACK when I'm in the bay ! Keep up the GREAT WORK box kitchen... 
WELL DESERVED 5 STARS IN MY OPINION
author: Jeff Z.

description:
Headed down on a Friday night. Was a bit surprised that this wasn't a sit down place. You literally place your order at a half door.

Anyways I wanted to try their chicken and waffles but was told they had run out. 

They had their menu posted all over the wall right next to where you order.

I decided to try their potato skins with pork belly and a quail egg for 11 dollars.

Order took about 10 minutes to make. I won't lie for 11 bucks I feel like I should have gotten more.  I ended up getting three potatoes skins each covered with a sunny side up quail egg on top of the pork belly.

Each potato skin was good for like 3-4 bites each, and I was super surprised at the flavors there.  It was not overly salty and you could taste all the ingredients meshing together to create a literal orgasm in your
mouth. The egg coupled with the sour cream and chives mixed with the delicious fat of the pork belly made me go mmmmm. 

This place is pretty close to Powell Bart station, I'll want to come back and try their chicken and waffles.
author: John U.

description: This place is amazing, Hamds down one of the best burgers I've ever had, Everything my girlfriend and I tried was great!!!! In fact the following morning before we left we went back... This is a must when in the city! You'll thank me later!!!!
author: John M.

description: Came here because of all the great reviews. Was under the impression it was a casual restaurant and that's my fault. This is a window on a sidewalk. Like a stationary food truck, but better. Had the brussel sprouts, chicken sandwich, and mac 'n cheese egg rolls. All solid, but sandwich was amazing. Not a huge fan of the bar next door even though you can eat your food there, but I think that's because I'm old and watered down beer ain't my thing.
author: Joanna R.

description: Ok wig! Literally the best chicken & waffles I've ever had! I must go back and try the burger and the fries! Seriously so good!
author: Andrew R.

description: The garlic fries were really good the only problem was its a walk and order kinda place there wasn't anywhere to sit
author: Mercedes R.

description:
By the time you've stumbled upon my review, you'd already figured out that Box Kitchen is a literal hole in the wall. They aren't joking. The kitchen is pretty much in a tiny box. Like a human-sized ant farm. A giant lego building. A lifesize replica of a miniature house. It's small, we get it! But just because it's small doesn't mean it's not ridiculously delicious. You know how the saying goes, "Sometimes great and beautiful things come out of tiny packages." That's a saying right?

Anyways, as the kids would say, "Box Kitchen is tight!" Do yourself a favor and get the Box Burger (4.5/5 $13). Surprise! It's not a box. It's not even a burger. It's everything and nothing all at once. It's pretty much as close to heaven you'll ever get. Possibly even made from the fabled, Okja. Make your day the best day possible with some Garlic Parm fries (4.5/5 $5), some potato skins (5/5 $10) and take your fortuitous booty over to Tempest for a seat and some $5 PBR/Jim Beam specials. What're you waiting for?! Get outta' here!
author: Brandon T.

description:
I have never held onto a bag of food and wanted to eat like a pig whilst walking as badly as the day I bought box kitchen. 

The box burger and the chicken sandwich were both bomb.com and I can say no more! 

We also ordered the potato skins and maaaan.... I'm just speechless.

The ultimate comfort food especially for after a night of drinking, which is convenient because it's located right next to tempest. 

Come early on weekend or game nights because there won't be any indoor seating left. (We ate in the car because stupid little ol' me forgot that there was a warriors game)
author: Karen B.

description:
I was actually blown away by the food from Box Kitchen. I ordered take out on the phone on a Saturday afternoon and they had it ready shortly after I arrived. They couldn't have been friendlier at the window and looking inside the kitchen you can see they are making fantastic creations. 

I ordered a Box Burger with Garlic Fries. The garlic fries were perfectly crisp with a garlic butter spread of sorts. Was not a strong or overwhelming garlicky flavor - the Fries as a singular dish would be a hit (I think they are alone somewhere on the menu). 

The headliner here was the Box Burger, though. Holy cow it may have been the best burger I've ever had (definitely top 3, I had a great kimchi burger in Chicago this summer and my mom's burgers have a soft spot in my heart). The bun is crispy on the edges from being toasted on the grill, the burger itself is tender and amazingly flavorful. I thought throughout the meal it couldn't be ground beef, and instead it was Michelin Star meat. The bacon cubes and onions on the burger make it irresistibly juicy and savory. I honestly cannot say enough about it. 

I will be back probably daily as I live in SF and I can't live without eating box burgers now that I've been exposed to what true happiness feels like. 

P.S. be ready to nap after this meal. It's so good it'll knock you out.
author: Jon N.

description: We were on our way home from the warriors game with a 10 year old and wanted burgers. We didn't leave Oakland until 10pm and wanted to find something that was good and still open. I read a lot of reviews about the wait at this place and the scary alley this place was on (next door to the bar) we took a cab there so when we hopped out and realized there was no seating for us (HOWEVER) the Bar next door will let you take your food in there , which I thought was pretty cool if yer out n about. Our box burgers were great , garlic parm fries  great. And the kid got spaghetti-os and meatballs. He said the meatballs were great too. Wait was 10 mins for the food, we ate outside in the cold. Well worth it.
author: Jeff N.

description:
as everyone has mentioned definite hole in the wall and seemed like a beloved club for those fiending for drunchies and munchies. The entire menu looked amazing and I wish I could have eaten it all! We ordered mac and cheese egg rolls, a box burger and the fried chicken banh mi. To our great surprise and relief they accept card and although the wait was a little long we didnt mind with tempest being right next door. We walked in to grab a drink and everyone was just so nice and friendly! 

Unfortunately they messed up my order and therefore over charged me but I wasn't even that mad because the egg rolls and banh mi were so good! I will definitely be back to try some more of their specials and this might just be my new favorite local spot!
author: Rachel N.

description: This restaurant is situated in the middle of tenderloin and is NOT sit down, despite what some pictures suggest. It's actually a booth that you can order from. The food was good, but my friend and I didn't feel comfortable in the environment.
author: Catherine W.

description:
Had the chicken n waffles
And the burger and fries
Been craving the chicken n waffles ever since
Portions on chicken n waffles are not that big but filling enough for one and it's a chicken breast not the normal staple but... it's done right 
The burger was huge but yet I finished it and I don't even normally finish an in n out meal so yeah 
Yelp my people got this one right plane Ole good food done right
author: Mia P.

description:
I love love love Box Kitchen and Tempest! 

I've brought several friends here for food and beers. It's great to order food and sit in Tempest with a beer and great company. 

I've tried several things here. Here's what I think so far:

-Pastrami Tacos: the BEST! My favorite thing on this menu. Pastrami is juicy and the balance of flavors and textures is wonderful. 
-Chicken Sando: Very good, hearty sandwich. Messy to eat, but pretty great when you are super hungry. 
-Potato Skins: some days are better than others, but these are creamy and tasty. Best potato skins I've ever had.
-Elote: Spicy and flavorful! It makes a great side to share and it's addicting to eat. 
-Box Burger: Flavorful, but much too heavy for my appetite. 

I can't wait to come back here!
author: Sofia R.

description:
This spot is literally a windows next to the Tempest Dive bar. Came here after we saw Hamilton to grab a bite and maybe grab some drinks. Price point wise, it is a bit on the higher side with an entree clocking in around $12-14 bucks depending on what you get. You can get some more finger food items like fries at around $6-8 price point.

Food takes awhile to cook but from the dishes I had here, they are definitely worth it. Fries are crispy and done right. Burgers are juicy and hits the spot. The sammie that knocked it out of the park though was the pastrami. It quite literally hit the spot. And was one of the better tasty pastrami from a location I would not expect. There are no tables so you just kind of eat there on the sidewalk with the other patrons munching away their alochol infused breaths. 

The area at night is pretty dark and a dash of sketchy but don't let that frighten you off this gem.
author: Andy L.

description:
WOW, OMG this place is the bomb. The best burger  I have ever had. We had the box burger and fries. A nice twist with fried shallots and baby spinach and a fresh ripe tomato.  Fries were great, "cooked  and seasoned  perfectly. 
I highly recommend this  restaurant!  The wait maybe long, but it is well worth it. Next time  I am in SF will be defiantly  be back.
author: Don A.

description: Yum yum yum...went in on a Friday.lunch. Food came out.fast and.so.delicious; hit.the spot amd prices were fair.  I.do.not drink beer but I'd.go back.for.the food alone. The west coast hip hop music playing was awesome too. The place was full of customers and friendly employees too.
author: C N.

description:
Solid hole-in-the-wall. The food here tend to be on the heavier side but also with more complex flavors than you'd expect.

I am personally a big fan of their fried chicken sandwiches. The chicken is tender and juicy, encrusted in a batter resembling a cornmeal plus crushed corn flakes. The batter ends up giving a lot of nice texture. The lettuce slaw they use on the sandwich pairs pretty well. It has just the slightest hint of tang from the blue cheese that offsets the oiliness of the chicken quite well.

I usually also get the potato skins - these are baked potato skins with pork belly, green onion, sour cream, and a sunny-side-up quail egg. Also on the heavier side but a great choice for the gluttonous days.

I imagine it'd be hard to find something here that is a complete miss. It's sort of my go-to when I don't have strong cravings and also don't want to exert energy/time into thinking up a new place to it. It doesn't disappoint.
author: Chia L.

description: Really great environment for lunch with friends. Highly recommend any of their burgers!
author: Alexandra E.

description: Great late night food! Burgers is a must try and the potato wedges...YUM
author: Jayneen P.

description:
Love this hole in the wall, literally. You can also eat in the bar nextdoor with the food you order here, but my boyfriend and I were staying in a hotel nearby so we bought a bunch of dishes back to try. It was $61 with tips for 5 dishes and 2 water bottles. The portions are filling and pretty generous.

- Brussels sprouts: perfect crispiness of each leaf on the sprout and right amount of vinaigrette.
- garlic Parmesan fries: the thinner fries that I like more than others and isn't overpowered with cheese or garlic. Crispy stayed even with our walk back to the hotel. 
- elote: I have a strong love for corn, but this one was delicious and definitely satisfied my cravings for elote. It had the perfect amount of spicy that I could endure and the corn was sweet!
- Baja fish tacos: my boyfriend got three of these and it was large enough to be filling without the other stuff we ordered. The fish stayed crispy with all its topping that didn't make it soggy. 
- chicken and waffles: perfect amount of batter on the fried chicken that wasn't too thick with juicy chicken inside. Usually chicken is overcooked but this one was perfect. The waffles were a yummy and perfect fluffiness with siracha dipping sauce. Initially wasn't a fan of that weird spice to the syrup, but I kept eating it with my waffles bite after bite. Definitely grew on me.

Would love to return and recommend!
author: Amanda C.

description: This place is a recommended night spot! The unique food choices are good, loving the combinations on their menu. It also comes an affordable price, you could surely satisfy your cravings from this place. The place could be quite small but the food makes the place worth the trip.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
One of the greatest hole in the walls in San Francisco.
- Great food made with quality ingredients 
- Fast service & chill staff
- Bar right next door for beer too
- Would sell a limb for their sandwiches
author: Vu D.

description: This place is honestly overpriced and just mediocre in a sense. The cashier was a bit rude for no apparent reason (hence why I took an additional star off). The burgers were pretty good, just a bit undercooked. Also the waffles were not what I was expecting with an almost spicy kick to it. The fried chicken was juicy but nothing special.
author: Lo H.

description: Nice little kitchen off to the side of the Tempest. Workers are always nice and I never wait too long for my food either. Nice n hot. My fav is the buffalo chicken nuggets. Deep fried chicken chunks with whichever sauce you pick between on it and a little bit of ranch with some shredded carrots and celery on top. It's soooo good and their fries are on HIIIT. 10/10 would recommend to a friend especially if you're at the tempest n got drunk munchies. Their Mac n cheese egg rolls are surprisingly good. Very cheesy and all. ALSO once you order you can sit inside of tempest since this establishment isn't really a restaurant more a side order kitchen.
author: Ashley K.

description: I had the mushroom veggie burger and garlic fries. It was out of this world! The tempest bar has a pool table also. It just great to sit down and have a beer. It is open from 1950's. I think its one of the best bar food in the city.
author: Amy R.

description: Great burger and I like the laid back atmosphere. Service was very good too. I'm definitely coming back.
author: K W.

description:
Two words. 

Potato Skins. 

Get 'em. 

It's seriously the best thing I ate on my trip to San Francisco. The quail egg served on top of tender juicy pork belly. It was like a bomb in your mouth. 

The vendor recommended the Box Burger, it was pretty good but not amazing. It's no where near as amazing as the Potato Skins. The Box Burger is served with bacon so that's a bonus.

There's no seating because it's a little take out window, but a lot of people would bring the food into the bar next door. Great place for bar food or drunchies.
author: Virginia Y.

description: This place isn't really a restaurant, it's more of a permanent food stand in a sketchy alley way. I love it though because their food is consistently great. Their menu changes every few months as they're always adding new inventions. Most of the menu is bar food with a bohemian spin - but everything is really good. E.g. potato skins w/ pork belly, quail egg, and Gouda.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is going to be a very short review.

Box Kitchen is literally a hole of the wall.
It's located in South Market section of San Francisco.
Imagine a food truck, but there's no truck.

My wife and I wanted to go somewhere different but not too far from hotel we were staying at. We found this place in Yelp.

The neighborhood is a little scary, especially at dusk.
No other establishments except the bar next door.
Anyway..you order your food from a guy at the opening.
I think the guy is over it with his position. Let's just say his customer service skills could use a touch up.

There is no place to sit. If you want to eat "there", you have to go the bar. There is no guarantee there is a season available. There wasn't when went, so we walked back to the hotel. Next time I go, I will order a to-go box.

For a first timer like me, this process was very frustrating.
But the burger made up for it. It was awesome.

I'm not sure if I will come here again, but I better look in the bar for a place to sit if I decide to eat out.

Or at least stay in a hotel close by.

Ok..the review wasn't THAT short.
author: Darryl L.

description: Best burgers n garlic fries ever!! So fucking tasty...but remember that their default is to serve a grilled burger medium! So if you like it well done be sure to request it! I do think this is my favorite burger joint.
author: D M.

description:
SoMa's hidden gem for comfort food!

5 stars for the food: Chicken and waffles, potato skins with pork belly and fries egg, and a burger with fries all excellent and worth coming back for.

4 stars for the service: In the bar great service. Dive bar with friendly enough people; everyone seemed welcome.

3 stars for the location: There's no way to avoid it, you'll have to walk down an alley to get there. The usual shady characters,  and nighttime residents around to greet you on your walk there. As great as the food is, and as friendly as everyone is. At night I would have second thoughts of going there, and definitely wouldn't go if I was solo
author: Neil X.

description: Great for late night. This place is small, but what they cook is amazing in taste and appearance. Service is also excellent. I recommend.
author: Darren C.

description:
My boyfriend always described this place as a "hole in the wall" and he was not joking. Box Kitchen is literally a counter where you order food and pick it up. There's no "inside" of this place except for those who work there. Great grab and go spot, especially with Tempest next door. Well, they ARE related. It's common to order food at Box Kitchen, find seating in Tempest, and drink beer while waiting.

The first time I visited, I got the Box Burger and Garlic Fries. So good! I was impressed by freshness of the fries, and even more so by the burger. The use of a potato bun was most memorable! There are tons of other delicious-sounding items on the menu, including pastrami tacos, fried cheese sticks, and elote. It's rare to find an overall bomb menu where I feel determined to try everything at least once. 

The partnership between Box Kitchen and Tempest is perfect. You can order food at Box Kitchen to take home or dine at Tempest without fighting the dive bar crowd to eat. I also love that Box Kitchen is open late and tastes amazing whether you're drunk or sober! I'll definitely be coming back more often. Excellent service, too.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Savory, reasonably priced food to go. Either to the bar next door or off on your adventure.
author: Kevin H.

description:
The guy who handled my dolla bills was the same guy who packed my burger in the box. I know because I watched him with no hand washing in between. 

Not worth it.
author: Belle X.

description: When we arrived at this location we realized the restaurant is actually a window next door to a bumping bar. They had a menu that could feed anyone's cravings, drunk or sober. And when my friend and I ordered at the window the man helping us was beyond personable and friendly. We took our food back to eat at our apartment and boy was it yummy! We had the croquettes, a big batch of truffles fries to share and two hamburgers. I'd definitely recommend this place to a friend!
author: Alex A.

description:
Found it on Yelp!

I got off work late and my friend and I wanted to get some American comfort food late night. Look it up on yelp and found this name with good reviews. 

Yes, it is literally a window on the street but omg the food is amaze-balls! 
I didn't want to eat much and the food is heavy handed, so I went for the corndogs. The garlic aioli was amazing and I don't like garlic. 
Now my friend ordered the pastrami sandwich and it was smashing. I don't like the salty lunchmeats but this sandwich was ridiculous. The flavors inside were perfect with the meat and the toasted dutch crunch roll was perfection. I can't wait to go try something else off of the menu, I'm going to try the chicken sandwich.
author: Reyna O.

description: Best service and best burger I have ever had! Definitely recommend stopping by even if it is just for food! Definely going back.
author: Jessica V.

description: This is a great late night spot. They're only open from 4:20pm to 1a.m. and the food is made to order so take a few minutes to get but well worth the wait.
author: Jesse M.

description:
Bomb ass burger. My girlfriend ate all of it  even though she doesn't like hamburgers.
 It was my first time there and won't be my last.
author: Rogelio B.

description: Fun vibe. You order a bunch of food from the window facing the alley, then take the food over to the bar next door. The food was good, but very heavy.
author: Margaret R.

description: Oh.....my......gods....... my tastebuds didn't just dance they danced until they dropped! I mean honestly I have no words for my meal. Delicious just doesn't cover it! I happened to be in the city late with an appetite that was starting to take over, and good ol' YELP to the rescue. Among the other options in the area the Box Kitchen just called my name. When I arrived I was a little confused I made a wrong turn, but upon further inspection I was in the right place. The garlic that was getting heavier just lead my way to this door designed with their menu and inside the brilliant chefs hard at work! I decided to order the quinoa mushroom burger and you're damn right I got the garlic fries as well! But friends, I'm telling you right now AMAZING! I was slightly ashamed of myself as I shoveled the delectable morsels into my gullet. That shame left me quickly as the flavors seeped onto my tastebuds. Get used to this mug people of the Box Kitchen, you will be seeing plenty of it.
author: Moon S.

description:
Personally I felt this place was a bit too slow  and too expensive for how fast food their food tasted - and ultimately not that unique. 

One good thing is that there is a bar right next door so it can work out if you are willing to sit down and get some drinks while you wait.
author: Dana N.

description: A dream has never brought me so much pleasure by coming true than when I was drunk and hungry late at night, and right around the corner from the apartment is Box Kitchen with FRIED CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. Nothing soaks up the night out like some crispy and moist fried chicken with a touch of sweet and spicy Sriracha syrup. Yes. You read that correctly. They have Sriracha syrup. It completed the chicken so well by having two flavors which compliment the saltiness of the meat. Salty and sweet with some spice to the meat! And do not despair that it is only something that works for the chicken, because that syrup also tastes beautiful with the fluffy and tender waffles. Whether you drizzled it on or dunked the waffle in, you were coating your fingers with the sweet evidence that you just completed your night with a savory delight. Do not miss out on the Box Kitchen chicken and waffles. I will be back to make a dream come true again soon.
author: Kai C.

description: We headed into the Bay Area for the SC v Stanford Championship game. So, this was another time when we arrived late to our hotel and did not  want room service. We read the great reviews, then followed Google maps taking us through dark streeets and alleyways of SF to Box Kitchen. It was so late they were out of Chicken & Waffles, so we ordered the falafel patty melt, their parm fries and a pastrami sandwich. While waiting we were chatted up by friendly students from a local college waiting for their orders. They gave us recommendations for brunch in the area. Once our food was ready, we saw the Tempest bar was packed, so we headed back to our hotel room and enjoyed our meals. The experience/adventure was actually more enjoyable than the items on the chalkboard menu. Next visit, we plan to make it early enough to try the chicken & waffles.
author: S M.

description:
Five stars! Kind of locals only type of place was filled with SF Giants fans the night I was there. This review is for both Box Kitchen and Tempest Bar they're both connected and are probably one of the best dive bar/underground food joints in San Francisco.

The Tempest Bar is where some of the bartenders from other establishments come to get there drink after hours, at least that's who I was drinking with it's a combination of artsy SoMa dive bar coolness.

The food at the Box Kitchen is off the hook it's a stand/walk up window in the alley next to the bar. The food is always a 12 minute wait so go next door and order a beer or two while you wait then bring the food inside. 

I got the Fried Caesar Sando with Elote (corn off the cob) and god that was some good grub! Wish I would have tried the Pastrami Taco's too, go there for $3.00 budweiser's and some five star bar food!
author: Mark C.

description: We ordered the Brussels sprouts, fried avocado tacos and the Mac n cheese egg rolls. Wow! Yummy! Our favorite by far was the Brussels sprouts. What a hidden gem!!
author: Andrea R.

description: I was a bit confused at first, as Box Kitchen is in what looked to be an abandoned alley...and is literally hole in the wall with no dining. But, initial confusion aside, the food was great!. You can take your food into Tempest bar which is just next door to eat and drink.
author: Josh M.

description:
Came to tempest on a Saturday night. Was a little but hungry so checked out box kitchen to the side. I had the best customer service, everyone working in the kitchen were the best. Shout out to Carlos!!!! He was amazing and really made sure our complicated order satisfied our needs.

Best bar food within the area! Thanks Carlos for making it feel like a 5 star restaurant!
author: Brittany A.

description: I love the restaurant the bread is so good in the salads in the food was nice and fresh the service wasn't bad either.
author: Charlotte S.

description: Best place to get food if you're in SOMA with the drunchies! Their Box Burger, garlic fries, and potato skins are all on point. This is definitely a grab-and-go kind of place as you literally order through a window, but the food is so good. Highly recommend.
author: Trisha V.

description:
On our way to watch a concert, some friends and I decided to stop at a joint in an alley called Box Kitchen. It was recommend we go there as a super small spot that packs a lot of flavor. I was excited. 

It's true, this place is literally a stand. You have the kitchen and then an ordering table and that's it. Plan on eating along the sidewalk OR you can go to Tempest, a bar next door and eat there (but have the courtesy of buying a drink from Tempest). I love how their menu is written on metal panels and that their kitchen seems clean! That's about all I can talk about when it comes to the place so here's what I had: 

-Box Burger for $9 and added fries for an extra $2. Ground chuck burger, bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, lettuce, tomato, crispy shallots on a potato bun. WOW, lots of flavor. This burger was on point. I've had a few burgers in my days but this definitely stuck out to me. I loved that they decided to add crispy shallots, lot the different textures. The lettuce they used was arugula so I also got the spiciness in my overall flavor. WOW, this was definitely a crowd pleaser and I highly recommend it! 

Turn down Natoma alley and look for this joint! If you're fortunate enough to find it, you'll really love their food. Simple menu, friend staff and their food is the epitome of flavortown!
author: Rockne H.

description:
Box Kitchen exists in two forms. At Lunch it is operating in Tempest Bar. Late night it is a Dutch door next to Tempest Bar, offering food to go (and eat in Tempest if you wish).

I was staying on Market and Cyril Magnin and there was much to have late night in the area. Luckily I found this. It really is "Bar food" but at a whole other level. Burger--Amazing. Juicy and cheesy with a host of unusual extras "ground schmitz ranch chuck, bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, arugula, spinach, tomato, crispy shallot rings, potato pepper bun". Not what you'd expect from a burger joint or a bar. $2 extra gives you fries. I also ordered the Brussels Sprouts which were charred and yummy. "sesame seeds, chili lemongrass vinaigrette"

Drawbacks, if you aren't going ionto the bar, no where to sit. You are waiting out on the street, which is cool, but it is SF and the weather can be whatever. Also it is south of martket, near the Tenderloin, so the homeless are definitely around, but so to are the hipsters.
author: Jordan P.

description: Falafel patty melt was great, everything else looked really good so I'll be back. Only downside is that there isn't really anywhere to sit unless you want to go in the bar next door.
author: Leo A.

description: They recently changed the menu, so some of the good pics that you see posted weren't available the day I went. The meatloaf sandwich was presented well, but nothing really to write home about. Probably a better late night food spot.
author: Rob R.

description:
I don't have a picture of my food because I ate it all. 

Box Kitchen is literally a "hole in the wall". It's a walk up window where you place your order and receive your food. You can sit down at the bar next door if you want. Or like me, eat it standing around while waiting for your friends to get their food. You'll probably finish it by then any ways. 

I got the Box Burger with no bun, except I got the bun, just didn't eat it. It was decent, I should have asked for mustard, though. The greens and tomatoes were super fresh. I also ordered fries which I only ate a couple of because by then I was already full so I gave them away to other hungry peeps. 

Almost every one of my friends got the potato skins, which are highly raved about. They smelled really good, maybe next time. 

I love they have a couple vegetarian options, everyone gets to eat happy.
author: Shereen A.

description: Came across this spot while in town for Super Bowl Sunday. The food was delicious (mac and cheese egg rolls and pork belly potato skins were great). So we ordered and then got a table next door at Tempest which was perfect for the game and a few beers.
author: Max K.

description:
At the end of a dark alley ridden with homeless people and hidden within a wall of graffiti, you will find this gem. The diamond of street food. BOX KITCHEN.

Im utterly speechless. I ordered the potato skins, elote, box burger, and French fries and every single dish was so unique and delicious.

Potato skins: Their house sour cream combined with a tiny egg and pulled pork just gave the entire potato a huge burst of flavor. 

Elote: I've never had something like this before and man...the juiciness of the corn combined with the tanginess of the cheese and cilantro was such a delight. Once I took a bite, I found myself going back for more.

Box burger: I have never had a burger so juicy before. The beef was thick but it just melted the second you take a bite. Even further, the bread was soft and wasn't dry at all.

The environment might not be for everybody but it's totally worth the search. This is the best street food I have had this year!
author: David H.

description: Heard a lot of goods things about this place and was staying within walking distance so tried it out.  Went around 10pm on a Tuesday and there were a half dozen other people waiting.  Yes it's a hole in the wall in an alley but at no point did I feel unsafe.  Unfortunately their menu was missing most of the things i wanted to try like their burger, garlic fries or chicken and waffles.  So i ordered the braised pork sandwich which was good but not amazing.  I'll be back again to try their other items though.
author: Robert C.

description:
I originally thought that this place tasted good only because I had previously chugged down a beer at Tempest before ordering, but turns out, this place just makes really great food in general! 

It's a cute literal box kitchen to the right of Tempest Bar and they serve great bar snacks and appetizers like garlic fries, elote and potato skins topped with eggs and bacon. *Drools*. On top of that, they have a delicious fried chicken sandwich and their burgers are just perfect to satisfy those cravings. 

The cashier was super nice and friendly, which made me like this place even more. Definitely is a spot that I'll be visiting very soon.
author: Nancy L.

description: Legit burger (and other stuff on the menus swell, quality ingredients, but pretty pricey, no where to sit and eat if you show up in the evening. During the day you can eat your food in the bar next door.
author: Kaveh M.

description: I make this simple. The food is good but the burger I got just needed more sauce burger was 7.5/10
author: Alex Xander P.

description:
Absolutely delivers with great taste and quality ingredients. We're staying in a hotel nearby and my teen daughter wanted a burger. I refused to go to a chain or themed tourist nightmare place and yelp turned up Box Kitchen tucked away on a side street only a block away. FABULOUS. Far better than I ever expected when I agreed to find her a burger. 

Service with a genuine smile and tasty food - perfect. Excellent meat cooked to order topped with fresh tomato, mixed greens, grilled onions, cheese all enclosed in a quality bun that held up to the juicy burger, crisp fries and an unexpected seasonal fresh corn in a spicy sauce that had great depth of flavor. I loved the corn! 

As noted in other reviews, it's only a window next to a busy bar, so if eating at the bar doesn't work for you, be prepared to carry away. I'm giving them 5 stars because this place is as good as a take-away window can be and offers a great local food experience. 

I should mention that this is completely out of the tourist zone. A block away can be a different world in cities and this area is the real SOMA (ca. 2016). My suburban child was uncertain about the street vibe, but she got more comfortable as we waited for our food with the friendly crowd (didn't hurt that the Golden State Warriors were winning). We certainly stuck out - us 14 and 50 surrounded by millennials - but good food unites.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Coming from Vegas where everything is open late (as late as 3am or later), you grow accustom to a certain expectation of convenience. While on vacation here in SF, it's always difficult for me to plan my preferred eating times around the waking hours of SF. I have a bad tendency to skip breakfast but, snack for lunch in the late afternoon, therefore looking for something to eat for dinner around 10-11pm. You can imagine my struggle whenever I'm on vacation and food places close anywhere from 6pm to 9pm. So, when I yelped for an affordable, quick bite, open passed the hours of 10pm, I was delighted to see such a well-rated joint - Box Kitchen.

From where I was (the Westfield mall), the walk wasn't bad at all. However, I did question the area of Box Kitchen the closer I got to it. Turn down an alleyway that isn't the best lit, with not a lot of people around, great. I judged a book by its cover, sadly, but never again. 

I ordered the Turkey sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the Bolito Misto. While I was expecting a basic turkey sandwich with not a lot of flavor to it, I was proven wrong. The turkey meat was carved and not reminiscent of your average deli meat at all. The aioli sauce on top of that... to die for! But don't let me forget the Bolito Misto. While I didn't get to enjoy the sandwich as a whole, my boyfriend was kind enough to let me try a slice of the meat and it was delectable. Small, but packed full of flavor and the aroma of the sandwich itself made it an even better experience.

Don't skip the Box Kitchen like I almost did just because it's in a sort of inconvenient place. This place is well worth the price, experience, and the service was quick.

***NOTE: If you are driving, there is a small parking lot directly in front of/across from Box Kitchen. However, it is $15 to park there.***
author: Kay E.

description: Really simple window ordering to-go only and the food hits the spot perfectly. Best late at night. Chicken sandwich was amazing, burger also really good. Highly recommend.
author: Kevin C.

description: Spent a week in San Fran, going out to eat for every meal of the day. This is by far the best place !! Also was the cheapest I have spent. If in San Fran I would 100% go and eat here. Cool vibes cool music cool workers. The food was amazing . Next time I'm in San Fran this will be the first place I go to. Shoutout to this place!
author: Chris F.

description: I usually would eat Asian food late night,  but I was craving America can food.  I heard about this place so I drove all the way across the city to try this.  Totally worth it.  I'll come back soon too try everything on the menu.  I'm sure its all good.  And you can bring your food into the bar next door and drink good beer with your awesome food.
author: Dan B.

description: Was satisfied with the box burger. Can't tell if being drunk and not eating all day helped but this burger was delicious. The fries were fries. Open relatively late seeing as how most places with this quality are closed by 1am.
author: Anoymous T.

description: OK but I really did not like that there was no where we could sit down. There is a pretty ugly bar next door but it's not very nice
author: Alfonso T.

description:
Solid late night food.

Potato skins with eggs and pork belly was quite good.
author: Sarah S.

description:
FOOD:
I LOVE the macaroni cheese balls!! They are so delicious! The Box Burger is also really good but sometimes the burger is a little too pink inside. Just ask for a little more cooked burger.

SERVICE:
Really nice people!

TIPS: 
Tip well and they will make your order first! Line can get long. OPEN LATE!

WOULD I RECOMMEND IT? YES!
author: Kelley Y.

description:
Unfortunately I just received really bad food poisoning from the food here, as my stomach was really upset throughout the night, on top of other food poisoning symptoms. 

I've really liked their burgers, but last night (on Tuesday, March 14th) I decided to try their wings, which were the source of the food poisoning. Looking into the ordering window of their kitchen, I could definitely imagine how the quality control could be lacking. Needless to say, I won't be returning here again.
author: Cliff H.

description: Delicious grilled cheese, pastrami sandwich, and potato salad! We ordered food at Box kitchen and took it over to Tempest. This place is open late and so good! The grilled cheese had honey drizzled on it.
author: Jessie V.

description:
You're staying in a nearby hotel for a work conference. You just got back from the open-bar event and are debating ordering room service or just snacking from the minibar. RESIST! Walk the two and a half blocks to Box Kitchen and order something. Trust me, you'll be happier at the end of the night.

Now, I've only had two items: The meatloaf sammy and their life changing brown butter rice crispy treat. But based off the quality of these food stuffs I'm willing to bet that more often than not you'll be wholly satisfied, even if they're out of something you were really craving. 

Seriously, I didn't even put ketchup on my sandwich. Ketchup goes on EVERY MEATLOAF. My Mom's, my Grandma's, and my Girlfriend's. Now I mean, it's not like I had any ketchup, and in all honesty I would have added some had it been available. However, I legitimately didn't need it. It was juicy enough to withstand the fairly thick bun and didn't fall apart at the first bite. It was also the perfect size (and the perfect size to pair with a desert or side option).

The brown butter rice crispy treat is a lie. It's more like a rice crispy pie with a buttery crust on the bottom and marshmallows on top. I only finished half, but it was a great half.

I'm rather disappointed that Box no longer makes burgers. I won't knock them for it cause that's not really a food or quality issue. But the pics I saw all over and the menu on the pourguys website really got me in the mood for a burger, especially because so many Yelp reviews mention it being dank.

Still, this is a great option. I can't wait to try something else from Box tomorrow.
author: Max A.

description:
The Box. This place...

I'll go out there and say it. The Box Burger is one of the most underrated burgers in San Francisco. It's a well-kept secret, but it has a cultish following, myself included.

Honorable mention: the chicken sando. A chicken sandwich is typically nothing to write home about. Restaurants have the burger, and then the chicken sandwich is an afterthought. Not at the Box. By far the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Better than most burgers. Who the heck puts slaw on a chicken sandwich? A genius. That's who.

Also of notable fame: the garlic fries. Best enjoyed drunk.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Got Dive?  Well... this place meets the bill for a quick escape during lunch hour.  And they have a full bar at the Tempest with lots of interesting beers on tap.  I was attending RSA this year and Yelped a good burger place, and the Box Kitchen showed me the way. And my Yelp peeps did not disappoint.  The menu is pretty limited, but the burger is what you want.  It is quite good as others have mentioned, as well as the fries... what a fulfilling lunch and definitely worth the caloric splurge in my opinion.  

I do want to make it back to the Tempest some day for some pre-game drinks as it looks like a really cool hangout.
author: Dan M.

description:
I've been in this area many times for conventions, but dam, I missed out hardcore on all the times I could have eaten here. After a long day of walking the Moscone, it was time for redemption. The stomach had to be filled and the vision had to get foggy. This corner is sketchy as f but be courageous and brave, and you'll be treated to the most unpretentious night of shenanigans. The Box Kitchen deal comes as a 2fer: good greasy food at Box Kitchen, followed by 5 dollar handles of beer. There's no losing here unless you hate having fun. Also, take your food into the Tempest bar next door, yes, it's allowed.

-=-Tempest Burger-=- omg no meat, omg no patty, OMG NO MEAT. WTF. Yeah, I made a grave mistake, and people should reallyy stop using the word burger when there's no meaty goodness inside. Out came......an egg sandwich when I thought I was gonna have egg on my meat. Here's the deal though: if you like eggs benedict and don't feel like meat, you'll love this egg sandwich. It's not as big and filling as the Box Burger, but I still found it delicious.

-=-Garlic Fries-=- Greasy, GOOD. Easily my favorite part of this meal. It's like a combo discount to get this with a sandwich like a few bucks or something. Fries are skinny cut and not a layer of potato was untouched by that garlic oil layer. You'll love it, and you'll always have to get it.
author: JR C.

description: Amazing food!! I tried the Mac n' Cheese Egg Rolls and they were so good! Such an unusual combination but so packed with flavor and so delicious! I also tried the Buffalo Nuggets and they were so good too! I will definitely be back at this spot!
author: Edith G.

description:
I've read a few reviews that Box Kitchen is a great place for the "munchies" so I was skeptic if I would enjoy it sober.

No seating so I definitely recommend going next door to Tempest (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tempest-san-francisco), the dive bar with your food and to get a couple of beers! Great spot to catch a sports game with a few TVs.

After reading the reviews I decided to try the top 3 most popular items:
- Chicken in Waffle with sriracha syrup sauce ($8): I was obsessed with the sriracha syrup! I wonder if I can replicate this at home? Small pieces of chicken are literally in the waffle. I was a little annoyed how small this was at first but after the first bite, everything felt forgiven. 
- Potato skins with pork belly and quail egg ($10): The epitome of cheat day with this order, sometimes you just got to live! Definitely food porn worthy of Instagram. A bit too salty for me though.
- Box Burger ($9): Great burger but I don't think it was too memorable that I would get it again.

My sober verdict....probably would only come back for the Chicken in Waffles. The guys that work here are super friendly though!
author: Kathy L.

description:
Box Kitchen is located in a rather shabby alley, right next to Tempest bar. But they serve some bomb food. I got the food to-go, and I had a bit of a walk home after stopping by target so I might not have gotten the best flavor of it though.
The potato skins ($10) that everyone is raving about is pretty damn good. pretty damn fatty, too. It's sort of a mini heartattack in one that is totally worth having to go to the gym for a few hours. 
The chicken and waffles ($10) had a bit of a spice to it, which was amazing. The chicken that you get is not very much though sadly ): 
No seating. They serve fries, burgers, sandwiches, gyros, chicken and waffles, salads and errthang. 
Lots of things take about 15-20 minutes, so you know it's not just frozen food.. but the wait is a bit of a downer. But during the time, you can check out tempest bar, which also has cheap drinks and a lively environment.
author: Grace P.

description: My best friend and I were so lucky to stumble upon this gem right as it opened and got to skip the long wait! The food was outstanding, it even managed to stay warm for the entire 20 minute drive home! Unfortunately the only down side to our experience was the service we received from the cashier worker. She was very unfriendly and quite rude. But a solid 10/10 for the food!
author: Julissa S.

description: The best burger I have ever had with some potato skins that blow your mind and taste buds
author: Jose U.

description:
TWO RECOS I AM IN LOVE WITH:
1.) quail egg potato skins! so delicious, and first time I had thing I'm pretty sure my heart skipped a beat. (probably also from al the damn grease on them!) perfect for sharing as an appetizer 
2.) gyro-- spent a summer studying abroad in Greece and while not necessarily comparable DEFINITELY GETS THE JOB DONE and incredibly filling. 

enjoy this hidden gem!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Box Kitchen is literally just that - a hole-in-the-wall kitchen that serves sandwiches, salads and other bites. Making it just a little harder to find, Box Kitchen Box Kitchen doesn't get the sign above the door. Rather, the space belongs to Tempest Bar, a dive bar with an adjacent kitchen. You order from the sidewalk through a window in a door, then you pick up your grub and either eat it in the pub or in the sidewalk or take it home.

What to devour:
Box Burger ~ made with ground Schmitz Ranch chuck, is a juicy affair, served on a potato pepper bun that's topped with bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, greens, tomato and crisp shallot rings mmmm-mazing burger! +2 for egg or bacon

Chicken IN Waffles ~ the reason why I came here since I was craving this, did not disappoint. The waffles have the shredded chicken cooked inside of them and come with a side of sriracha syrup.  Love the sweet and hot of the Sriracha syrup, what a genius idea.

Fried Chicken Sandwich ~   super juicy buttermilk fried chicken breast, cheese, Caesar cole slaw and a soft roll amazingly yummy! + 2 for their delicious garlic fries

Pork Adobo Tacos ~ friend ordered this, delicious, being part Filipino I loved the flavor.

Potato Skins ~ Roasted potato halves, crispy pork belly, charred green onions, Gouda cheese, crema and quail egg need I say more, it was loaded, rich and awesome.

If you find yourself in SoMa be sure to check it out, a lot of people go out of their way to come here because prices are reasonable along with the good food you won't go wrong. Delicious, fast comfort food makes me give Box Kitchen 4 stars!
author: Maria M.

description: I love this place for the food, the sandwiches have a juicy flavor to them and no matter what you order, you'll enjoy the bite. I would give it 3 stars because of the customer service, I feel they are very rude. I would definitely recommend a take out!
author: Shivam K.

description: Bomb burger!! Got the box burger with garlic fries and potato skins. Burger was really tasty but the fries were soggy. Potato skins was also really tasty! Went here during the daytime but this will definitely be a late night spot after a long night of drinking
author: KB B.

description: I don't normally write reviews but this place is worth it. I was in SF on a rainy day and had a craving for something delicious and nearby. Walked up to this gem and ordered chicken & waffles, Box Burger, and Garlic fries (soooo good). Anyways, it was raining and there was a wait so the guy suggested I should go to the Tempest bar next door which allows outside food (dope bar btw, loved the vibe but this review is for the food). Damn! my mouth is starting to water just thinking about the burger. Ok so food wasn't too pricey (don't recall the specifics but cheaper than other hipster joints) and there is just one word to describe it: DELICIOUS. If I had to choose the chicken & waffles was probably a bit less impressive than the burger and fries but that's cuz I had my food to go instead of sitting down and eating it right away (bar was too packed). Go check it out. You won't be disappointed!
author: Manraj A.

description: The Mac and Cheese egg rolls are worth the stop! Cool environment, also the pastrami tacos were legit! Two thumbs up.
author: Marc K.

description: We needed a quick bite to eat after some late-night shopping at Westfield. Since we didn't get out of the mall until almost 9, many of the restaurants I typically go to were so closed so I went on Yelp and took a shot at Box Kitchen. Initially, I thought the address was wrong because we were walking along a dark alley but there was actually a line outside, which surprised me. It turns out it's literally a hole in the wall right next to Tempest. I took awhile to look down their menu because they have an interesting variety of foods and we ended up with the Box Burger, Potato Skins, and Chicken and Waffles. The Box Burger had a healthy cut of beef, juicy and packed with flavor, the Chicken and Waffles had great flavor with a spicy kick but it was a little dry, and the Potato Skins with pork belly and egg was amazing, by far my favorite item. It took a little over 20 minutes so expect a short wait. You can take it into the Tempest bar to eat but we decided to eat out on the sidewalk like the majority of people. The food was definitely on the heavier side but it's not surprising since it's next to a bar. The portions were a little smaller than I'd like but the quality and flavors make up for it. Overall, excellent service and comfort food!
author: Jason C.

description: Can't believe they open till 1am. This is definitely a go-to when you're drunk and hungry in the midnight. The garlic fries is my favorite. Not a big fan of chicken nuggets and shrimp. :)
author: Yuliana Z.

description: The place is located off a small street that seems very sketchy but it's worth it for how good this burger is. I've had this burger twice now and each time it is cooked perfectly. The meat blend is delicious. The sharp melted cheddar on top is a perfect addition to this burger. The bun was slightly toasted. Pair this with garlic fries and its the perfect meal. So much fresh garlic that is finger licking good. This is one of the best burgers I've ever had!
author: Lisa D.

description: There's a bar next door that gets pretty crowded but if you're just looking for bite to top off you're drink - this is it. I highly recommend the potato skins. It's only three but it's pretty filling.
author: Mikki M.

description: Food was good, would like to try more on the menu. Overall wasn't the best experience but no fault of the food. As I was carrying my food back to my table in the Tempest, I was carefully avoiding the guys playing pool. But one of the guys, drunk off his ass, went out of his way to bump into me and then try to make me say "Excuse me" to him. Well that wasn't happening. He later came over to apologize. This was at 5:30pm. If there is a next time, I'll get it to go.
author: OtherJesus ..

description:
I really love chicken sandwiches for some strange reason and when I saw they had a Buffalo Fried Chicken Sandwich, I had to try it! The space is a fairly comfortable space. It gets super crowded during lunch times so the second times my friends and I tried to go there we turned back to avoid waiting in the huge line. The restaurant is very much a typical sports bar with tvs and a nice bar selection. The bartenders are also very nice and seemed like they really liked serving people.
The chicken sandwich is definitely in my top 10.It was full, and hearty, the cause was amazing, basically everything you can ask for in a chicken sandwich. And for $12 it's not terribly priced either. Definitely want to go back and try the other things on their menu and maybe catch a game or two there.
author: Itzak H.

description: Ordered the Box Burger and enjoyed it.. a lot. A very hidden but great spot next to a bar.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Nothing like good food to counteract all the alcohol you've been drinking next door. That basically sums up Box Kitchen for me.

We had all been drinking since I got off work at 5:30p last Thursday. Since our dinner reservation wasn't until 9:30p, we needed snacks. Enter Box Kitchen.

*Crawford's fried brussel sprouts: chili lemongrass vinaigrette, sesame seeds ($5)
-Salty, sweet with some vinaigrette to cut through it all! Plus a little healthy since they were brussels? All kidding aside, this was actually some people's fav. It was just a tad too sweet for me.

*Natoma dog: bacon wrapped all beef hot dog, pickled onions, roasted jalapeno salsa, garlic aioli, queso fresco, roll ($7)
-Another fav among the group. I enjoyed all the flavors of the pickled onions, jalapeno salsa, etc. There was just a little too much garlic aioli for me.

*Salt & vinegar fries ($6)
-Just like salt and vinegar chips, but in french fry form!

*Fried mac & cheese balls: marinara, cheese curds ($5)
-This was my pick! I love mac and cheese. Batter and fry it and you have a great drunk snack! This was my fav, but some in our party thought it was too rich. I loved it!

Box Kitchen was a great way to hold us over until we had dinner. Plus, you can bring it back to Tempest and eat while drinking. A perfect combo right?!
author: Elena N.

description: First night visiting San Fran and I bumped into this little gem of a restaurant. I loved their Chicken and Waffles. Chicken had great flavor, super juicy. I'll make the trip all the way from Anaheim just for this restaurant!
author: Ellie G.

description: Wow!  The burger is so flavorful!  It's a must! The elote is also very tasty but on the small side for the price.  Honey grilled cheese was also tasty.  Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu!
author: Cynthia A.

description: Send time that we visited the place and it really worth to visit over again. Excellent food and friendly staff.
author: Mega Team R.

description:
Sober or not I would never come here again. We had the rudest person take our order, the food was absolutely gross, and there were beggars everywhere. All this combined, I wish I could give less than a star. 

My friends and I wondered over to this hole in the wall after several drinks around midnight. There were only two people ahead of us in line, so I guess it wasn't that busy yet? You would think the staff would be nicer since there wasn't a huge crowd. But no, the staff was rude and unwelcoming. Despite this experience, we ordered potato skins, hush puppies, and garlic fries to share. Here's my breakdown:

potato skins- nothing outstanding. literally chunks of potato put back in the skins with sour cream, cheese, and bacon. You would think it's great, but no- it wasn't. 
hushpuppies- extremely dry with no flavor, how can you even call them hush puppies
garlic fries- drenched in oil, I wasn't aware we ordered a pool of oil with a side of fries. 

The food here made my drunchies disappear after a bite. I can only imagine how unappetizing the food would be sober.
author: Melanie H.

description:
I love their garlic fries! Unfortunately, it was flooded with so much oil. Like when you turn the container sideways, you'll have about 3 tbsp of oil. So yeah, soaked in oil. 

Their wings are so-so. It was like 5 pcs for $11 with a side of French fries. 

The lady was on her first day and it's good that she informed a time frame to get the food. 

However, when I saw the kitchen..... I don't know. I'm not sure if they passed in sanitation inspection. The floor was so dirty.
author: Kat P.

description:
Box Kitchen is one of our more reliable late night food spots when just about everything else decent has closed. Located just off of 5th and Howard, this is really just a window that you order from which has quality street food like pork belly potato skins, mexican street corn, wings, waffles, burgers and macncheese balls. It is really surprising just how good all of their food is considering its just a small hole in the wall next to Tempest which is quite a dive. What's really nice is that they're intended to be paired together and most people will take their Box food and dine at a table in Tempest.

Overall, Box definitely has a niche and purpose and it does its job well. I've been there a handful of times and will continue to come back when we are out and about and in need of some late night munchies. "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description: considering the rave reviews, I decided to grab lunch to-go. I had "the tempest", which was only average (i'm upset the bartender forgot to add my avocado too) and the broccoli and cauliflower was way too spendy for what it was (especially the portion) I wish I had chose the falafel sandwich and caesar salad, I think I would have been happier.
author: Jessica C.

description: Chicken and waffles and Box Burger are both so good. Best of bot I've had in the city. The location is pretty bad (especially considering that it's a literal hole in the wall in a pretty grody neighborhood) but the food is well worth it. The bar next door that allows their food is also a pretty nice atmosphere
author: Molly O.

description:
This place takes forever, like forever forever. And they apparently like flagging reviews, so let's try this again.
