The verdict: Is anyone else tired of these places? I'm talking about this hipster food joints serving basic food for hella cash that take forever. I'm talking about $14 nachos that take TWENTY FIVE MINUTES to make. I'm talking about places where after 25 minutes of waiting for nachos and ask, hey where are my nachos, only to be given a confused look and the explanation "sorry man, but our guac guy is out for a smoke, man." Man. 

My advice: I would recommend that this staff take a field trip to The Mission or to the kitchen of any Californian's kitchen and learn how to make make nachos, then drop the prices by 40%. I would also recommend firing your "guac guy"/your social media person who spends more time flagging reviews rather than making guac/customers happy.
author: M G.

description:
I love this place.  No, seriously.  I can't believe I haven't left a review earlier.
I really love telling my friends it's a "hole in the wall".  Cause that's what it really isn't!  You walk up to a door & place your order.
The food choices change a bit occasionally, but the standard items are always there.  Why?  Because they're so damn good & people buy them!
One of my favorites are the Box Burger, which is so juicy, and the textures in your mouth will have you inhaling it & wanting more.
But my ABSOLUTE favorite are the potato skins.  Oh.  My.  Gawd!!!  Potato, pork belly, creme fraiche, Gouda, topped with a little bitty quail egg.
Try & find THAT at anything but a higher end restaurant, much less a "hole in the wall"!!!  My only gripe about the skins, is that you get 3.  For me, three is too much for one person, but too small to share.  I wish I could buy them individually! 
I've turned so many friends onto Box Kitchen, and every one of them is grateful!
Added note:  if you don't want to get your order to go, you're welcome to bring it into The Tempest Bar next door.
author: Reed S.

description:
Excellent potato skins. The pork belly really makes it. They're a must try.

Prices are kinda high for the quantity but not unreasonable given SF foodie prices. They do sell out of some options though, wanted to try the waffles.

Certainly recommend for some drunchies. Maybe look elsewhere for a full meal though.
author: Jon L.

description:
This place is horrible and I would never come back. Here's why:

1. TERRIBLE service. Our waitress came by exactly twice: to take our order and to give us our check. Both times, we had to ask the busboy walking by. The waitress had enough free time to watch the TV but NOT ONCE did she come by to check in on us. We asked her and another waitress for waters, but they never came. We ended up going up to the bar to get them. No apology or even acknowledgement from the waitress. We had way more interaction with the busboy.
I asked (the bus boy since the waitress never came out) for a side of blue cheese since my sandwich was so dry. It never came, so I went up to the bar to ask. I had to stand there for 5 minutes while the wait staff watched TV. Finally someone from the kitchen brought it out.
Why don't they just do bar service and give up the presence that a waitress will serve??
2. SHITTY DRINKS. We ordered margaritas. They were 3% tequila and 97% cheap margarita mix. I don't really drink, but I got no buzz off this. From the reviews I was expecting a quality drinks. Big disappointment
3. DECEPTIVE PRACTICES. The menu sounded great online. It's rated as "$," meaning under $10. Nope. When we arrived, they had taken all the cheap options off the menu, leaving only $15 sandwiches. How do I tell Yelp this? 
4. SHITTY FOOD. I ordered the BBQ Chicken sandwich - two slabs of dry, overcooked chicken with weak Buffalo sauce.  It was a watery vinaigrette with a tiny amount of blue cheese in it - I'm from Buffalo, and this is NOT blue cheese dressing.  
My boyfriend ordered the meatloaf sandwich. The meatloaf was fine, but it was a 2 inch slab, impossible to eat as a sandwich. They couldn't have cut it down?
They also messed up our salad dressing orders.

FAIL
author: Drew G.

description:
Sitting on the corner of a "scary and creepy" alley way, this place did not seem to be a typical place that offers tasty food. I was wrong. It has a small windows for food ordering and there is a bar next door so that you can also "dine in". We went here on a Thursday night, picked up our orders and quickly escaped from the alley way (it was indeed not pleasant).

We ended up sitting in front of the dentistry school across the main street and hoped that the food was not too bad. Well i guess i should have thought it cannot be bad with such a high rating on Yelp. The food was unbelievable. I had the Box Burger and it blew me away: the patty was thick and super juicy, the saltiness was just enough to make the burger flavorful. The vegetables also tasted very fresh. The price was ok: The burger was 11 dollars w/o tax which was a little high for a street food place. it was worth it though. Also since you can see their kitchen from the ordering windows, the hygiene level can be a concern. However, i would still come back for the delicious burger since these guys really know how to make great food!
author: Xian S.

description: Goooood Lordy wtf do they put in the burgers???! Crack for sure! As I sat there w a friend biting into our burgers we sounded like a chorus of moaning filth as we couldn't believe what we were tasting! Best burger I've ever had in my life. I've had a lot of burgers, it's the best, no joke, can't believe I'm saying that.
author: Philip T.

description:
This hole-in-the-wall food stand is literally a hole in the wall! Conveniently located next to Tempest, it's perfect for snacks before happy hour, a legit meal while you drink, or even drunchies. What more can you ask for? You order your food, and they'll tell you when to come back to pick it up. In the meantime, grab a drink and make a new friend! :)

- Garlic Fries ($5): Perfect crispiness and so garlic-y. I didn't even care if my breath smelled bad after eating these bad boys. (But that could also be the alcohol talking..)
- Potato Skins ($9): Three pieces of starchy goodness. It's potato topped with delicious  pork belly, green onions, cheese, and a quail egg. Yes, it does taste as delicious as it sounds!
- Fried Chicken Sando ($9): I really digged the contrast of texture between the bread and the insides.
- Box Burger ($9): Flavorful but not over overwhelming. 

The food made taste buds, tummy, and wallet happy. And it's great when I can highly recommend both the bar (Tempest) and the food (Box Kitchen).
author: Christine S.

description: First I've had a burger here. After i've had many others and all what i can say is that the food is great! Definitely worth the price Beautiful interior, also you can take a food and go to park or some other place.
author: Daminan F.

description: This was a little hole in the wall that you walk up and order outside . No where to sit . You either stand and eat or walk to the bar next door. The food was absolutely delicious though ! One of the best burgers and garlic fries I've ever had . They are open late too which was great .
author: Serena S.

description: The burger is awesome, I think chicken waffle is just OK.
author: Anita C.

description:
potato skins with quail eggs at a gross, loud dive bar on Natoma @ 5th. St. I met someone in the area and wanted to try this dish. I don't know how the place is rated as highly as it is... Maybe it's decent for the area. What a shit show. Granted, I can't stand dive bars in grimy areas.

There was too much pepper and salt on the dry potatoes, to boot.
author: Paulina F.

description:
This place has just a little, baby window for ordering which would be easy to miss except there's frequently a good line outside of it, especially of barflies who come from Tempest. I ordered on a Saturday night around 10 pm; the area WOULD be sketch, except there's the aforementioned barflies from Tempest hanging around and there's safety in numbers.

Got the Turkey Sandwich, Garlic Fries, and Elote. Fries and sandwich were fine, and the elote was great, except I'm not a huge fan of jalapeños. Other than that, it was dressed up different from the normal elote fare with garlic aioli instead of mayo, queso fresco instead of cojita, and cilantro; never had it like that before but it totally worked. Service is great -- the guy taking our order was super chill and nice, just like the price.

It gets an A (4/5 burps) for the $10 & under bracket, and a great option for drunk food on a dime -- you just gotta take it and eat it somewhere else because there's nowhere to sit, lol.
author: GG C.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with a friend. There were only one or two and people ahead of us - still, the food took 15-20 minutes to come out. I guess that's why there's a sign asking you to be patient at the top! We got our food and then walked to Yerba Buena gardens and ate it there, since there's no seating area outside the hole in the wall.

We ordered three things total: the Box Burger, potato skins, and some burger made of fried kale and egg. 

The Box Burger might've been the best burger I've ever had. And I've had many (gourmet-ish) burgers in my life. The patty is cooked to a medium rare is and is extremely juicy, and the burger itself has a ton of texture (via the fried shallots) and flavor (via the thick chunks of bacon it comes with.) I could probably die happy eating this burger for the rest of my life. If you're here, I definitely recommend you try the Box Burger!

We also got to try the roasted potato skins which are topped with more thick cut bacon, a quail egg, and cheese. I got the cheese on the side because I'm not a fan of cheese (I'm terrible, I know.) The roasted potato skins were really yummy, but were also really rich; not sure if I'd recommend getting a burger at the potato skins together, as that might be too much food. They also come with a side of ranch so you can dress your potato skin to your heart's content (although there's a ton of flavor without the ranch already!)

My friend got the kale and egg burger, and she absolutely loved it! I was confused by the existence of a burger without meat, so I didn't think too much of it, but she was a huge fan. So, if you're looking for something lighter, that's recommended as well.

All in all, the food was super delicious and pretty cheap for a meal of that size. I'd definitely come back again!
author: Jessie Y.

description: I ordered the box burger and fries and brought next door to eat. Burger was excellent, fries too and the food was ready when I can to pick it up. Friendly and sharp attendant.
author: pie a.

description: Sure it's cliche but this place is a great example of a "hole in the wall" type of business and especially to find it by chance, late night after leaving a concert, No tables or chairs... just a split door to order from but the cantina next door doesn't seem to mind if you patronize them at the same time. Most of the dozen people were just standing or sitting on the sidewalk and it was nice to see SFPD finest even cruised through the alley while we were waiting for our order. A little expensive and tasty and moderate size portions...  but the ambiance of late night in downtown San Francisco with like minded people hanging out eating and boozing next door it just what kind of fun experience to tell others about.
author: Christopher B.

description:
There are times where I owe Yelp my life. This is one of those times. There is no way I would have found this place without Yelp. That mean's I would have missed this gem, and there would have forever been a void in my life. 

A little to-go window with 10 items on the menu in a somewhat sketchy neighborhood. You can order the food and take it next door to Tempest to eat and drink. 

The wings are cooked in a dry ranch rub and then they give you hot sauce for dipping. Brilliant!

The pastrami tacos were out of this world. The best tacos hands down, bar none. We ate here sober one night, then went back another night after some beverages. This place is the GOAT.
author: Andrew Q.

description: Get the box burger. It's a little too greasy for my taste, but very good nonetheless. Fried chicken sandwich was okay. Overall a pretty good experience.
author: Sarah W.

description:
You place your order standing on the sidewalk.

There are no seats but you bring your food into the bar on the corner, or stand in front where they have a 4 foot long plywood ledge.

Excellent and super juicy burger but it took around 15 minutes to get after placing the order.
author: Evan W.

description: The service here is great, and the Box Burger is amazing. I'm not from here, and I wanted something that I couldn't get at home. Well this is the place. Best burgers ever!!
author: Rachel B.

description:
Best. Find. 

This hole in the wall kitchen, associated with Tempest next door, is legitimately a hole in the wall, and what a find! Their food is a quick and fun spin on pub grub. You can take your food to go or bring it next door. Open from 4:20 pm-1:00 am everyday. Definitely recommend.
author: Daisy W.

description:
So I'm no longer on that fried food diet. My cousin and I came here before heading to a rave and it was the best decision ever.

Chicken in waffles: is exactly what the name spells out to be, chicken shreds within the waffle dipped with sriracha maple syrup. Not as crispy as I'd like but definitely an interesting flavor for your taste buds.

Potato skins: This is a must try! Last time I came, someone told me to get it. The quail egg, cheese, and pork belly tasted amazing.

I'm reading a lot of reviews wondering why this place is rated so high. I originally gave 3 stars, but I think you just have to order the right foods. Yes, everyone has different interests, so choose wisely!

The wait isn't super slow but it isn't super fast either. We waited about 10-15 minutes. So if you're not on a tight schedule and want a small snack (if you're starving, this place just won't do), this is a place worth checking out.

Someone said the box burger is amazing so I will definitely be back for that.
author: Lincy H.

description:
The most unassuming place and it provides incredibly DELICIOUS food! 

I had the Box Burger and let me tell you, it was definitely one of the best burgers I've ever had. The crispy fried shallots just *made* the burger for me. The burger was juicy, nicely seasoned, peppery arugula, little bits of bacon, and it's alllll wrapped together with some nice melted cheese. To top off the amazing burger, I upgraded my fries to Garlic Fries!! (yum...because whats a burger without some fries on the side?)

My boyfriend and I stumbled across this place around 5, not realizing that we had come justtt early enough before the work crowd. (Perfect timing in my opinion) Anyways, this place is hilarious, opens at 4:20 and closes at 1am. The crowd here is down to earth, edgy, and seems to love a good game of pool.

If you're in the area and looking for a bite to eat, I'd definitely recommend stopping by!
author: Katie 2.

description: Pastrami tacos were on point! Tender meat with good mustard seeds on top, everything else on the menu seemed delicious as well. I will be back to try the burger
author: Sasan S.

description: Ordered the garlic fries, it was lit. Crispy and tasted slightly of chicken, i think they fry them in the same oil as the fried chicken. Garlic flavor was not too strong, the best garlic fries ive ever had. Would definitely come back here
author: Emily J.

description: Amazing Brussels sprouts! Hella yummy. Wick good! Ali was mad cool and professional. Must try. You will enjoy!
author: Crystal R.

description: I think this place is great 10/10! The garlic Parmesan fries were delicious and I normally go to Tempest for lunch! They have a really great burger and have an amazing fried chicken as well. The menu rotates for daily specials too! Most of the food is great and I can't complain at all :)
author: Alex L.

description:
I've had the burger and chicken sandwich each several times and they were really delicious. Just got the burger to-go this evening though, and it was not the expected experience. It was very dry, the bun didn't seem quite fresh, and the patty was well-done. I'll still give it another try sometime but this was a letdown.

PS the staff are always super friendly.
author: Casimir P.

description: Impressive takeout food. The food is good on its own, don't wait until late night after drinking to eat there. The potato skin with pork belly and quail egg is awesome at 5:30pm
author: Kenneth L.

description:
Box kitchen will definitely be added on to my late night adventure to the city for food. It is located in an alley where your order is taken through a window. Box Kitchen is like one of the hidden gems. My friend and I both got the chicken sandwich which was delicioussssss. My favorite was the garlic Parmesan fries, their fries are sooooo good. 

The workers here were pretty cool and nice. The guy who took my order was very patient with me. While I was waiting for my food, I also notice that they have a lot of regulars who come by and everyone who worked there seemed happy. 

I recommend taking the food to go because there are no seats and everything is outdoor. there is also a lot across the street that you can park in. There is a bar right next door so I can only imagine how busy it gets when people start getting hungry at the bar. It took about 15 mins for us to get the food. Overall, I cant wait to come back and try other foods on the menu!
author: Temmara S.

description:
First off... I wanted a burger and was pondering to go chain or somewhere like a hole in a wall and went here.

It is connected to the bar but if you just hungry, the food is about 10-15 feet from the corner and was greeted by a nice person.

Only burger is the box burger and... it blows your mind and the first thing that came into my ear was cooked to medium rare.  I was sold and the mixture of cheese, arugula, onions, and that bun holding that meat.

I went to heaven and back with the parm fries.  Money well spent with everything perfect in SoMa
author: Matthew L.

description:
Believe the reviews, this is literally a hole in the wall.  I was in SF for business and got to my hotel after 11pm; nothing was open in the area, except for Box Kitchen, so I decided to try it out.  As I walked towards the spot, I started to get a little concerned when I turned down a small street that looked like an alley.  The alley had lots of people just hanging around; upon seeing this situation, some might have turned around for fear of a mugging, but I pressed on, I was really hungry after a cross-country flight. 
 
I eyed the hole in the wall and took a look at the menu which is nailed around the order window; despite being a really simple place, Box Kitchen has a great variety of food and I ordered the rueben tacos with garlic fries. After waiting for ten minutes, my order was ready; I rushed back to my hotel and enjoyed some delicious greasiness.  I loved the entire meal, though next time I might just get a large order of garlic fries and call it a day, they were that good.
author: A. C.

description: It's good. But it's not 4.5 stars good. I got the Chicken Sando ($8) with a side of garlic fries ($3 as a side). Both were pretty tasty. The fried chicken was really crispy and I liked the added flavor of the cole slaw. I don't like how Yelp categorizes this as one $. I guess if you only get the sandwich without any sides, technically that's under 10 bucks but that's hardly a meal. Garlic fries were mentioned frequently so I figured I'd try that too. It did taste good but I did not like how thick the fries were. It would've been better if they cut the fries thinner so there's more fried / garlic flavor per bite.
author: Richard D.

description:
Wow!    What a find. This little hole (or should I say Box) in the wall is great.   The fried chicken is spicy and delicious but could use some aioli .  The Box Burger is both unique and tasty.    The ground Schmitz Ranch chuck, bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, arugula, spinach, tomato, crispy shallot rings, on a potato pepper bun is a perfect build.
I can't wait to explore more of the menu.
author: John W.

description:
Easily some of the best food in the area.  The Brussels sprouts are spectacular, as are the potato skins, burger, and I think everything else I've ever gotten.  They change up the menu often enough to keep things interesting, and while it is mostly elevated bar food, there are lots of good options if you want to eat healthy or vegetarian.
My only warning to people would be that there's not always a place to sit and eat inside at the Tempest, especially if it's happy hour or later on the weekends.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Loved the box burger. I don't usually like burgers with lots of ingredients on it, but this one has got me. I's a must-have.

In my second visit I had the chicken sando. It's pretty good. Crispy and tasty. A little spicy. I still recommend the box burger, though.

Well, update. I had the chicken sando and it's good. Just a bit too spicy for my taste. But I would stick with the burger, anyway.
author: Lucas C.

description:
Box burger was great with its savory thick texture. Cooked medium rare which I prefer. IT was simply delicious one of the best burgers I had in the city. 
Along side the burger I got the cooked brussel sprouts which was also dlelicoius.

I wish this place was more obvious as normally I would never find this place if it wasn't my friend who brought me here. This is more a local spot hidden in a alleway and no signs indicaiting its position.
author: Jude N.

description: I was not expecting a literal box-sized kitchen when I arrived here, today. I was skeptical at first, but the mushroom burger was probably the best veggie burger I've ever had in my life. The Brussels sprouts looked sooooo good that I will probably have to be back.
author: Kyra D.

description: This place is amazing. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, and it's also really fast! We ordered and got our food in 15 minutes, and it was so amazing!!! Highly recommend the Box Burger
author: Thalia N.

description:
In the middle of a fairly abandoned, unremarkable alley across the street from a parking lot lies a door that opens at 4:20 PM: this is the realm of Box Kitchen. Mexican music blares from within, but burgers and fries are on the menu in addition to tamales, chicken wings, and other delights. 

People line up and gather in sporadic groups in the street as though they are waiting for reservations to get in to a restaurant, but in this case they wait for their food to come out the same door from which they ordered. 

We waited around 15 minutes for our order, then trucked across the street to dine on the School of Dentistry steps while Donald Trump gave his acceptance speech at the Republican National Convention. 

The fries were salt and pepper style, a bit crispy, hot, and excellent. My burger had an egg added, and it was very tasty (the meat was cooked medium rare, but the quality of the meat is above-average). My only complaint: the bottom of my burger was quite moist from the burger grease, but hey, that's what burgers are all about!

The food came in sturdy boxes and a bag that was easily capable of bearing the weight. We will definitely return to Box Kitchen. 

Their motto? "Please Be Patient." Please do. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kris F.

description:
Perfectly greasy foods for late night times. Had the burger and the loaded potato skins. Loved them both.
If you like pork belly and lil quail eggs, definitely get the skins. Seating at the bar next door which is a refreshing change from the usual typical boring and clinical financial district establishment.
author: Maivy N.

description:
Their Box Burger was one of the best burgers I've had - perfectly juicy and tender, and the garlic fries with it were a great complement.  It's a pretty neat place, as the whole restaurant is literally a kitchen behind a door.  I could imagine this place being great for late night munchies.  I will definitely come back!

I didn't go to the Tempest to eat like many suggested.  That's definitely on my to-do list for next time!
author: Michael N.

description: Food is good and you get plenty for the price. Count your change before you leave the window. Pretty sure if they short you it wasn't a mistake. Not a place for kids if you are staying in a hotel just pick it up.
author: Leo D.

description:
From my standpoint, if you're going to eat out, then you have to put out enough effort to work off the extra calories.  Thus, one day after work, I walked from one end of SOMA to Box Kitchen  to get my dinner.  I looked up instructions and I thought to myself, it's really not that far and it will be cool to try a new place and at the same time, get my heart pumping.

Walking down Howard St at night around 3rd or 4th is usually no big deal.  I think it's when I go from 5th Street and further down that the neighborhood changes a bit.  I think there's a homeless shelter near there and I saw lots of people just "hanging out" on the streets outside.  I

With that said, when I got to Box Kitchen, it looked exactly as what the posted Yelp pictures say.  It's a box shaped kitchen without any seating outside and the Tempest Bar next door.  For such a small kitchen, they have lots of variety of options like their popular Box Burger and those breakfast tacos with the quail egg on each one.  It really was way too many options to ponder.  Maybe it was the adrenaline or my uneasiness in the neighborhood, but I indulged and got some garlic parmesan fries with an order of meatballs.  

After I got to a place to sit down and eat the food, it still tasted great even after the additional walking time after I got my order.  

Since I know the lay of this land now, I probably won't feel too out of place here the next time I'm in this area.  The food is definitely worth a return visit.
author: Ben H L.

description:
I didn't go to Tempest, but I was near Mission and Fifth craving some good cheap eats for dinner. I was forward to Box Kitchen, and I was very happy with the dinner I got for my bro and me.

The definite keepers were the chicken sando, the box burger, and the potato skins. You get a good hearty amount of meat for both sandwiches, and definitely filling for what you pay for. As for the potato skins, you already know pork belly and quail eggs sound awesome. Three doesn't sound like a lot, but don't expect those tiny toddler skins you'll find at some scrub like Applebee's. You're gonna get three hearty half potatoes the size of some people's hands. Definitely worth what you're paying for.

The buffalo wings were excellent as well, but didn't knock my socks off like the first three dishes. As for the Chicken IN Waffles - I get the concept and you can definitely taste the confit. But personally, I'm not a fan of the concept and the chicken-tasting waffle just leaves me hungry alone. It's a neat idea, but no substitute for your classic chicken and waffles. We also shared Tempest with Chicken Fried Steak - pretty good, but the chicken fried steak isn't prepared like the classic. Instead of thin tenderized steak with some double breading, you're getting a big chunk of meat. Enjoyable, but not what I love about CFS.

Overall, Box Kitchen hits a bunch of great notes from dinner takeout to bar food. If you hit up Tempest, I don't see why you'd get food anywhere but here. Because it's damn good.
author: Dave N.

description:
A true hole in the wall. with awesome take out food served thru a half door on an alley way. Located next to the Tempest bar on an otherwise easy to walk past street.

I love this place and they are open till 1am.

Favorites here are:

The potato skins with pork belly and quail egg - amazingly good

The brussel sprouts - probably the best I have had anywhere

Box Burger - superb juicy thick burger with baby spinach instead of lettuce


Also good

Buffalo wings - Very good

chicken waffles - Good, but I would prefer more chicken and more spice in the maple syrup


Only OK:

Adobo pork tacos - bland and dry. Reserve this one for kids or more conservative palettes.
author: David T.

description: This spot is down an alley and next to a dive bar. If you don't feel comfortable being in a dark place with homeless people wondering around then you may want to rethink going here. Its only a window and you can take your food into the bar. Although its a sketchy  neighborhood everyone was friendly and its a very mixed crowd. I felt safe enough and the lady that took my order was very friendly. I had the chicken sando with the parm fries. It was delicious, the chicken was moist and the slaw that came on the burger was good. My only complaint was my parm fries were a little oily but i still ate it, so it wasn't that bad. I would come back to try the other menu items, its a really good spot.
author: Rosalind C.

description:
Okay, first of all I need to clarify that The Tempest is attached to this. I was very confused when researching but I figured it out!

This place wasn't the easiest to find and google maps took me down some shady turns to get here, but the place is cool.

We ordered the following -
- fried pickles (good)
- ranch chicken wings (good)
- sweet and sour wings (good)
- potato skins (amazing and the best)

There's really no where to sit so I would recommend this as a grab and go type of place. It's crazy how long the line gets right after opening, lucky we were there right when it opened. The staff was super nice, and the potions were great for the price. If I had a complaint it really would be the quality of napkins (I know, it sounds petty). The amount of sauce/mess you can make with this type of food requires a lot of napkins. 

Anyway, aside from that unusual input, I like this place. I would go back for the potato skins for sure.
author: Tyler V.

description:
Fabulous.   Delicious.    Easy to walk past a couple of times without noticing....    but worth the stop once you find it.
I love brussels sprouts, but wanted to inhale theirs... mac and cheese was a flavorful twist on the classic, and their burgers were divine.
author: Jen D.

description:
What a divey, grub, hole-in-the-wall kind of food spot!  I love the concept and I am thankful that my foodie friends introduced me to this place.  It is located in an alley that I never knew existed and the people traffic is mellow!  There is a bar next door, so this isolated alley to drink and eat is pretty much down to earth and low key.  Keep in mind that there is no seating! 

It is endearingly a hidden gem and surprisingly a block away from the main Bloomingdale, Metreon, Powell shopping area!

We ordered up the majority of the menu.  Every dish sounded too compelling to roughly decide and settle for just one or two.  They have Chicken and Waffles, signature Box Burgers, Battered Corn on the Cobs, Chicharones, Fried Chicken Wings, Fried Chicken Sando and Crisp Potato Skins!  It seemed like a short, simple list, but it was hard to choose because all of the names sounded too savory to pass up!  They even have whole coconuts as drinks!  So hipster and random at the same time!  

Basically, anything coming out from their kitchen, was top notch, comfort food!

The highlight was their potato skins!  It was perfectly crispy and a unique concept!  It is served as 3 in an order with the pork belly tucked inside the potato skin and each topped with sunny side up quail egg.  It is food-gasm in the mouth!  Believe me!

My recommendation is to order up at least 3 entrees from the menu, such as the Chicken and Waffles and Box Burger! 

Whether packed to go or served on a platter, Box food gets me wide-eyed and wonderfully waiting to become comfortably satiated!
author: Tiffany D.

description: We ordered takeout from here on a rainy day. We got the burger (with a fried egg), side of fries, the fried chicken banh mi, and the sweet and spicy wings. The burger was a solid 4, but could easily have been a 5 if it hadn't been take-out. The bottom of the burger got soggy due to some sort of sauce and/or grease, but tasty nonetheless. The sweet and spicy wings were good, but didn't seem to stand out in any way, just tasted like good buffalo wings. Fries were  still crispy. The chicken banh mi was a disappointment as it just tasted like a rather dry fried chicken sandwich. It didn't have the pickled carrots and daikon, or the cilantro, or some sort of pate spread as you would expect from a delicious banh mi. The burger was the winner though, and will definitely be back when I'm craving a burger.
author: Jingsong W.

description:
Pretty much what most folks have said on here.  I love that you walk up to a door and order your food in an alley.  Bottom line is that the food is AMAZING.

I had the chicken sandwich and the burger.  Both were phenomenal and the best burger I had in the City.  Their garlic fries were great!!! 

Going back again today!!! Don't pass up this place.  It is worth every penny!!!
author: Dr. W.

description:
I've totally been to Tempest before, but it took one adventuring friend to bring me to Box Kitchen, which I've never noticed before. 

I ignored my calorie counting for one day and ordered the Box Burger, garlic fries, and mac and cheese balls. The food took a while, but we weren't in any real hurry.

We took our food to the nearby Yerba Buena Gardens to chow down. The burger was a nice medium, which I liked, considering that they don't ask you about your desired temperature. The burger was good - a solid patty, good toppings, good flavor. The garlic fries weren't garlicy enough for me, but that's just my personal preference. And the mac and cheese balls, while tasty, were way too hearty for me.

Box Kitchen would make the perfect drunk food for the next time I'm at Tempest. I'm very glad I know about it now, especially since it's just a block away from my work place!
author: Christina S.

description:
FOODGASM ALERT!! TASTY LIBERATIONS!!
(5 stars and a meteor shower)

Its a "i just want to punch people in the face" good. Have you ever had something so tasty you are just lost for words and all you can do is let out a foodgasm. Well, damn, I just had a multiple foodgasm. Sprinkle that gelatinous all over me.

-FOOD, ridiculously phenomenal
-PRICES, affordable 
-SERVICE, fast and on point
-AMBIANCE, walk-up window

Box, clever name. It literally is a box. Searched alley, Walked-up, no line, skim daily menu, ordered, eat, foodgasm, eat, more foodgasm, done.

HEFFER STATUS.

POTATO SKINS ($9) - three roasted potato slices, with green union and other stuff, filled with meaty juicy gelatinous pork belly chunks, melted creamy cheese, topped with quail egg... Daaammnn. This has been by far a favorite thing to eat in the past months. It's that good. Heavy, fatty, not so healthy, juicy, and p-e-r-f-e-c-t. The juice from the pork belly soaks into the roasted potatoes skin, yum. so good!!! it's my new kryptonite, it weakens my strong yelp defense. 

Will I be back? YES!!

JABA APPROVED... Until the next review.
author: Jane A.

description:
First of all, The Tempest is one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. My grad school is located nearby so there were a lot of late night get togethers on the mismatched salvaged chairs.

Box Kitchen is in the same building as The Tempest and during the day they serve lunch in the bar with actual table service. They even put place mats down on the old chipped tables.

In the evenings Box just has its street window open where you go and order food. It's the best late night snack in SOMA.  The chicken n waffles with siracha is the perfect blend between sweet and spicy. You may be surprised if you are expecting traditional chicken n waffles because Box Kitchen puts the chicken IN the waffles. Now you know. The  Fried Mac n cheese balls are delicious. Their burger is delicious. The potato skins are classed up with some quail eggs and, you guessed it, are delicious.

The guys running the Box Kitchen are super nice and get the food turned around pretty quickly, although it can get very busy.
author: Casey S.

description: These is one of the best burgers I've had in SF, so thick and fresh! And those garlic fries are amazing! Will definitely be coming back for more.
author: Kriz C.

description:
The food here was pretty phenomenal. I got the pea and squash empanadas and they were much better than I would have even imagined. The slight sweetness of the squash really paired well with the crumbled cheese on to of the empanadas.

My boyfriend got the potato skins with quail eggs - sounds super hipster, but tasted good (and hey, why wouldn't you try quail eggs when you have a chance?!) I was glad I picked the empanadas, but these were also tasty.

There isn't seating outside anywhere and the attached bar is very crowded so our group just ended up eating outside. I will say the bar inside has fair prices for some really good beers, but this place should consider getting a patio table outside or something.
author: Sylvia S.

description: Flavorful, juicy, big, tasty, excellent burger! One of the best I've had in such a long time! Came here after I found it during a job interview! Such an amazing place, definitely coming back with friends to have a few drinks as well since it's inside tempest! What a place. I recommend to anyone trying to try this hidden gem!
author: Paulo F.

description:
Delicious! We ordered the corn dogs, Box burger, brussel sprouts and fried chicken banh mi. Everything was solid besides banh mi, where the chicken was a pretty dry. The Box burger is solid win.

Next time, spaghettios and meatballs!
author: Kristina K.

description: One of the best dive restaurants I have enjoyed. The food and vibe here are awesome. I can't recall the last time I saw $2 beers. Granted it was PBR,  but two bucks is two bucks. Will definitely come here again.
author: Gary D.

description:
I usually get the Box Burger and Garlic fries which is an A+, especially late at night in this part of SOMA where food options are slim. Last week I tried the chicken sando and it's just as good as the burger! The folks you order from are exceptionally friendly and even remember your name, so that's a nice added bonus. Try Box Kitchen, you wont be disappointed.

Update: if you come here on Tuesdays they have a steak frites daily special that is straight FIRE. A+ all around.
author: Dylan H.

description: This is literally a hole in the wall... But it was delicious regardless of where there were located. I live in SoCal and we have good food here but I will crave their box kitchen burger. It was delicious and probably the best garlic parm fries ever.
author: Brittney K.

description: So happy with this discovery! Stopped by after hitting up Market, and it's now my favorite place around there. Great selection for pretty cheap (under $10). I got their grilled cheese, which came with gouda, manchego, and honey on top, which was surprisingly a good touch. Their fries are also well seasoned. They're open super late (1 am), which is excellent. Big fan. Friendly people too! You can order your food and take it into the Tempest next door. Technically, the two are one in the same.
author: Jen A.

description: The Parmesan garlic fries were amazing and the box burger is delicious. Instead of using boring lettuce the use arugula and spinach which have the burger a more bitter taste which I enjoyed. They also cooked it medium rare which I appreciated. I would definitely go back.
author: Kyle L.

description:
omgomgomgomg. If you're ever having midnight drunchies (let's be real, we all have those at least a few times a week), BOX KITCHEN will satisfy your drunchies. But really though, you can come here sober and it'll be just as good. 

After eating the whole day in SF, my friend and I decided to get two things and share. It was super hard to narrow down our choices and it doesn't help that they have a lot of potato entrees! I stared down the menu for a good 10 minutes trying to decide if I wanted garlic fries or potato skins. I ended up getting potato skins and a box burger. HOLY SHIZ, the potato skins were DIVINE. I just wished i hadn't devoured them that quickly. The burger was good, but not as good as the potato skins. If any of y'all are thinking about coming here, don't count the calories and just get the potato skins. Like nike says, JUST DO IT. 

The best part about this place is that it's located next to louie's bar, so you can grab a drink while you wait to have a foodgasm. Nightly food services start at 4:20pm and end at 1am.
author: Tammy T.

description: I give four for great service! And food was good. You know when someone is so nice you feel bad writing an ok review? That's how great the service was. The food was good I ate it all but I think yelp hyped it up too much for me. Someone said best garlic fries they've had, hmmm.. Well it was good but I've had better. Elote was yummy, my friend was literally shoveling the corn in her mouth, legit. The burger was good too, I love the bacon bits. Was it memorable? Nah. But I would go back to try other dishes.
author: Karen T.

description: Called this place to put in a to go order. The woman answering said I called Tempest and I needed to call box kitchen. I asked for the box kitchen number. I called that one, the guy answering said I called Tempest and needed to call box kitchen. Gave me the first number I called. Fuck this noise, went somewhere else.
author: JD M.

description:
The Fried Green Tomatoes were super good. Crispy, corn meal coated, thick green tomatoes, with a tangy sauce and the perfect amount of green and dill chips. Though the $9 price point ins a bit high.

The Potato and Leek Soup was very flavorful and the crispy leeks were tasty but a bit thin for my liking.

The Fried Mac & Cheese Balls were really good! Perfectly salty and cheesy and the marinara was delicious. I fat kidded them all.

The Burger was pretty good as well. Very thick and juicy and I like the fried shallots and the bacon jam gastrique.

Eating inside Tempest was nice as well. The place was packed and our server was great. Only downside of the service element was that everything we ordered came out at once, and we were waiting a few too many ticks for our food to arrive. Though, as I said the place was packed.

I will definitely be going back to Box/Tempest and next time I'm getting the Fried Chicken Sando.
author: Lee S.

description:
Due to construction work on a pair of new apartment buildings, my detour towards my lunch destination reminded me of reviews by Jon A. and Keane to explore this place.  Arriving on a Wednesday afternoon around 2 pm, I walked here to find the window under the black awning closed.  Walking to Tempest at the corner, I asked the doorman about Box and he pointed me inside.  Apparently during the day, Box offers its menu in the bar in either sit down form or take out.  Needing to return to my office, I ordered with a waiter clearing a table and waited for my food at the bar.  There were multiple TVs going, showing the A's game, Giant's game, and a soccer match.  After about ten minutes, I brought the following to my office:

1) Clam chowder cup (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lTrCMGwm2kOdezxaiEUjyg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) -  It was creamy and rich, just a bit boring since there little more than potato and clam pieces. 

2) Apple braised ribs (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=6tTZoO-VQhQbzFSYvbVZzQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Schmitz pork ribs, Angry Orchard Apple Cider glaze, Carolina slaw, and cornbread wedge.  Deceivingly, this plate was packed with flavor as the meat was off-the-bone tender with a tangy apple aftertaste.  The slaw was pretty nondescript and the cornbread added some sweetness.

Need to return to try their touted burger and garlic fries. Oh, and yes, will stop in on a Thursday to try their Chicken & Biscuit special.
author: Mike C.

description: This is the definition of a "hole in the wall," and so damn good. Loved their box burger and garlic parm fries!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Holy moly, this place is delicious! You definitely won't be disappointed. The fried caesar sando is by far the best chicken sandwich I've ever had.

Oh, and don't miss out on the potato skins...amazing! Dare I say I'm on a mission to try every item on their menu?
author: Leo R.

description: Showed up here late Monday night expecting an establishment but it's a door with a hole in it and you order and take it to eat next door at the Tempest and it was perfect. The old adage of not judging a book by it's cover absolutely holds true here. Anything you get here is beyond worth the price you pay. I went with the box burger my girlfriend went with the elote. It was all delicious.
author: Adolfo V.

description:
This place is awesome! 

Although I'm normally a burger gal I was craving a chicken sandwhich when I came... was hoping it'd be the fried chicken sandwich on biscuit but that day they were serving a buffalo chicken sandwhich on I believe Ciabatta. It was still completely satisfying! Wasn't really spicy but tender and flavorful. Bread was soft too. Made for great leftovers as well. 

I think my favorite thing we ordered was the waffle stuffed with chicken and sriracha maple syrup. Waffle was warm and soft with tender pieces of chicken throughout... the maple syrup just had a hint if sriracha to it. Pretty fun dish for the taste buds.

The potato skins with pork belly and quail egg were good too. Super creative and pretty much everything I love in one bite! Just wish there was more cream to dip them in since they were very conservative with it.

Recommend this spot for creative delicious munchy food lovers!
author: Melissa C.

description: We went here late at night and its a really cool little spot. They have a really cool menu. We had a few items which were all very tasty. Everything is made fresh so it takes a while but its worth it. The staff are very nice and friendly.
author: Fabi V.

description:
Grab some food at Box and head on over to Tempest!
Definitely get the mac and cheese balls, and the potato skins with quail egg and pork belly. 
Pass on the corn fritters! They're a little dry.
author: Michelle L.

description: Hidden in an alleyway. This place was awesome! Came here during lunch and there was about an 15 minutes wait. The waitress was quick and super nice. I ordered the box burger and it was so good. It was $11, which is not bad. It also came with fries. I would definitely come back again and try out other food on the menu.
author: Louise C.

description: i love Box. It's my go-to for a late night meal. The burgers are excellent but the chicken sandwich and mac and cheese taquitoes were excellent as well.
author: Banjot C.

description: The food is fantastic.  My son forces me to get burgers from here when we go to the Metreon. It's in an ally way next to a dive bar, so carefull taking squeamish people upady people.  But if your adventures this is a San Frrancisco must go to place.
author: Piyush P.

description: Awesome !  Was absolutely not disappointed !!  Had lunch here with my hubby.   It is totally off the beaten path in an alley at the Tempest. The staff is super friendly, efficient and engaging.  Fast food- fast service- great quality with both.   We will be back without a doubt.
author: Tara M.

description:
I came here after something from a nearby grimy gay bar and thought to ask to use the restroom which,at the time, was not an option but the guy behind the counter casually told me that if I turned around and pissed in the street, "The drainage on this road is quite good."

There was a crowd of people leaving a bar and heading directly for the counter at which I was standing as if like moths to a flame they had no choice but to come to the box kitchen and eat.

So realizing that I had prime real estate has been the first in a soon to be completely too long to wait line, I asked for something sweet was recommended the chicken and waffles titled chicken in waffles. 



Getting about a really really good vibe from and about San Francisco waiting in this grimy alleyway, I looked at all the other entrées and thought that I absolutely had to try it at some point every single one.

10 minutes later, I found myself choking and gasping for air as I tried to devour the waffles before they fell or someone asked for a piece.


Knockout
author: Grey G.

description: From Chicago. Best food I had while I was in San Fran. Unreal. Mac and cheese egg rolls. Skins are incredible. Pastrami tacos. Eat here now. Before there is a line that's two blocks long.
author: Peter R.

description: Amazing food and great staff. The kitchen really does take time and dedication to making their meals for perfection of taste.
author: John A.

description:
Although it's only a few blocks away from my favorite intersection in the city, 6th and Market, I'd definitely come back to this place for some late-night grub.

My dining partner and I shared an order of Potato Skins, a Box Burger, and a Chicken in Waffles. Of these items, the Chicken in Waffles was the highlight of our meal. We thought the chicken was forgotten in our order, but the chicken is literally in the waffle! The blending of savory and sweet in this meal was executed extremely well: the waffle and chicken, and maple syrup mixed with Sriracha sauce all came together in a pleasantly novel way.
author: Mark C.

description:
Box: it's an apt name for this hole in the wall next to the Tempest bar. Don't let the grungy name fool you, though; I had literally the best burger I've ever eaten in my entire life here. 

You know how a lot of burgers end up tasting overwhelmingly like the toppings, piled onto a charred, crumbly patty that hardly resembles beef anymore? You won't get any of that here (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/box-san-francisco-2?select=ENy9FfHsWDoZ87gVhuYTRw#AuJCEcgKiGNLbwc6ULbwTw). Cooked to a perfect pink and juicy medium, the flavors were clean yet complex. The bacon shallot gastrique added a smokey depth without overpowering the unmistakable flavor of BEEF! The crispy shallots made my taste buds squeal. All this was enveloped in a dense potato bun with just the right amount of crunch. GET IT. 

The chicken in waffles (IN waffles, not AND waffles!) is oh-so-clever and witty, which makes me gleeful. The confit chicken is a smart and tasty move, as you don't risk any sogginess while it's sandwiched between the crisp waffle. So is the sriracha maple syrup - it adds an interesting dimension that I can't quite describe. You'll have to get it yourself to find out.

At $8 for the burger and $7 for the chicken in waffles, prices are totally reasonable for the quality of food. We came around 6pm on a Friday evening and there was a 14 minute wait, so keep that in mind if you're planning to take it on the go.

I'm sure Box gets a large portion of their business from late night bar-goers with the munchies, but honestly, I'd rather come here sober so I can consciously enjoy every last bit of my burger.
author: Clarice W.

description: Very tasty and filling food. I would recommend stopping by if you're in the area. Make sure to try their chicken.
author: Thato C.

description:
Of course the following night I went back and duplicated my order and talked a bit with the guy at the counter. He said the garlic fries are dressed with a confit of garlic made with duck fat. No wonder they are so damned good. Yummers!

And the Box Burger is made from Nimitz Farms grass fed beef, and the quality shows.The ground beef reminds me of what my meat-cutter grandfather used to sell. And the additional toppings I snarfed are a Bacon & Shallot Gastrique--shallots with nice chunks of thick sliced bacon. My mind didn't miss these details, they were all very present but I didn't ruin the experience by analyzing them.

Finding out later these details helped me relive the experience and served as an appetizer as I waited for my new order in the bar a scant 12 minutes.

So damned good.
author: Travin T.

description:
I think you have got to be drunk to like this place (which I imagine, most who eat here are). The food comes cold and in small portions, also incredibly salty. Not quality stuff, but cheap! Spaghetti bread was stale last two times I ordered it. The chicken waffles are pretty good, but the machine has been broken the last few times I've stopped by. The workers are always very nice and cracking jokes, but that's sort of the only thing to rave about while waiting for your cold food in the icy, dark alley. Who would've guessed that the world's missing hospitality would be found at a little hole-in-the-wall?

Oh, and there are cute little mice running around every few minutes. 1 star for entertainment.
author: Elaine N.

description:
The burger is amazing. Thick and juicy, piled with cheese and these greasy bacon bits. Not at all the type of burger you'd expect from a restaurant that is literally a hole in the wall.

I showed up around 9:30pm. There were several people waiting outside. It took over 10 minutes to get my burger after I ordered it. Well worth the wait for something so delicious.
author: Adam G.

description:
My go to's

Potato skins -  with pork belly and fried quail egg 
Box Burger 
Chicken in waffles w/ Sriracha syrup 

Awesome place... Hole in the wall joint but a must stop anytime I find myself in SF.. Tip*  grab a Manny's Pale ale at the tempest to wash it down.
author: Francisco V.

description: Great food! So glad we found this spot!! Had the chicken sandwich and it was delicious! My friend had the burger and was raving about it. Will definately come back.
author: Giovanna R.

description:
I had already been tricked out of eating here once, and I was not letting that happen again.

We came to Box Kitchen on a Saturday night for the food and stayed for the cheap booze (at Tempest).

To start, the Box Burger is divine. Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Perfectly-seasoned patty, excellent accoutrements. We also tried the chicken sandwich (solid, a nice bit of spice) and the garlic fries (oh, yeah), but the burger stood out.

If you want, you can order and walk next door to Tempest. I'll definitely be back for this excellent combination of mind-blowing food (potato skins with pork belly and quail eggs?!) and cool vibe.
author: Becca M.

description: Garlic Parm fries are the best fries I've ever had. Small to go spot, but definitely give them a try. I'll be back to try their wings and burgers soon!!
author: Anna M.

description:
Divine burger. Enough said. 

My friend had the chicken wings and they did not live up to his expectations. He was expecting a lot perhaps.
author: Yash R.

description:
Big fan of Box Kitchen. The food here is good and their menu is great- really creative and I see it being switched up from time to time. Not 5 stars, but I would definitely give them 4.5 if I could and they are definitely a solid 4. Gotten both takeout as well as food "for here" (which you can eat standing up outside or at the Tempest bar next door; I absolutely recommend doing the later). 

As I mentioned, they have a pretty creative menu. Lots of interesting options- think classic with their own spin. I've had the potato skins (topped with pork belly and quail egg) and the meatballs (a little too spicy for me, I wasn't a huge fan of them) but I keep coming back for the burger with garlic fries. The garlic fries are great- I definitely recommend them, either with or without the burger. Delicious garlicy fries with some awesome beer from the Tempest or other drinks = fantastic. The burger is alright. Definitely specify medium as they otherwise cook it a little too well done for my tastes; even the medium has a pretty good char on it. I'm not a big fan of the bun it comes on and tend to remove the bun and just enjoy the burger by itself. The combination of bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, and arugula that it is topped with is delicious. Not the best burger i have had by any means, and I think the toppings are the best part (better than the burger itself) but a solid option and I love that they let you add the garlic fries to it for a couple of extra bucks. 

I definitely need to come back for lunch at some point as I hear they have table service inside of the bar. Box kitchen can get a little busy (as can the Tempest) but I certainly recommend both.
author: Seema U.

description: Simply the best late night food EVER! It's amazing! I had the kimchee burger, Mac and cheese egg rolls, Brussels sprouts are good. the box burger is to die for, all of the food is great and really amazing, chicken and waffles, kimchee burger, it is all great
author: Jefferson P.

description:
Love this "FIND"...Random turns into pure deliciousness!!! Late Sunday night after the Giants game in the hotel we got hungry and checked Yelp! Our burger was juicy and big enough to split ... The garlic fries were pungent and delicious ... Ate next door at Tempest with a craft beer and rolled back to the Intercontinental !
Loved it!!!
author: Jan K.

description: There is no seating, you can however decide to sit at the bar next door. It takes them no more than 15 minutes to make the food. The burger was cooked medium by default and not too juicy. The fries were crispy but not airy on the inside.
author: James S.

description: Ordered the mac and cheese egg rolls with chorizo and the pastrami tacos. Both were very tasty!
author: Jeremy B.

description: This was an amazing surprise during my trip to San fransico. Found it during a random search looking for lunch. We ordered the grilled cheese, chicken and waffles, mac and cheese egg rolls and drinks. Everything we ordered was awesome. Will most def be back on my next trip.
author: Sergio G.

description: Insane, amazing, delicious, price isn't bad, thick half pound patty cooked tender and juicy!
author: Alfredo N.

description: Burger was fantastic, huge portion of garlic fries just as good the next day, chicken sandwich texturally mind blowing and the potato skins an insanely rich treat I could not get over. 10/10 would put in my mouth again.
author: Evan M.

description: This was a unique experience. I came here with a friend after craving some waffles and seeing their yelp reviews. It was a little difficult to find and it wasn't well marked. It's essentially a bar that serves food. The decor is interesting. There's some color and mixed vintage furniture likely picked up at garage sales and such. Our server was spectacular. She was knowledgeable, friendly, and very attentive. Our order did get messed up, but when we called it over she knew it right away and fixed it. She couldn't stop apologizing about it. Overall, I enjoyed the experience and appreciated how well taken care of we were here. We would totally come back here again!!!
author: Axedentol S.

description: My friend and I went here 2 nights ago after a late night out.  They were serving only a limited menu because apparently they had just repaired the vent hood and couldn't use it yet. They charged $15 for a tiny "meatloaf sandwich"- no sides or anything; and $14 for a "loaded" baked potato, which was very small (about 4 oz) with about a tablespoon of chili and sour cream and a chopped up radish. Really? I understand equipment needing to be updated and fixed but what I DON'T understand is PRICE GOUGING- which is what this experience amounted to.  If I could give them a no or minus star review I would. This place is crap. Stay away.
author: Cathey H.

description: Those potato skins are pretty great. The smokiness of gouda, the crack of the pork belly, the mini egg (quail I believe) all come together for a pretty decadent bite. I'd share them, since eating all three (which I did yesterday) is kind of a lot.
author: Misha T.

description:
The box burger was so tasty and filling, I adored every bite. The fries were crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.

Just a suggestion, it was a bit pinker than I'm used to, so possibly asking how the doneness is preferred would be great.
author: Rosa H.

description: Pleeeeeeease bring back the southern crispy chicken sandwich. The banh mi you replaced it with is nowhere near as good. For years, that crispy chicken sandwich was all the reason we needed to come for lunch over and over and over again. But now it's gone. Put it back on the menu and it's a no-brainer 5-star review from me!
author: Hunter H.

description: So good. Staff was fun and good at answering any questions about the menu when we felt overwhelmed by all the choices. Great food esp. the burger
author: Malia G.

description:
YUM! they have great food, hours and service- in that order and all with a high rating.

I love that the bun is perfectly toasted and the meat is super flavorful, not to mention the bright greens added to the burger. greens are typically overlooked,
but not here and I'm grateful. 

thank you, box kitchen for the beautiful textures and flavor.
author: hannah l.

description:
Food was good, came it fast, service in the window was super friendly. Very convenient spot and you can bring it in to Tempest while you're drinking, "high five!"

We had the garlic fries, chicken sando and the potato skins. All were delicious and the skins were downright amazing with the pork belly chunks, quail eggs and all.
author: Michael B.

description: Are you kidding me? Eat everything they make. My 2 favorite are the Roasted potato skins with crispy pork belly, charred green onions, gouda cheese, cream and a quail egg...I added grilled serrano peppers. And the Baby Corn Elote - chipotle lime butter, elote spice, garlic aioli, queso fresco, radish, lime
author: Chris W.

description:
Yum! The take-out portion of Box Kitchen definitely has a rustic feel. Now don't expect the service to be fast, whether there is a line or not. They take their time putting together the burgers. But, I'd say the wait is worth it!

You must try the hamburger, priced at $9 is pretty decent. I savored every bite!
author: Aletta B.

description:
Totally unassuming place. Literally a hole in the wall but amazing food. Don't let the outside fool you. The food here is awesome. Its kind of a hard place to find if you are new to the city. Its on a small street that resembles an alley way and the place literally just has a door open. They have a menu stand outside, but that can be overlooked. 

The burgers that we got were great. The patties were well seasoned and it wasn't a mess of grease. The fries were fresh and seasoned well.
author: Moses L.

description:
Come on, folks. It's a window serving grease for drunken bellies that's literally embedded in a bar (The Tempest).

It's not amazing. Not even close. It's just there, and it's good, and you're drunk, and it's there. They could hand you a wriggling crab and a pair of needle nose pliers and you'd probably give it five stars like the drunk fuck that you are. The next morning you'd chalk up any pinch marks to that feisty number you Tinder'd earlier in the evening.

Things to get: tacos and sandwiches. Things not to get: chicken in waffles. Not "and," but in. It's chicken blended into waffle batter, which is to say there is pureed meat involved so I'm out. My first bite was so weird. I'd sooner eat human meat than eat this again. I will however, order the fries because they are dank.

Obligatory Title Pun: Think outside the BOX.

Menu Readability: It's on a sign by the door and looks pretty hip-hop. Word.

Need to mention: I mean, it's there. I don't hate this place, but suppress your orgasms please.

What this place teaches me about myself: When it comes to drunchies, proximity isn't everything.
author: Vivek S.

description:
The cashier here was super mellow, while friendly and informative.

I couldn't resist the namesake sammich: the Box Burger. It lived up to the hype and beat it. Frankly, the textures and layers of flavor blew me to smithereens. Can't wait to go back for another.
author: Blaine C.

description:
Trust the reviews, Box burgers are gooooood!

A juicy patty on a lightly toasted buttery bun, this $8 burger's got all the fixin's you need: sliced tomato, some spicy arugula, aged cheddar, and crispy fried shallots which ultimately make the dish.  This burger is so much better than many $10 burgers in SF and it's created in a dive bar kitchen.  Love it.  5 stars.

However, I was a bit disappointed to find that they no longer top their chicken in waffles with crispy chicken skin.  4 stars.  Also, remember that it is chicken IN waffles - don't be that guy/gal who asks the cashier "Umm where's my chicken?"
author: Beatrice W.

description: AWESOME burger ...had the box Burger with fried egg and fries...did not disappoint! Friendly Service, big screens...earmarked for repeat visits!
author: Richard C.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I was SO sad they didn't have the chicken in waffles when I came here last night. I risked my life walking through the SUUPER shady alley way and hunting for a parking spot on Market, all I wanted was chicken IN my waffles.

Now that I got that off my shoulders, this place is pretty cool! It literally is. a. box. in the wall. so it makes for a pretty great spot to get your grub on post bar-hopping (though it's at a very inconvenient spot if you aren't hopping on the Bart next door). HOWEVER, I would suggest coming here when you're not drunk so you can actually taste the food you're eating!! The food is very flavorful and they seem to always add a different sauce to their dishes to add a delicious spin on it. For the fried chicken sandwich, it's the sweet honey mustard addition and for the pork tacos, it's the extra spicy red sauce! I definitely recommend the chicken sandwich- the crunchy chicken, carby Sourdough bread, and sweet honey mustard makes for a nice treat. The portion is also reasonable for the $9 you pay (as big as Ike's sandwiches, just with less stuff in it).
author: Aradhana V.

description:
Late night meal to feed the kids (age 11-19). It was a hit! The Box Burger was big, juicy and filling. The Falafel pita wrap had excellent hummus in it and was devoured.  We had garlic parm fries and everyone enjoyed them. For a family of seven we ate everything within 20 min. Good portions, filling and overall delicious. Highly recommend. Hole in the wall, don't be turned off by it. We took it to go. 

Kids loved it(so did mom and dad) so much they wanted more. We went back the next day to try the potato skins, chicken and waffles, and more garlic parm fries.  Again everything was delicious but the Box Burger was the best with the garlic parm fries. It's a definite must try!!
author: Roselle T.

description: 2/2 times I've been here, I ate the burger and had intense late night stomach pain and diarrhea. It also took them 10 minutes to get me the food, which feels slow when you have to wait outside.
author: Jarred S.

description:
I'm actually not sure if I could explain how much I love Box Kitchen with mere words...

If it was a YouTube video, it would be a kitten wearing a tiny hat riding a puppy riding a zoomba.

If it was an interpretive dance, it would involve lots of jazz hands and heel clicks.

If it was a movie scene, it would be that moment when the music swells, the light hits the main character and one tiny tear rolls down their face because they are so overwhelmed with the beauty of the world.

That's how much I like this place.

Ok but let's get one thing straight - this place is not fancy... it's not michelin starred... hell it doesn't even have a place to sit down. It's a take out window next to a dive bar, so adjust your expectations (puppies riding zoombas aside). But as a take out window next to a dive bar, they have perfected their niche. Enter: the world's best drunk food... or hungover food... or I need to eat this in 15 minutes food.

I was in San Francisco for a week and I ate here three times, under three different circumstances. The first was while drinking. We took down: mac & cheese balls, garlic fries and hush puppies. Oddly enough, these weren't my favourite even though I was a few drinks deep and feeling pretty darn happy go lucky, but still a solid choice and you can bring it into Tempest (the dive bar next door). Bonus.

The second time was hungover the day after our big work shindig and we ordered burgers and bloody marys from inside Tempest. Between 11am - 3pm they act as the bar's "lunch menu". Damn fine burger.

But the last time... the last time was happy music, YouTube magic. Why? Because I was sober, starving and ate my fried chicken sandwich while sitting on a sidewalk at midnight because we were too fussed and hungry to make it back to the hotel.

AND IT WAS MAGICAL.

Seriously... I will dream of that sandwich.

So as far as I can tell, you can't go wrong with anything here. They also have a surprising amount of healthy options (including salads) and you should add avocado & bacon to anything and everything. I wish I had this dive bar/take out combo in Edinburgh. Consider me jealous San Francisco.
author: Jody B.

description:
Great late night food.
Could be a long line outside.
Literally whole in the whole.
No seats. You have to eat in your car.
Open late.
Their menu changes every night and can easily ran out of many things ASAP.
To go place to after a night of funzy.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Late night drunk food so good, if you eat it sober, you'll actually start to feel like you've had more than few. What is this phenomena? I think that Box Kitchen just hits the drunk food mark so perfectly, that ever single top drunk food experience will come flooding back and you body will have trouble understanding that something is missing. How could something taste this good if you haven't been out all night?!

I'm not gonna lie - While I was in SF this past week, I hit up Box Kitchen twice in one day, and no, I am not ashamed. 

Trip 1. Got myself the chicken and waffles. A hard combination to find in Calgary if you're looking for effort put into the two most important aspects, being Chicken and Waffles. Box Kitchen does it right and taught me a new way of life. I never really understood the American fandom to this mix until I tried box chicken's, I mean Box Kitchen's (see?! they're already messing me up!) Chicken & waffles... People! The saltiness of the fried chicken works with the waffles in a very similar way to bacon. I'm not saying chicken is better than bacon, in fact, I never would, but I will say that it keeps up. It's a re-defining genera. Go ahead and pour the syrup over everything. The two of them hold their own, but are happier when you blend them.

The waffles? Soft. Fluffy. Crispy. Magnificent.
The chicken? Juicy. Tender. Crispy. Magnificent.
Put them together and you've got a home run, or a #WINNING sports analogy of your choosing.

Trip 2.
Late night, super tired albeit sober fast food craving. This led me to realize that Box Kitchen is NOT fast food, but in fact good food, fast. 
I got the Chicken Caesar Sando - hold your horses scaredy cat - a Sando is really just a sandwich... on a bun, maybe? I don't really know the difference, but that made it all the more enjoyable. The same delish deep fried chicken breast I had experienced early was now on a sandwich, covered by some American-style creamy coleslaw. Failing to find a spot to park our tushes inside Tempest, the neighbouring bar the Box Kichen Serves as a regular kitchen for, we parked our butts curbside to consume some chicken. Yup. I'd shove a Box Kitchen Chicken Sando in my face curbside - ignoring the stench of street-side urine, the Sando is one deliciously mean chicken bun-wich.

I can't wait to go back. Lunch, dinner, all the way to the latest of late nights, (open until 1am, Box kitchen is definitely worth a visit and I cant wait to return the next time I'm in San Fran.

Good night neverland!
author: Dale E.

description:
Gee, I wish I was a rudely impatient SoMa slacker like the ones who seem to hover around this modest evening operation next to the Tempest nightclub. They just shove themselves in front of you as you are about to order and then smoke next to you and look at their cell phones until their food is ready. I just wonder how the poor guy inside the place stands dealing with the crap-fest of customers that come here. He operates the Eat Box all by his lonesome and does a heroic job serving up what I would describe as funky twists on carnival fare.

On the menu are such delectable goodies like wings, garlic fries, pulled pork sandwiches, 'pour'-boy burgers, and fried pickles. All the good stuff you would find after you knock down only two of the milk bottles in the midway. It was hard to decide, especially since it was pitch-black at 7:30PM in the Natoma alleyway where I felt like I was about to be cut. But despite the odds, I chose two tantalizing items - Aron's Little Wiener (misspelled as 'Weiner' on the chalkboard), just $5, and the $6 Chicken in Waffles. This is when the army of praying mantises started contaminating the landscape.

Twenty minutes elapsed, but the wait seems reasonable since the guy behind the window prepares the food one order at a time. You can even watch him make everything from scratch with his deep fryer going full gonzo at that hour. I took it to go since I ain't eatin' in that alley with the smoking slackers. I trundled home with my food and was pleasantly surprised. I didn't know that Chicken in Waffles actually meant 'chicken in waffles' or more accurately, waffle sticks (see photo). Referring to the poultry as 'chicken carnitas', he used real pieces of shredded chicken since I actually ran into a bone in one of the waffles.

It came with a zingy siracha maple syrup, which I thought was a nice touch for all the sweetness involved. I especially liked Aron's little asset (no offense, Aron) since it turned out to be a set of mini-corn dogs that used higher-end sausages and mixed bits of jalapeno in the batter. They were delicious with an aggressive dunking into the spicy aioli (see photo). What a nice surprise this little closet operation turned out to be. It may be worth tolerating the slacker mantises. I just need to bring a big can of Raid next time I venture into the bowels of the Natoma alley.

FOOD - 4 stars...creative twists on bite-size food you'd find in the midway of a carnival...only tastier with a kick
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...well, it is a dark alley with a lot of hostile slackers
SERVICE - 4 stars...but the guy operating the place was terrific and a solid cook
TOTAL - 4 stars...it is indeed an eat box
author: Ed U.

description:
...

Leave it to the shockingly incredible food from a dive's kitchen to be the one surprising thing is San Francisco. I mean, I've seem a human being shit on the street, and it's the menu at Box that leaves me speechless.

Roasted potato skins topped with crisped pork belly and, oh, a quail egg because yes. Garlicky herbed fries are a thing everyone does, and Box is everyone just as much as anyone, only they do them like nobody else. There's not enough room for potato - every spud shoot is just saturated with outrageously essenced confit fatty fat. And sprankle of vergetation. Sorry, mouth's full of delicious memories.

Finally, those Brussels sprouts. Stuff of legend. Yeah, there were spicy-sweet sesame wings, big and meaty and all that, but the sprouts stole the show. I mean dropped the mic, walked off stage, didn't need an encore, stole the show. I don't know what magic sweet and tannic blend they drizzle over those hearty, caramelized cabbage juniors, but it's just... right. These are a must. Order them always. Order them if your teeth are Brussels sprouts and you're not sure which will side will give on your first bite (spoiler alert: who cares? Get real teeth.)

If you're tipsy on Tempest, this food will taste fantastic. If you're high on life, it will still taste fantastic. You deserve fantastic food.
author: Damien S.

description: Chicken sando, garlic parmesan and Brussels sprouts! That's what I had. The brussel sprouts would be better if there were minimal drizzle of the vinaigrette dressing, there was too much that it tasted sour. The chicken sandwich was bomb! And the fries, couldn't complain. I think we waited about 20 mins, it was around 11pm when we got there. I would say $10 for just a burger is pretty pricey, you can get a plate of meal elsewhere but it wasn't bad to try it out.
author: Jackie L.

description:
There are enough rave reviews of the food (especially the chicken sando, potato skins, burger), so I won't be a broken record. However, not only is the food really yummy, the service at this hole in the wall far surpasses its humble appearance (and many real sit-down restaurants).

Came here on a Thursday night to pick up dinner for two - burger, potato skins, chicken sando... and a beet salad so that we wouldn't feel like complete carnivores. After a relatively short wait, the nice cashier told us that she couldn't fulfill our salad order cuz they ran out of beets. While many places would've simply just said "sorry, we ran out," what did Box Kitchen do differently? Box still gave us a perfectly fine salad (minus some beets), apologized for it, AND gave us the full refund of the salad back!

Five star service (and food) from the most unexpected little food stall in an alleyway next to a dive bar.
author: Lanisa W.

description: Delicious food with gourmet ingredients like grilled cheese with manchego and honey, or twists on traditional food like macaroni and cheese egg rolls and Mexican style corn on the cob . We liked that we could call it in, pickup at the order window and eat on our hotels outdoor terrace.
author: Dee C.

description: We had yelped this place prior to arriving our first day in SF, and had no idea what we were into!!  Our flight came in late, around 10 pm, so we had limited options near our hotel.  We took a LYFT to this place, which is ACTUALLY a WINDOW...just FYI to folks who are not from SF.  The area is a little sketchy, but it was all erased once we took our first bite.  We had the chicken tostadas which were INCREDIBLE!  We would definitely come back here again!
author: Brissa I.

description:
Best burger in SF! 

Awesome flavorful burger, from bun to bun! The party was juicy, crispy shallots were amazing, and the fries are the best!!!
author: Jeff C.

description: The burger here is pretty damn good! I don't know if it's cuz it was one of the first places I ate at when I moved to SF or what, but I have a sweet spot for the food here. You can get it and eat next door at the Tempest and the guys are hella nice. Love it!
author: Mariecar M.

description: This place is literally a window in a wall of a super sketch alley --- but the food is on point. The potato skins with pork belly were delicious. And the box burger hit the spot after a long day of studying. Now I understand why this place is super packed. Also, if you have drunchies and are in the SOMA, this is the place to stop by, because they work super late.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Some of the best food that I have come across in San Francisco, so far. 

Here for a week and attempting to try as many local food places as I can, this is one of the best I have tried. Garlic Parm fries are addictive, the box burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had, and the potato skins were amazing. Can't wait to go back and taste some more food from the menu.
author: Terry H.
