description: Instructions for amazing burgers/fries: Go to Box Kitchen window next to the Tempest Bar; order great burger-related fare at the window; go next door, order your first beer and drink until your food is ready; get food bring it back and order second beer; enjoy. Burger wasn't oversized and it was cooked to perfection when I ordered med/rare. Very tasty!! Garlic fries were a perfect match with the burger and the beers.
author: Ken K.

description:
My friends and I got into town late. By the time we checked into our hotel, we just wanted to find some delicious local spot that was still open. Fellow yelpers led us to Box Kitchen. All the dishes sounded great, but execution fell short (and hence the 2 stars.) 

This place is located in SOMA, in a small quiet street, right next to a bar. Apparently people buy food here to bring over to the bar next door. This place is literally a hole in the wall. You order and pick up your food through the same window. There are no seats, only a small bar top for you to quickly inhale the food, or the sidewalk. There are a lot of smokers around that window, either waiting for their food or just from the bar next door, so get use to the smell. 

We tried a few things but none of it was memorable. By the time we got there, they were out of the burger and the chicken sandwich. I was really looking forward to the Chicken IN Waffles from all the reviews I read before, but I was highly disappointed. The waffles were soft and sort of soggy, not crispy exterior and fluffy interior. There was so little chicken that I didn't even taste any chicken flavor. The maple syrup was suppose to be sriracha maple syrup, but it tasted like regular sweet maple syrup. So what was suppose to be awesome waffles with chicken inside with spicy and sweet maple syrup turned into regular soggy waffles with regular maple syrup. Not very exciting even for a starving person who just got off a plane. 

The chicharrons were ok. The buffalo wings had a good kick but was a bit salty for my taste. Overall, I think this place has high ratings because people are drunk and/or high. If you're sober, you're probably better off going somewhere else.
author: Vickie C.

description: My boyfriend and I were a little lost looking for this but we found it just as they were about to open! We're from out of town so we saw that this had good reviews so we decided to check it out. Like I said we were lost so we didn't really know how it worked. We ended up eating next to their door because we were confused about being able to eat at the bar next door. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles, waffles were amazing (who can mess up waffles right!?) and he said the chicken was okay. I had the box burger which was okay, a little greasy but yummy!
author: Alejandra M.

description: This place has amazing food.  Walk up to the door and, prepare to get blown away.  Got the burger, brussel sprouts and potatoes skins.  This is hand crafted top notch eats in a funky back alley setting right next to the Tempest bar ( which is a killer little dive bar with loads of cool ).  Gotta love places like this, great folks making great food.  You won't be disappointed. Gonna go back for the chicken and waffles soon!
author: Bill V.

description:
Box Kitchen is so clutch when it comes to late night dining.  The best way to describe this place is upscale bar food.  The place has no seats; it's a box... but the food that comes out will surprise you.  You don't even have to be drunk to appreciate the goodness. 

My favorite items here are: the poutine, chicken in waffles with sriracha syrup, elote, and brussels sprouts.  Recently, I tried the ranch chicken wings with buffalo sauce, which is now my new favorite.

Some notes: 
- There's typically a wait for the food since good food takes time
- It's linked to the Tempest, which probably has the cheapest drinks in the city. You can order food at Box and bring it to the Tempest to drink.
- Menu changes all the time, so try something new!
author: Candace C.

description:
Get. The. Elote.
This is hands down the best corn I've ever eaten in my life. Not only it is interesting (which I can't say about most corn-centered  meals in my life), it is delicious. 
I went to this place twice, and I've never been disappointed. The service is courteous and the pub food is just great. You can just carry it into the Tempest bar next door and have it with some beer. This is what we did anyway.
The menu changes frequently, so it stays interesting. I would also recommend their falafel wrap, their garlic fries, and the brussels sprouts, when they are on the menu.
author: Valentine A.

description: Went there last week, and I loved the bacon cheese burger, and the garlic sticks as well, pretty good place, just had to wait a little bit for someone to place the order, moreover the establishment was sort of crowded. But it`s ok.
author: Emily T.

description:
Burgers and garlic fries here are mouth watering.  

They don't have seating or beer but you can always grab your food and walk next door to the Tempest for beer and drinks!
author: Lauren T.

description:
Pros:
- buffalo wings
- hush puppies
- sriracha maple syrup
- literally a hole in the wall (you order from one side of a door)

Cons:
- chicken IN waffles (chicken flavor isn't pronounced; waffles are soggy)
- the foods are sit down foods (require 2 hands to eat and 1 to carry the tray)
- slow-ish service
- no seating
- dingy neighborhood

Bottom line: good bar food. Box is probably better as a snack than as a meal because of the lack of seating and portion size. I would go back for the wings.
author: Jiann M.

description:
This hidden place is one of the best hamburgers place I ate. 
Small window in middle of nowhere but yet very busy say it all. The Box Burger is tick juicy and seasoned perfectly. Whoever knows me know that I have weakness for hamburgers and I will look for them everywhere I go (even if it is French restaurant ) and when I find one like this place I will share it with the world. 
You can skip the fries, but you might want a pickle  fries instead. 
Worth to come here and eat in this great place.
author: Eitan Z.

description:
The location is strange, in the middle of a dead street... Parking is prevalent but didn't seem to be a safe place to leave your car at night or to walk by yourself alone. It's a few blocks from the hubbub of the main intersection. 

It actually IS in a hole in the wall but we were surprised to see a huge line forming for this place. Affordable late night munchies!

Adam Jo's BBQ Pork Sando - Yum, we love our pulled pork! 
Aaron's Little Weiners - Different and inventive. Never tried corn dog battered sausages before but these are top dogs!
author: Nicki F.

description:
Upsides:

-This place is right next to a bar
-Decent prices for what you get
-They have a fried chicken and waffle combo thing (it's literally fried chicken IN the waffle) on the menu that comes with sriracha maple syrup to dip it in.
-They have tacos on the menu
-Small business = support

Downsides:

-Did I get some undesirable parts of the chicken in my meal? Because some parts were chewy and seemed like I would avoid them at all costs if it were a literal piece of fried chicken
-Hot men doing CrossFit running up and down the street while I eat my fried chicken and waffles washed down with a beer. Makes me feel like a fatty.

Next upsides:

-Beer makes me not care anymore about the hot men. 
-Soaked up any ounce of a hangover.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Just an fyi, it's basically a drive thru. You walk up, order and in about 10 mins or so pure gold is ready to be put in your mouth. 

Amazing food for a fair price.

Burger (perfectly cooked with so much flavor) w/fries
Falafel (for you semi-healthy eaters)
Tacos (so much flavor)
Wings (who doesn't love wings)

No real place to sit and eat, but it seems you can bring it next door to Tempest and eat while washing it down with a beer.

So simple yet so good.
author: Brian S.

description: Tried box burger with fries, should have tried garlic fries with parm cheese. Awesome medium rare burger
author: Ron S.

description: The restaurant was a bit hard to locate. You had to go into Tempest, which was a bar, to order. I decided to eat there before I realized that the entire place smelled like old beer. It's a bar, why would I expect anything different.  The food was good and the presentation was quite delightful.
author: Maria L.

description:
Warning: This is a bad story with an even worse ending. Read at your own risk. 

So I rollz into Box Kitchen quietly, just minding my own business last week.  Like the sweetheart that I am, I quietly ordered a Box Burger and the Brussels Sprouts to-go, because I am also very busy. 

I give the cashier my debit card, which admittedly has a rather adorable yet dated picture of me and a purse that I have since accidentally destroyed.  Man, I really miss that purse.  The blonde-haired, green-eyed cashier then told me I look "older" now than I did in that BofA ATM card picture. 
...
...
...

Mother frakker.  Of course I look "older" than in my mother frakking ATM picture, which was taken when I was 21, full of dreams, determination and self esteem. Now that I'm 2 degrees older (and much smarter yet still quixotically sexy), I resent any references to my dated ATM picture. Did I mention this dude then proceeded to ask me to dinner? Bananas. 

Please be advised that my order for a nutritionally terrible burger does not constitute a solicitation for comments on my appearance. Men: please understand that any negative reference to a woman's appearance, age or weight is tantamount to the following statement: "I do not wish to have sex at any time in the near future." 

Anyhow, the burger was bacony but overcooked.  The Brussels Sprouts were admittedly delicious, but will likewise put the kibosh on any sexual aspirations in your not-so-distant future. The carnitas tacos are the clear winner in this situation. Delicious, yet fragrance free. 

I just don't know what else to tell you. Message me if you need further assistance, I guess.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Box, you are SO good, but oh so bad for me. Living a block away from Box, I've been here many, many times. I went to Tempest with a coworker this past weekend and after our dumb (obviously drunk) idea to take shots of fireball, I wanted to introduce him to Box. We ordered the burger, garlic fries, and something else. I say something else because I woke up the next morning and there were 3 boxes on my kitchen counter and one of them was completely cleaned out. It obviously was good. Too bad I don't remember what I ordered. I didn't finish the fries or burger, so I knew I ordered those 2 items. Anyways, the next day the first thing my coworker asks:

Coworker: "Did you finish the burger?"
Me: "Obviously, the next morning"
Coworker: "Good, I was really worried you threw it out."
Me: "You were more worried about the burger than my well being?"
Coworker: "Yeah, it was a REALLY good burger."

Burger is good. Get it. Also, I've had the food here sober many times so I can testify that it's good anytime of the day.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I'm so sorry I ate the box burger before I had a chance to take a picture. I am literally typing this right after I just finished it. 

Every part of it was spot on. It was an amazing burger (and not because I was starving). The bun was delicious, patty was seasoned perfectly, there were bacon bits, onion straws, and a bit of arugula to top it off. It was not what I expected from literally a hole in the wall. If you're going at night, be mindful of the neighborhood. It's worth it though!! 

Now to wash my burger hands.
author: Lynn T.

description: The best cheeseburger that you've ever bought from a window in the wall of an alley. Maybe try the quail egg potato skins? Open ridiculously late, which is rare.
author: Maya J.

description: One of the best burgers I've had in SF. Juicy, flavorful and huge. It beats out a lot of $15 - $20 burger spots that claim themselves to be the best burger in the city.
author: Ai N.

description:
I had just awaken from the backseat of my friend's car, when he told us he was going to drop us off to make a few rounds on Uber. Not knowing how long he would take the best option seemed to be finding a place to eat and kill time. 

I was just a few blocks from Box Kitchen so I decided within 5 minutes of waking up that I wanted to come try this place. 

The hole in the wall, in a dark alley of a sketchy neighborhood gives this place a lot of character. I love finding places like these. 

I ordered the box burger, 
A chicken sandwich and garlic fries. 

It looks like the menu changes often because I didn't see any chicken and waffles or chicken sando. 

I had one friend with me so we split everything. The burger was really good and I suggest skipping the chicken sandwich. 

The bun was toasted. 
The bacon garlic gastrique gave it a nice bacon flavor without needing big strips of bacon in the burger, strips of bacon can be hard to manage.

The garlic fries were ok. I think I could have settled with regular fries. They were pretty crispy too.

They also let you bring the food into the bar next door.
author: Henry C.

description: This is quite possibly the best take-out food I have ever eaten... in my life. We ordered the Elote and Falafel Patty Melt. The Elote was a flavor rush with the combination of the garlic aioli, queso fresco, cilantro, and jalapeño. The Patty Melt was the perfect combination of sweet and savory, with the falafel cooked nice and crispy to give the sandwich texture. The order took about 12 minutes, and we're going back tomorrow for the nachos. Definitely swing by this place if you're in SoMa.
author: Ian S.

description: Had a fried chicken sandwich from this joint while drinking at Tempest. It was great! Considering that this is basically a kitchen serving food on the sidewalk it exceeded my expectation. Pork belly potato skins are one of the best comfort food dishes I've ever had. Crispy crust, generous helping of pork belly all around delicious. Service is generally good and quick, portions are generous, and you can do take out over to Tempest, great next door dive bar.
author: Lonnie S.

description:
My fiancé introduced me to this place. Literally a hole in the wall. He really likes the burger there and I have to admit it's pretty good. Not the best ever though. 

They have a menu posted on the wall outside and there was a line when we got there. Appears to be a pretty popular place. Not a great area for parking though and definitely no place to sit outside besides the bar next door, on the curb or on a bench that's outside the bar. 

We got a burger and a fried chicken sandwich. The again burger was pretty good. Very juicy and greasy which is what makes it tastier to some. But I prefer a little bit more quality meat. Probably a bit more medium rare. The bacon on top gives it some additional grease and flavor. Not much vegetables in the bun and the bun itself is ok. The fried chicken sandwich is nothing special. Pretty decent quality. But again nothing out of ordinary.

I give this place a three star because the quality is good but nothing special. Given the difficulty of the location and crowdedness of the bar next door, it is not a convenient spot. Most likely I won't go back here again because I have to go out of my way to get here and their food is good but not the best. 

So I recommend this place only if you can get a good spot to sit and eat at the bar next door and only if you can walk there and don't have to drive around to find parking.
author: Anahita Y.

description:
This place might be the #1 thing I miss about SF. 

You walk up past a small window and chalkboard menu to order. I don't know if I would even have noticed it unless it was pointed out to me.

I was told that despite being in/near/partnered with a dive bar, Box strives to combine fresh, whole ingredients and merge street food with haute (maybe not exactly, but high-end) cuisine. 

They nailed it. The garlic fries are in every single other person's review for a reason. Order them.

I went with a falafel wrap. Lettuce, tomato, hummus, tazitiki (which I asked to be kept off), feta in lavash. What came advertised as lettuce was really a blend of amazing greens, among them arugula. I can't rave about this wrap enough-- it was huge and delicious. 

If more bars served food like this, people would never be forced to attend a 24 hour crappy chain restaurant again. Viva la Box.
author: Trisha F.

description: Great menu.  You will want a least one of everything!  My favorite is the burger.  Honestly, it's better than Marlowe's.  Yes, Marlowe is great, but what Box Kitchen does is just more tasty.  It's not 'drunk' good either, this is a straight up excellent burger.  I've never had a bad experience there, though the walk to and from is SF gritty.  Watch your step!
author: Ken H.

description: I don't often give 5s for burgers, and would have said this is a solid 4 stars for me but then I had one of the best burgers I've had in recent memory. The burger was well seasoned (peppery and salty but not overly so), had a bacon shallot gastrique, arugula, spinach, melted cheese and fried shallots. It was unique, juicy, tasty as hell, and just satisfying. Would definitely recommend the burger.
author: Will H.

description: Excellent brussel sprouts! Great service and relaxing atmosphere. It's tucked back down a weird street and inside Tempest bar
author: J. H.

description: Great drunk food and I love that it's made by scratch just didn't have the wow factor. If I had the drunk munches I would give it 5 stars but I was the DD
author: Jonathan W.

description: I had the tempest yesterday. I had the tempest today. I will have the tempest tomorrow. The garlic aioli sauce makes all the difference in this sandwich. Just a caveat as evident in most sunny side up egg sandwiches, the yolk will explode upon squeezing it so careful not to get your pants dirty with this one. These sandwiches are always a runny yolk mess but a mess that only adds to the delicious texture or everything you are consuming. The bar itself has good music, good vibes, love it!
author: Daryl M.

description: The chicken and waffles are awesome, although it could be a little spicier. The waffles themselves are insanely good and are made with Miller high life. Totes worth the wait!
author: John O.

description: Food was very average and cost kind of high for just a sandwich. I ordered a side of garlic fries but got plain cold fries. You can order to go or you can get your food and eat at the bar next door. I would not recommend eating here unless if you are really starving and are already in the bar next door.
author: Gigi M.

description: Hands down THEE BEST burger I've ever had!!! Do not let the hole in the wall places fool you, they are often better than those 5 star restaurants  with high priced menus, two items on your plate and no seasoning on your food! Lol I cannot wait to go back to this place ssssoooo mad I just found out about them! Thank you Yelp!!!
author: Brittany C.

description:
Me and my wife took a trip to the city to have a late night dinner. Stumbled upon The Box via yelp. Driving down the alley we were a bit skeptical, but there it was, small and hidden. We tried the pork adobo tacos, garlic fries, fried chicken sandwich and garlic fries.

As all the yelpers have noted the garlic fries are a must and worth the $5.  I have to say that I will be back for the potato skins, they were on hit, loved the tangy cream sauce drizzled on them. The pork adobo in the tacos were tender and the flavor pushed through the salsa and aioli sauce. The fried chicken on the sando was nice and crispy. The slaw in it was also very tasty without overpowering the flavors in the chicken batter. A MUST visit spot for any foodie.
author: Ces C.

description:
Yessss the perfect late night spot that is literally a hole in the wall- or maybe a square in the wall..? 

The burger was flavorful, juicy and just so much goodness. The wait is a good 10 minutes especially a little longer when you come during rush hour. But it's cool, I don't mind waiting for good food- totally worth it.
author: Kim P.

description:
Bravo to the design of the operation, providing us with affordable prices where we can take risks and order adventurously without breaking our bank.  Sure, we didn't like everything we tried, but at least we weren't angry about paying through the nose for it.  I've gone three times now and can give you my subjective rundown on most of the menu:

Burger:  juicy, and great satisfying thickness.  The bun is delicious on its own too--soaked with the burger juice, bacon, and sophisticated dark greens.  Of the three times we've gotten it, it was incredible once, it was taken home and not bad, and it was pretty good.  Overall, Umami is better in terms of taste and consistency (it is ALWAYS good), but this burger is about 60% of the price.

Brussel Sprouts:  Excellent.  Similar to Starbelly and Hi Lo BBQ (when they had it) etc.  Satisfying cruciferous fiber with a heady balance of sweet/sour

Pork adobo tacos.  If you like generous meat and deliciously pickled vegetables, this is really good.  \I actually had to take half of the meat off to balance  it out.  1st world problems.

Fries/Garlic Fries:  Delicious, done right

Waffle/Chicken:  Probably the most exciting sounding thing on the menu.  Not bad.  On our serving, there was a slight sparsity of chicken bits.  But it is fun and thoughtfully made.  The waffles are also made fresh to order, which you can taste.

Biscuit breakfast sandwich:  pretty much what you think, except the english muffin is a bit on steroids.  Sort of like a panaroma bakery english muffin--the muffin mass overwhelmed the other tasty components.  The touch of seaweed inside was elegant.  I should've put some of the extra meat from the pork adobo tacos in this huge muffin.  There's a dirty joke in there somewhere...

Fried Chicken Sandwich:  The fried chicken is a nice thick breast.  It's very white, but a bit bland (didn't taste brined?).  All the fixings around it are delicious (just like with the burger). We ended up taking the chicken out and finishing off the bun/toppings.

Wings: standard, salty.  The vinegar smells awesome.  I wish these were as exceptional as the burger.  Maybe they could throw in some korean style wings (just adjust the sauce!)

Potato skins:  if you look through other reviews, I'm probably the only person who did not like this dish.  In great part, it may have been to us taking out--and the dish losing its crunch and heat.  Besides that, for us, there were too many toppings that were not discernable, and a slightly fishy taste (maybe from the quail egg).  I won't bother trying it again, but probably better eaten IN rather than taking home.

Also, the bar next door was a more than fine place to eat the food.  If you order a lot of food, tell them it's "to go." That way you can stack the plates on top of each other more easily as you make your way through the crowded bar.

Free parking around, esp after 6 pm.  Also, if you're lucky, there's a wild flock of corporate runners going through Natoma alley (and back) at about 555 pm.
author: Philip L.

description:
Dropped in one night after a nearby photo shoot, because my model friend loves Southern food, and was craving chicken and waffles (strange contrast, I know). So the two of us ordered their burger, chicken and waffles, garlic fries, and chiccarones, and brought it back to my place since Box was literally a hole in the wall without any seating available.

And, well, everything was damn tasty! The burger and the garlic fries were the stars of the bunch, while the other two were good, but more interesting than anything else: the chicken and waffles were actually more chicken IN waffle batter, and the chiccarones could be likened to the shrimp chips you sometimes get at Thai restaurants, but, crispier, saltier, and tangier.

I suppose it's a good thing that they don't have proper seating, because I'd be coming here a lot more than I should otherwise! Great for a normal meal, but stellar for those of you who get the munchies after a late night of drinking.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - There's not really much of an accessibility issue with Box, because it's nothing more than a hole (window) in the wall. Grab and go, unless you want to hang out in the alley with whatever other characters are there at the time.

Bathroom - Pretty sure they didn't have one, unless you count a dark corner in the alley.
author: Johnny W.

description:
First off... This place is located next to Tempest, a dive bar. I missed it while driving but found it once I parked and was on foot.

I had time kill before an appointment, but not too much time where I could go to The Front Porch, and was cravingggg chicken and waffles so I came here based on reviews.

First off, the chicken is literally inside the waffle. It's like a shredded chicken with an Asian fusion sort of vibe, especially with the paired Siracha maple syrup.
I honestly did not like the syrup concoction but then again I'm not huge on Siracha so everyone else probably digs it.
The waffle just seemed so soggy and didn't really have flavor I could taste unless I got a piece with chicken and then again there's not much chicken.
Did not satisfy my desire for chicken and waffles.

The Elote however... Woooo! Right up my ally. Probably because it reminded me of the Mexican corn they'd have outside of church when I was a young girl.
It has a nice aioli with cheese and a sauce.
The best part was it was crunchy and one whole corn split in half.

My boyfriend had the fried mac and cheese balls. We were so excited for them, we don't mess with our Mac and cheese love.
They were good but sadly only 3 of them. They come with cheese curds and they were weird tasting. Wouldn't get again.

We bet other things are amazing like the other reviews say... But I just don't know if I'll go back here again unless I come back to this area and am in need for food but not for me to drive from the marina district to here.
author: Eff B.

description:
It is 2am. You are not sober. You know you will regret eating the Tempest sandwich (fried egg, kale, garlic aioli buns with a whole lotta sauce) and fried Brussels sprouts the next morning. But at the moment that you devour your food, you don't care. Because everything is so delicious. 

Cue the following morning and do you still regret it? A little. It was just that one time, you tell yourself. And it is...until the next time.
author: Mina K.

description: Great food! It's just as the name calls it and is a door food place. The menu is small, but nice and I loved the hardiness of it. Very juicy and great food for lunch, dinner or the munchies after drinking next door at the bar.
author: Devika B.

description: Ok first off this place is amazing. But however if you are walking from the bart area do not go down 6th unless you feel like getting robbed ghetto as hell. We made that mistake but survived and found this wonderful literally hidden gem. Its a lot like a dive bar with nice music and atmosphere. Nice staff :) we got the box burgers and they were amazing and very filling.  Probably one of the better burgers I've  had and I have been to some real nice places. GREAT FOR THOSE WHO WANT A SUPPER YUMMY BURGER AND DON'T MIND GETTING GREASE ON THEIR HANDS.
author: Chelsie B.

description:
A hole in the wall... literally!

Looking around for some late night eats and found this place on Yelp. 

The place seemed a little sketchy because it's down a dark alley next to a dive bar surrounded by drunk people. If a place like this was in San Jose, you deeeefinitely shouldn't be there. But this is San Francisco. It's a totally different vibe!

First off, the drunk people surrounding the place are pretty nice and friendly. Everyone is drunk, but they're all happy that they get to chow down on the goodies coming out of Box. 

Second, the menu choices at Box are different from the typical late night fare. Chicken confit? Sriracha maple syrup? Bacon shallot gastrique?? HUH? O_O I'm definitely not at Jack in the Box!

You MUST try the garlic fries. The BEST garlic fries I've ever had. Yes, even better than Gilroy. There's REAL garlic flavor. And the garlic isn't just sprinkled on top. It must be in the oil because you can really taste it in every bite of fries! Most of the fries come out crispy, but even the not-so-crispy ones taste good!

The roasted potato skins were sooooo good. Roasted potato halves filled with chunks of crispy pork belly and topped with cheese and a fried quail egg. Talk about elevated! I wish every place made potato skins like this! 

The goat cheese and bacon potato croquettes are also a good choice. The bacon inside still stays crispy in the middle. Love the addition of the goat cheese and the homemade salsa just ties everything together. 

The chicken IN waffle was a surprise! You might think it's the typical friend chicken and waffle, but instead of making it a knife-and-fork situation, they actually put the chicken inside the waffle itself. Handheld and yummy! The Sriracha maple syrup was a nice touch!

Sometimes the wait can be a little long when the kitchen gets backed up, but the wait is worth it!

With food like this available late at night, who needs fast food anyway? Move over Burger King, Box is here to stay!
author: Daisy T.

description: Some of the best chicken and waffles I have ever had!!! Husband loved the tamales with chillie!! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!!
author: Tarynn S.

description:
The best burger in San Francisco. Seriously, the first time I had the Box Burger I was drunk and I worried that going back it wouldn't have the same effect. Wrong! The second time I was dead sober and it was just as good!

Always a treat to go to Box Kitchen, pick up some grub, and go next door for a nice time at the Tempest (which has great prices, a good beer list, and an interesting crowd!, great for Dubs games too. Yes, the alley "feels" a little sketchy but it's really not bad and there's always folks hanging out, waiting for their food. This is a serious gem
author: Lucas S.

description:
This is an alleyway in SoMa, run outside of a little window, next to Tempest bar. It holds late night hours, and the food was really good! I will be back as it's in my 'hood.

They were out of the chicharones unfortunately; I'll have to try those next time. The two of us ordered the burger (with fries for $2 extra), the potato skins, and the chicken and waffles.

Potato Skins:
Wow! The potato skins really hit it out of the park! 
They're a little pricey at $9 for only 3, but they were so amazing! How can you go wrong with pork belly with an egg on top! They were perfection and worth the splurge!

Burger:
The burger was really good and juicy. The fries were great too with just the right amount of crisp and garlic. 

Chicken and Waffles:
One of the chefs recommended this item, so we ordered it, but I did not care for it. The chicken is inside the waffle, but I couldn't really taste it. It was covered in powdered sugar and was too sweet for my palate. 
The Sriracha maple syrup was very good though, and I don't like syrup, so that's saying something. The spice in it was very nice. 
I've tried chicken and waffles a few times now at various places and I just don't think I'm into them, so take my review on this item with a grain of salt.

Box Kitchen also serves lunch inside Tempest, and Tempest told me they really "class it up with black tablecloths." The lunch menu looked good. Also, Tempest apparently serves free food on Sundays during football games, so that sounds fun! I'm guessing it's food from Box (so it'd be good), but I have not confirmed that.
author: Rebecca G.

description: I live a couple blocks away and eat here often.  I've had the entire menu and everything is very good.  The potato skins and chicken sando are exceptional!  My friends love the poppers and garlic fries.  I've never had anything bad.  Tempest the bar next door is a good place to eat your food in a unique atmosphere.  Also, the people are super nice and good takes only 10-12 minutes.
author: Paul C.

description:
If you're drunk, this place is 5-stars.  No seating--literally a hole in the wall.

For late night grease food, it's everything it should be, perhaps minus a dollar or so. People working the counter are usually pretty solid as well.
author: Dan K.

description:
Literally a hole in the wall. We got to-go boxes but apparently, you can also eat at Tempest, the bar next door.

For sides, they had fried mac and cheese balls, which was really good though they give you ones that are just cheese too. Surprisingly, the Brussels sprouts were even better! Definitely worth a try

There's a couple of vegetarian options. I got the eggplant parmigiana sub, which was pretty good. A little oily & messy and I've had better versions of this sandwich elsewhere, but would still go back for those,
author: Pallavi K.

description: I had the corn dogs and I literally can't say enough good things. Had a few other things, also so good. You can leave and go in the alley and socialize and stlll love it, tempest is a Locals bar in the bet way
author: Blair W.

description:
$5 side of brussel sprouts from heaven.

I highly doubt there was an ounce of anything remotely healthy in them, but again I repeat: brussel sprouts, FROM HEAVEN.

#winning
author: Anjali V.

description:
I'd hate to be so negative, but I honestly don't understand what the craze is about this place. I would have to agree with the former reviewer that the food is probably good if you're drunk.

I had the box burger, the boyfriend had the fried chicken sando and we had the potato skins. I didn't try his sandwich, but none of it was that great. The burger was moderately ok and extremely greasy. The potato skins tasted kind of gross to me, and everything felt like it had 3 lbs of salt in it.

But I'm sure if I was drunk or baked it would be more appealing.
author: Jennifer A.

description: My favorite is the Hamburger & GarlicNCheese Fries. Its more healthy then McDonalds and Burger King. Its also near my place.
author: Glen W.

description: Stopped in for a bite while we were drinking next door at Tempest.  The burger was fantastic and the garlic fries were a great match (my inebriated friends definitely agreed).  My guy enjoyed the falafel wrap.  Great late night bar food.
author: Michelle K.

description: Hard to overstate how good this place is. The food is just wonderful. Simply put, there is no better burger and fries in downtown San Francisco than the Box Burger and Fries...and certainly not for the paltry $10 they charge. That's right, ten bucks flat including tax (but not tip, just the tip). It would be a bargain at twice the price. And the other delicacies on the rotating menu are worth a few bucks and your sense of adventure. Particularly the Chicken In Waffles with Siracha syrup. Grab a bite at this late nite walk up and a beer at the Tempest next door (you can eat the food in the bar) and you are guaranteed a San Francisco experience of the highest order. Not just recommended, it's a rite of passage. If you love food, you can't skip this spot.
author: Jabba T.

description: Didn't expect the place to look like this. The location is a bit sketchy, but cool at the same time. As for the food, it was extremely good but a little pricey!
author: Michelle H.

description:
This place is awesome! The guy that took our order was super funny and real nice. He keeps you updated as you wait about how much longer it's going to take them to get your food out. 

Don't be fooled by the fact that this place doesn't look like a five star restaurant! The food in my book is five star quality. The burger was delicious and not over seasoned. You really get to taste the meat. And all the condiments added to the burger were fresh and delicious too.

Even the fries were freshly done and delicious.

The wings are also real good. They were freshly  made and the wing sauce was deliciously spicy. 

If I was a local, I would visit this place often. Since I'm only visiting SF for the weekend, I plan to hit this place one more time before saying good bye to San Fran.
author: Sonia C.

description: I was at a concert at the Mezzanine this past Monday and was starving after the show. Lucky for me, Box Kitchen was only a few blocks away and didn't close until 1am! Ordered the Potato Skins ($10), Chicken and Waffles ($12), and Garlic Parm Fries ($3 as a side). I highly recommend the Potato Skins! Definitely the highlight from my late night meal!
author: Kevin Joseph A.

description:
Wow.  Some friends have told me that they serve the best burger in town.  I didn't believe it but it is true.  That is what you order here. 

It is all about the fried onions in there. I'm telling you.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Mark M.

description:
WHAT??!!!

This place, oh, I mean "window" to food heaven is amazing.  All the 5-star reviews are spot-on.  If you dare to walk off the beaten path (be bold, it's not that bad), you'll truly be lured by The Tempest's little sister on the alley, Box Kitchen; the illusion and skillful manipulation of the Tempest Bar (attached).  It's about the size of a large cardboard box that we used to make playhouse's out of and what delivers through the Box window will make you cry for more.  The Elote (corn kernels off the cob cooked and seasoned to perfection) is delicious.  The Box Burger is cooked to perfection and dripping in it's own juices layered with the freshest accompanying ingredients.  

Next - the potato skins with a quail egg on top!?  Ahhhhhh - Dive Decadence!  The fried chicken sandwich is also off the hook.

Enough said - take it to go, eat on the street or venture in to one of the best dive bars in the country - The Tempest where you can play pool, watch sports, chat with the beautiful bartendress with green lipstick and listen to your jukebox favorites.  Does it get any better??

Oh, and just to mention the irreverent and creative - the posted hours in the afternoon begin at 4:20, not 4:30.  LOL
author: Stephanie W.

description: Great atmosphere, delicious food, stellar service,AND good hip-hop? Box Kitchen is a must where you're in town. And yes, the Box Burger is worth it!
author: Thea T.

description: Everything is pretty darn delicious. I've been eating here for years and have never been disappointed! The food is oh so fatty. Im talking mac and cheese balls, fried chicken sando, giant order fries, five pound falafel sando, I can go on.. and the menu always changes. They even have salads and a vegetarian options if you want to eat something on the lighter side.
author: Denniz S.

description:
The best food, especially late at night. I am surprised that more people don't know about it. The hamburgers and potato skins are fantastic!
In fact, my family and I are on our way there now. 
Yum!!
Oh, and the neighborhood is funky. :)
author: Maria K.

description:
Place is awesome!! Great for a late night snack (which is what we had). 
We had the falafel which was really unique with some pomegranate seeds and plenty of falafel balls to fill you up. The pita bread along with it as well was great. 
We also got garlic fries- super bomb. Not too crispy or too soft. 
The staff was friendly and the service was fast with great quality. 
DEFINITELY grabbing this again when I come back to SF.
author: Avi S.

description:
Did I just get a bad batch of "chicken in waffles?" Because we were not a fan at all. The taste of the chicken in the waffle was not appetizing at all. I'm a fan of fried chicken AND waffles when it's good... so maybe I know too much and was expecting a particular taste combination that was definitely not there...
The burger here was really tasty though so I'll give it 3 stars; I highly recommend it over the chickaffle/waffiken.

I swung by really late one evening with my little cousins and they thought I was leading them into a sketchy situation. It's a literal hole in the wall off a dark street (er, when it's dark out), but hey that's probably my bad ;) No seating, fyi.
author: Teena S.

description: Solid greasy food served up pretty fast in a back alley. Nice folks, nice prices, good stuff.
author: Daniel E.

description:
Friendly service and great food!

Ordering and pick up is from the same window in the evenings.  Menu is limited but food is sooo good!  They take credit or cash.  Prices are reasonable.  All food here essentially is "to go" but you can enjoy it next door at the Tempest (21&over).  Keep in mind that it is located in sort of a alleyway and it gets hella cold here.  

Defo worth a try!  I know I"ll be back... Often.  :D
author: Jackie C.

description: Eat Box! Smells delicious and long line. Waiting for my food and really excited. This place would be the one that's featured on a food network as a local hidden gem!
author: Demetra S.

description:
Really good food stand in a dark grimy alley (girls don't come here by yourself)

The BF and I came here before catching a movie at the AMC because we wanted good local quick food and that's exactly what we got. 
Their special...the Temptest was ham and fried egg and other good stuff in an english muffin ($6) and we also ordered the pork sandwhich ($8). All very tasty. 

This seems like a good place to get some quality food pre or post drinking at the bar next door!
author: Daniela J.

description: 5 star place for sure.  A little pricey but the food was flavorful so I'd say it was well worth it I had the elote and my chick had the garlic Fries. It was bomb.com thank you guys. I was drunk and had the munchies and this hit the spot
author: Jen O.

description: So good! Box burger and chicken Sandro are the best! Great food with reasonable price~~~~~
author: Belle C.

description: Their box burger is INCREDIBLY JUICY!! The potato skins are a must try too! Plus the chef couldn't be friendlier
author: Matthew S.

description:
I've been here a couple times while drinking in the bar next door, and their food is great! They're a little on the slow side making it, but that's fine when it's made fresh and delicious.

The menu is a nice twist on "pub classics", and you can't really go wrong. As a bonus, the bar next door (Tempest) is cool with you taking their food inside if you ask nicely, so there's usually a place to sit and eat.
author: George B.

description:
To all the Yelp people!. This is my first review. Now... Let's do this! Yee!

I literally just finished eating there... Well not so much there but across the street at the Intercontinental Hotel because this place is in an alley full of sleeping bums (No offense to any bums on yelp). So, Box Kitchen is actually just a window situated right next to a bar which seems pretty cool for snacks and what-not to break up the drinking.. 

Anyway, I had the Box Burger with garlic fries and the fried mac and cheese balls. 

The burger was really good. The garlic fries are a lot like the ones they have at At&t park which are bomb... so they were really good too. The Mac n Cheese balls were arighhhhht. 

Word of advice.. make sure u request a specific temperature on the burger. Just cuz none of us specified and they all came out medium to medium-rare. This isn't an issue for me and the wife, but we were with one of her friends which happens to be pregnant... And just so you know, undercooked meat isn't an awesome thing to be eating if you're expecting.

Key points:
- awesome food, decent price. 
- specify your meat temp. 
- mind the bums. 
- close to a bar
author: Shaun A.

description:
The location is somewhat sketchy, but the food is solid. I had a falafel wrap and hush puppies, both of which were very tasty. It was all freshly fried, and the hush puppies even had onions and other bits mixed into the batter.

As noted, there wasn't an obvious place to eat, but you can wander back towards Yerba Buena Gardens.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Their garlic parm fries are good most of the time. Last time I got it, they're were a bit too greasy and not crunch enough. Its nice you can bring your food into the Tempest next doors where they have cheap beer / drinks. 

The box burger is really delicious too with a good piece of meat.
author: andrew y.

description: Love this place! The workers were sooooo friendly! I got the box burger and it was delicious! If you like your meat well done, then I would make sure to tell them because it was definitely on the rare side! Don't be alarmed by the "alley" it's located in, it's perfectly safe if you take a car/uber there. You can bring the food into the bar located next door if you are over 21. However, we just took ours to go! Food came out within 15 minutes! Perfect late night snack. Reasonably priced for how great the food was! Definitely recommend this trendy place!
author: Emily O.

description:
Yum yum yum yum yummmmm. This place is effing delicious. I've passed by it a few times and never really took notice to it. But thank god was around this place when my belly started to grumble. My boyfriend got the ribs, which I forced him to share with me once I took a bite and was unable to stop funneling them into my black hole of a mouth. I got the garlic fries and the elote which is their corn on a cob. Both delicious. The garlic fries were bomb and the elote I couldn't help but moan with every bite. 

I read some of the bad reviews like I do when trying any new place I find on yelp, and for those who said that you have to be drunk to enjoy them are just absurd. Also to give a place 3 stars or less for not having seating is ridiculous. If you want to sit your fat ass down walk a couple blocks to union square or stand or don't bitch about or just don't go. Small businesses shouldn't have to be bashed or penalized because a person is lazy,  not all food trucks have seating, they're not getting deducted stars for that. 

Bottom line: eat here.
author: Basia C.

description:
The burger was great. This may be one of the best burgers in San Francisco and for less then $10 it's  a must try.

The hush puppies are passable. Ours were nice and crispy on the outside and hot on the inside. Nothing special but good for a back alley hole in the wall. 

The fries are very good. I'll be back just to grab an order of their garlic fries. Damn tasty. No ketchup needed, yum. The fries are 5 stars.

The burger done just right. Its not so juicy that it kills the bun in under 30 seconds but is juicy enough to be a full flavor experience. This is not a gourmet burger with artisan tendencies, it's just a damn good down to earth juicy burger with great meat. I highly recommend it. If you're  on a mission to try the best burger in the city  you need to come here. It likely won't finish in first place but it deserves a place on your list, no question.

Chance of return: 91%
author: Justin S.

description:
Went there around 11 50pm after a long day. Took about 15 minutes for two box burgers and garlic fries (fast service but not so friendly). Burgers were juicy but a lil bit under seasoned. Fries were yum yum. It was more than enough to share for two people. 

Unfortunately, we got a street cleaning ticket while waiting for the food. Apparently, there is street cleaning from 12am to 6am on Natoma street!!! So be careful.
author: Sara S.

description: This place is awesome. Great food, service and drinks. Parm garlic fries are a must. Great music selection! Definitely recommend.
author: Laurie K.

description: Super killer sortve gourmet bar food , not really in a bar but next to it but you can get the food for the bar . I got the chicken sandwich and it was very tasty ! I will be going back again!!!!!!
author: Kai P.

description:
Got a burger, chicken sandwich and the potato skins and split them all with my man. Amazing amazing. High quality ingredients put together in a creative way. Definitely
"Drunk food" but amazing nonetheless. Staff was super friendly, gave us recommendations. Wish we got to try the mac and cheese balls! !!
author: Rebecca A.

description:
Super friendly service. The guy that works the front counter knows his stuff. Trust him when u ask him what he recommends. Box burger is sooooo effin good. Omg. Totally hit the spot. Didnt see chicken n waffles on the menu though, would love to try that.

Its a hole in the wall, no where to sit, but ots totally worth it, rain or shine
author: Albert H.

description: This place is amazing. Came here after work with friends when I worked for yelp and now coming with my partner. Garlic fries are to die for and the box burger is unbelievable. Also next to tempest which has a great Wednesday night drink special
author: Sean G.

description: Perfect place for a late night bite! We got the falafel wrap, fried mac and cheese balls and the chicken in waffle. Everything was prepared fresh and tasted delicious. The chicken inside the waffle was quite interesting and came with a delicious maple Sriracha sauce. There isn't any seating as it is literally a little box, but you could walk to the nearby neighbourhoods or just stand outside and eat, like we did!
author: Shriya P.

description:
Oh my lord.  God has decided to place a small piece of heaven on earth.  I generally steer clear of fried foods and burgers but after struggling to find a decent place to eat around union square, I stumbled upon this place and I'm SO glad I did.  

First thing is first, this is NOT a sit down restaurant but you can buy your food and eat it at the bar next door.  Service is on point and they are extremely friendly.  Prices are decent and the wait is too bad.  

Now on to the food.  Their potato skins are actually exquisite pieces of food art placed on this earth to make even the saddest beings smile.  They are delicious and extremely genius.  Definitely a dish you MUST try!!!  Their burger is also AMAZING but I made the mistake of eating the potato skins first which took some spotlight from the burger. The burger is cooked to perfection and topped with just the right toppings to make it a match made in heaven.  Their garlic fries were good, nothing out of this world. And last but not least, there is their signature fried chicken sandwich!  So good.  To be honest, it could use a little more sauce (or perhaps making the sauce more potent) but nevertheless it was delicious.  Probably my least favorite out of everything we tried but still better than your average. 

I will definitely be returning! But not before working out for weeks to burn off the initial stamped of calories I consumed here :p
author: Michael B.

description: Burger was good, but I wish the cashier tonight told me earlier that they ran out of burger buns and gave me I think sour dough (which I don't like). Told him I wanted to go and he got that wrong... He might be tired, but so am I... I even tipped him too and I don't think he even noticed.
author: ABC Z.

description:
What I ordered:
+ Fried Chicken Sando (B)
+ Garlic Fries (B+)

Box Kitchen and Tempest share the same address so naturally my friend and I walk into Tempest expecting to get some Chicken and Waffles. With no food menu in sight we attributed the lack of a kitchen to the fact that Box Kitchen opens at 4:30pm and it was 4:10pm. For 20 minutes we waited in anticipation that this awesome dive bar would magically transform into an awesome dive bar restaurant!

I counted down to the seconds as if the rapture was going to occur on the dot annnnd....nothing. Just like the actual rapture.

Defeated, confused, and still very hungry we hung our heads down looking for the closest quick bite. That closest quick bite turned out to be the kitchen next door that looks like it's in a box and close enough to qualify as part of 431 Natoma St.

To save yourself from looking as stupid as I did, Box Kitchen directly to the right of Tempest outside. 

I got the fried chicken sando, perfect amount of heat and very juicy, almost too juicy to the point where my fried chicken had no crunch to it. As much as I want to give that sandwich another shot, there's too many other mouth watering gems on the menu to repeat dishes. Though you can't really go wrong any of the greasy food at Box Kitchen and a cider from next door. 

The experience itself is worth going back. I don't remember the last time I was able to sit buzzed on the sidewalk with fried chicken in hand and not be judged for it. Hallelujah, child!
author: Jason O.

description: I am new to this city, and have been looking for hole in the wall places to eat.   I found one of the best so far.  This place is a walk up order, takes about 15 minutes to make your meal, but worth the time.  Pricing was reasonable, their hamburgers were out of this world, I also had potato skins that are topped off with a fried quail egg, the fries were crispy.  The whole meal way everything I have been looking for.  If you want to sit down just step next door to the bar, this is a place that could become a neighborhood bar for me.  The whole experience was worth the trip down the side street.  Don't miss this place.
author: David R.

description: Unless you like a raw burger stay away! My burger was so pink I had to throw it away. Waste of my $. Never again!
author: Nyla S.

description: Fucking excellent. Great burger, perfectly crispy garlic fries, this place is literally a hole in the wall, but it's some of the best food I've had in SF so far.
author: Guy M.

description: Such a simple location but wow.. Talk about innovative items on the menu... Hard to look past the box burger with garlic parm fries.. Also located next to my fav bar in the city the tempest.. Excellent for just food or to a compliment drinks
author: Jack O.

description: Its literally a window on a very sketchy street. Burger is fresh, juicy and tasty. Potato skins are the best I've had with a good balance of salty, tangy, crispy and soft. Chicken and waffles were unique with a very strong beer flavor.
author: Yen T.

description:
I came here with a friend before catching a movie at the Metreon. It was about a 7 minutes walk away. Box Kitchen is in an alley way next to a bar (Tempest) or maybe it was connected to the bar. It seemed sketchy with all that. 

We were greeted by a nice gentleman. He took our orders and we waited about 15 minutes for the food. We ordered chicken in waffle, fresh young coconut and the box burger with fries. The food was in a nice paper bag. I did not check the food before leaving. My friend and I opened the box of food at the theater. When I looked inside, all I saw were waffles. I was really confused. I was thinking "Where's my chicken? Did they forget about it?" I decided to go ahead and rest the waffles. I pulled the waffle apart and wah-la! The chicken was inside the waffle. No wonder it was called chicken in waffle. 

The chicken in waffle was good. Inside I found the chicken with siracha. It also came with a side of syrup, so it gave it that sweet and spicy kick. The waffle wasn't too dry. This can be a snack, but not a meal on its own. The box burger was delicious! The size of the burger is huge. It had a good amount of meat and a lot more. I would definitely order this again and share it with someone else too. The fries were crunchy and addicting. The coconut was refreshing and quenched my thirst, but wish I had more. Probably a life time supply worth. 

My other friends went to get another burger after having one bite.

Overall, I had a good experience. I would love to try the other items on the menu. Probably the honey mustard crispy chicken sandwich next. Give this place a chance. Its pretty good :)
author: Tracy P.

description:
I LOVE this place. This is my absolute favorite late-night place. The staff and food are all amazing.

Recomendations: 
Burger yummmm
Mac 'n' cheese balls amazing
Chicken and Waffles delicious 
Fries perfection 

The food cannot be beat, they even serve lunch during the week with even more options.
author: Addison P.

description:
Pretty cool, great for late night. 

Pros: 
(+) Decent food - the pork skins were good (that sauce is super yummy), fried chicken sandwich was good too, and the burger was good. I heard the elote was good as well although I didn't try any myself. 
(+) Right next to Tempest if you want to grab a drink while you're waiting for your food, or bring your food into the bar, they're cool with that too. 


Cons:
(-) Sketchy neighborhood - there was a guy lurking and talking to himself while we were waiting for our food and I was feeling quite uncomfortable
(-) The food took a while to make, so we were standing outside for a while
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I ruined my diet to try this place and I'd have to say it was one of my best decisions ever!! 

Potato skins with pork belly, gouda cheese, green onions, and a quail egg on top. Elote (corn on the cob) seasoned with extra goodness and more. Tonight they had garlic fries, tacos with pork belly and jalepenos, honey mustard chicken sandwiches, box burgers, buffalo wings, dirty dogs, and falafel wraps. Apparently their menu changes. 

Note from 420pm to 1am, it's a little hidden window on the side of the street next to Tempest, you'll probably see a bunch people congregated on the sidewalk. For brunch/lunch you can order inside of Tempest.
author: P H.

description:
Came here for a late-night snack on a Sat night with some friends & it was SO good!!

I got the Box Burger - Grand Schmitz Ranch Chuck w/ bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar, spinach, tomato, crispy shallots, potato pepper bun. When was the last time you got a burger with fried shallots and true leafy spinach greens? Usually they just slap on some iceberg lettuce, devoid of any real nutritional value or flavor and call it a day! The Box Burger I ordered was absolutely PACKED with flavor, and interesting tones I had not previously tasted on a burger. The crispy shallots and bacon shallot gastrique gave it a truly earthy, rich flavor. It really hit the spot.

My friend got the Chicken IN Waffles w/ Sriracha Maple Syrup. Nope, that was not a typo - Chicken IN Waffles. As in, the waffles had chicken inside of them. If this wasn't enough of a treat, they came with a side of Sriracha Maple Syrup! I don't even like hot sauce, and I have to admit I loved this combination. Though I question how it first came about - who dared combine the two?? Defying all logic, the sweet maple mixes well with the spicy Sriracha sauce, giving a great kick to the classic chicken and waffles. The perfect late-night snack.

I cannot recommend Box enough - their menu is innovative, delicious, and reasonably priced, and their service manages to match this quality. 

My only suggestion would be to come in a car or cab. Don't walk or bus it to the area, especially if you aren't from the city and especially at night. It's not the best neighborhood for a stroll, but perfectly fine for a quick bite.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Heard great things about this place from a co-worker, and the Yelp reviews drew me here. Stopped by on my way home from work and had the burger and fries tonight. Super disappointed. Definitely not the best burger, have had many burgers that are similar. And fries were just okay.

Disappointing for sure. Staff was nice though.
author: Jenny L.

description:
If you're looking for a place called the Box for lunch you won't find it. That's because it's inside The Tempest Bar at 431 Natoma! But fear not!  It looks like a dive but aren't the best foods found at places like this?!?  

I got the Box Burger with garlic fries! Fat, juicy and delicious mixed with garlic and cheese fries!  Worth the $10!!  

If you're looking for pretentious froo froo foods with mystic ambiance go elsewhere.  If you're looking for down right good comfort food, mission completed!!
author: Gary L.

description:
We were looking for some place tasty to eat after midnight on Friday night, and this place popped up on Yelp. I got the potato skins with quail eggs and boyfriend got the chicken burger. Both were amazingly delicious. They both looked exactly like the photos I looked at before ordering. The chicken was so succulent and the baked potato skin was so crisp and savory.

It was either to go or eat in the bar right next to it (Tempest), which was awesome because it was really cold and drinks + delicious fried food is a good combination.

At one point boyfriend said loudly "This place obviously only takes cash!" To which the cashier said "We take card, you fool!" When I managed to pay for our food over boyfriend's protests, the same cashier told him, "That one's a keeper." Then he began laughing to himself and other people in the kitchen joined in. Later boyfriend was self-conscious and asked me why everyone thought his beard was so funny. But I think the people who work here are just jolly people by nature.

Would definitely recommend.
author: Jiwon K.

description:
Yep yep yep. Box compliments Tempest, next door, quite nicely. A nice take on bar food, and better, to boot. 

The chicken sando' is amazing, and the fries are YES. After you have your order, take it next door, or GTFO back to your humble abode. Whatever you like. 

Make sure you stick around, though, to actually get your food. I wouldn't put it past an inebriated Tempest-goer to mistaken your order for theirs.

The good: great bar food.
The bad: bring a buddy while waiting for your food, especially if you're female and/or nervous.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Good Stuff, I was drunk so it was great, but to be honest I can see what they are doing and it is really good late night eats, I will come back until I am dissatisfied or in AA, whatever comes first.

P.S. RAIDERS BABY RAIDERS YEAH BABY YEAH!!!
author: Jason M.

description: Literally a little hole in the wall kitchen, with awesome food! Located in an alley and next to its sister bar, you can take food to go or into the bar. We had the potato skins, which were incredible rich and melt in your mouth. Crack I say! Can't remember the other item, but I remember it being pretty good as well. Great place for a snack/food on the go, and definitely to satisfy the drunchies. Will be back to try more things on the menu!!
author: L T.

description:
Pop-up restaurants are the new food truck.  A literal hole in the wall serving late night bar food from a walk up counter next to a bar (using the bar's previously unused kitchen?).  Not as sketchy a corner as you'd think given the proximity to 6th Street (a.k.a. Crack Alley).  Best strategy is to turn on to Natoma from 5th to avoid the nearby street theater (and I don't mean Boxcar).  All the food was made to order, so it was a good thing we were the only people there else I might expect a long wait.  Seemed like an interesting menu so I will definitely be back to try other items like Aaron's Little Wiener.

Fried Pickles: Some of the best fried pickles I've ever had.  Very thinly sliced so when they're fried, they are actually crispy. I hate when fried pickles are so thick that they are still squishy after being fried.  Love the sour contrast to the salty fried crust.  Some nice seasoning, like Old Bay (?) on top.  A nice creamy dipping sauce helped add extra calories.

Wings: The sauce seemed Asian soy inspired, almost like something you'd expect on a spare rib.  But it worked.  Though I love hot wings, I appreciated all the spices going on in this sauce and enjoyed the experience of trying to figure out all the flavors.

Chicken in Waffle: Innovation!  Why throw fried chicken on top of waffles when you can put chicken inside the waffles???  Kind of like a bacon waffle, but with pulled chicken bits.  Extremely tasty.  Could have been better though if the chicken was battered like little popcorn chicken.  Came with a nice cup of syrup to provide the very familiar sweet contrast.
author: Adam B.

description:
This is in a very bad part of town, and as a non-native I got lost. I got my food back to the hotel room and wondered if it was worth it...

YES. YES IT WAS. YES. OH YES.

I think I got the regular burger on their menu and it tasted amazing. The fries were good but the burger was extremely tasty! It hit the spot. I was blown away. Honestly, I was drawn to this place by the rave reviews. The burgers do NOT disappoint!
author: Sam L.

description: Came here to grab a bite while drinking next door at Tempest. We ordered the Box burger and garlic fries. The burger was cooked to perfection and the garlic fries were deliciously garlic-ey. The wait time for the food was about 15 mins, which gave us a chance to go back into the bar and drink some more before we stuffed our faces. If you drinking next door like we were, you can bring the food back and eat in the bar. Not bad at all..
author: Jackie T.

description: Box Kitchen was right next door to Tempest bar and the place was hoppin'. It was down a one way alley and literally was a hole in the wall. We tried the garlic fries, brussel sprouts, baby corn and potato skins. All were delicious. Their menu changes with the season. Glad we checked it out.
author: Racheal B.

description: This is literally a hole in the wall place. It is a hole in a brick wall. It was pretty busy and it did take quite a while to get our food. I ordered the potato skins which was $9 for 3 potato skins... which is 1.5 potatoes. I'm used to getting at least 6 potato skins and for a cheaper price. But anyway, the potato skins had cheese like normal, but also had pork belly and a quail egg on them...... I was not a fan. I also tried someone else's garlic parmesan fries which I debated getting and I'm glad I did not get them. They were just meh.
author: Shin M.

description: Roaming around SoMa on a Saturday night with friends also new to the city, I had no idea where to go for loud music, affordable drinks, and tasty food, so I was relieved to come across Tempest. I was even happier to find Box Kitchen next door. Open until 1, the Kitchen offers a little bit of everything, from upscale salads to giant portions of wannabe truffle fries, all for $10 or under. Two people in the kitchen and a counter person handled probably 10 orders in the 15 minutes I waited in line and for my food; service is astonishingly fast. The burger I had ($9, +$2 for fries) was large but manageable, done medium-well, and topped with spinach, tomatoes, cheddar, and avocado. I easily brought my food back into the bar, but you can comfortably take a seat on the clean and quiet Natoma St. curb and chat with everyone else enjoying their mid-outing snack. I'll return whenever I'm at Tempest (or on my way to 442)!
author: Brian C.

description:
Cool place, food didn't blow me away. 

Love how you can grab food from this place and take it to the bar next door, but the nachos weren't amazing. The meat was not that great and they were kind of 'meh' overall. 

Loved the bar setup though! Great experience!!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Had the pleasure of checking this place out a few nights ago after being told about it from a friend.  The Potato Skins were amazing and did not disappoint neither did the chicken in waffle.  The ability to take the food to the bar is nice and will definitely be returning in the future.

Highly recommend the macaroni balls too!
author: Andrew V.

description:
Food: 3
Decor: 2
Service: 4

Came here for some late night eats.

1. Box burger with garlic fries, 10
~Okay. Wasn't a big fan of the burger (had a weird sour taste possibly because of the gastrique), but the garlic fries were excellent.

2. Buffalo chicken sandwich with garlic fries, 12
~Okay. Didn't really like the sandwich.

Service was pretty fast (~10min wait). Definitely will have to drop by to try the chicken and waffles next time.
author: David L.

description:
Chicken. And. Waffles.

That's it, really, all you need to know.

Okay seriously I've been here about a dozen times. Everything rocks, everyone is nice, I love it!
author: Amanda P.

description:
Scary neighborhood, parking meters, back alley hole in the wall, next to a rowdy, er I mean lively bar (Tempest).

The ambience is crack house with a walk up window and a line but the food is prepared to perfection.  (Which is pretty much why there is a line there in the first place).

I know that the area looks dodgy.  It probably is.  But you don't want to miss this spot and late at night there simply are no alternatives.  

Perfect for dieters or those considering a diet that consists of tasty grilled and fried foods.  
Delicious?
Yes.
Why?
These guys understand how to season/flavor and cook. 
Most places cook stuff till it is tasteless dry cardboard/leather.
Box Kitchen cooks food so that it still has juices and flavor.
Actually knowing how to properly prepare food is a rare trait that we normally must pay a substantial premium for.  (Think Ruth's Chris or Lawry's as opposed to any mediocre restaurant/steak chain that hawks leathery jerky steaks and meats by cooking everything well done, even if it is ordered rare).
Unlike the rare premium places that know how to prepare food: this place is seriously cheap.

So the food rocks.  
If you make it (alive) out of the alley, (I mean off of Natoma Street): you can bring your own dining room with seatbelts, comfy seats and great music to make this a fun place to eat or see if you can get your box home without opening it and munching on the way.  Either way is pretty much a tasty adventure.
Okay, maybe I exaggerated how comfy the seats were.  I mean how scary the alley was.  Oh hell: if it is late you have few options anyways.  You gotta eat, just do it.

All joking aside: I love Box Kitchen and I rate it a full 5 stars.

Edit/Update 2 days later.  Back in SF next week, already planning and looking forward to my next visit to the Box Kitchen.  (Of course if I owned it: I would name it "crack house" because that sounds funnier and the food is rather addictive).
author: Veronica S.

description: Stumbled upon the box kitchen and fell in love with their box burger. Smells of greatness waft onto the street from the small window/door along the sidewalk -- and the grub is worth the wait.
author: Blake L.

description: Wow, a stunning decline.  I don't think Chef Crawford shows up here anymore and it shows.  The best menu items are gone and the new menu items are heavy handed.  I've been more times than I can count, but those days are over. Sigh.
author: Dave H.

description:
I work in SoMA and while there's plenty of companies here great places to eat in the area are definitely lacking...there's the usual Deli Board or Tin but very few places to write home about...but this little bar + restaurant is one of those places. 

It's one of those bars that you felt kind of got passed by a few years ago when the era of local craft beers and hip bars started popping up, but I think the addition of Box Kitchen revitalized Tempest Bar and now it is a popping place to be at lunchtime! 

I've been here four times already (that's saying something, as I don't frequent a lot of places often) and every time the food is just DELICIOUS. 

Pro-tips: 
- Order the brussel sprouts....don't give me the "I'm not a brussel sprout kind of person" speech because gosh darn these brussel sprouts are the best ones I have ever eaten. You eat them all and then try to look into how to recreate them. 

- Nacho Fridays...it's a thing and it's a very good thing at that. It's the place to be on Fridays at lunch time or if you're looking for a good snack to go along with your beer.

- Box Burger, it's good...not the best but pretty good. I omitted the bun, 'cuse I was "trying to stay healthy."

- Garlic Fries, pretty bomb.com but eat them there and don't take them to-go. You know fries aren't traveling food, as much as your brain tries to convince you otherwise. 

- Chicharones - skip them. That's been the one disappointment at Box. I went to school in SD and when they say Chicharones it was a thick slab of deep fried pork belly goodness. That's not the case at Box...it's those chips that you buy at the corner market and it's not worth your $$$.  

- Beet & Apple Salad...WHOA. No words...this salad is amazing. So good. I was on a 30 day fruit diet and couldn't find any places to go that would abide by my dietary restrictions, but this made me love being on my horrible diet. If you're trying to stay healthy at Box, I definitely recommend this. 

I can't wait to try the whole menu! Plus, the service is super nice and you just know the waiters/waitresses and bartender have been there forever. I see the the same people every time I come. :)
author: Connie P.

description: This place is pretty dirty, the beers are cheep but its a little too much of a hole in a wall.  Its open late and in kinda a skechy neighborhood.  I wouldn't recommend going there late at night unless you want to get stabbed.
author: Mike B.

description: The Box Burger is so good. I love the food here, the atmosphere is just sketchy. Plan on using the restroom somewhere else. The service was excellent though.
author: Jessie O.

description:
I was waiting for this burger for some time. I was coming off of a diet and needed a good "cheat" night. I decided to spend my cheat night getting a burger from Box Kitchen.

I schlepped myself over to Box Kitchen on a rainy Saturday night and brought the burger and fries back to my apartment (about 4 blocks away).

The burger was good. Not outstanding, but good. Generous meat, right proportioned buns and toppings that blended well and didn't overpower the meat. 

I must admit, I am largely vegetarian and this is the first burger I've enjoyed in probably close to a year. I wasn't disappointed, but I was expecting an other-worldly experience based on the high reviews.

The fries - well they were soggy. I don't know if it was due to the rainy weather and the walk home, but they were nothing really special. I'd like to try the fries again under different weather conditions (and maybe dining in) to see if the fries were a one time blunder or if they're usually so non-remarkable.
author: Robin P.

description: The potato skins have caused me to weep tears of joy. Must remember to come back here when drunk. I would probably die.
author: Grant M.

description: This place was pretty good we ordered the burger and brussle sprouts. The brussle sprouts melted in your mouth and were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside! The burgers were huge and had tons of juice inside. The bread was on point.
author: Vincent G.

description: Amazing Place!!! The manager and all the employees are amazing and deliver great service!! The Box Burger is the BEST!!!
author: Samantha P.

description:
The guys here are super chill and try to work as quick as possible to complete each order.

I've tried most of their menu offerings and they're all filled with flavor. Each item is creatively constructed with many ingredients which all work impressively together. 

They're open at the right time every day, 4:20
author: Terrance M.

description: Man oh man, I come here maybe once or twice a week! I'm addicted to this food joint!!! if you love good burgers and garlic fries, please pay these guys a visit (:
author: Jeff D.

description: Box along with Tempest has been a SOMA combo favorite. I think my friends and I can all vouch for the food, from the chicken IN waffles with sriracha syrup, the chicken and gravy biscuit, the burger and garlic fries, and the cemita, which one friend became addicted to.. Then grab a drink at tempest. Often packed but if you find a place to squat, you'll enjoy the environment.. Promise
author: Neil I.

description: The burger rocks! Love the fries too. The guy at the front door is real cool and patient. I'm usually in a bit of a rush and they take an average of 10 minutes an order but the staff is up front and real with expectations and I appreciate that. Had to bug out once for a work thing and when I came back a few hours later they did me solid and prepped me a fresh meal.
author: Richard P.

description: Best Burger in SF - forget Super Duper Burger or In and Out ... If you're in SF you gotta try it!
author: Ron C.

description: Best chicken sandwich I've ever had (no slaw on the sandwich). Gourmet style bar food from literally a hole in the wall. There's a hole in the wall bar next door where you can sit down to eat.
author: Brantley B.

description:
When my friend Jessica L. said this was a hole in the wall... she wasn't kidding! 

Box Kitchen is located in an alleyway next to a bar or lounge that is on the corner. They serve you from one of those doors where you open the top half and keep the bottom half closed. There's no seats so be prepared to eat standing up, on the curb, or in your car. I think there was a small table top but I can't be sure of it. It's an order and eat somewhere else type of joint so it's totally fine. My friend and I just ate in our car, away from the cold. 

We arrived at around midnight after coming back from San Jose for a Sharks game on a Wednesday night. There were other people around but not a ton so we were able to order and get our food pretty quickly. 

Jessica and I split some garlic fries and adobo tacos. I really liked the tacos!  

Jessica says you have to try the potato skins and some sort of waffle sandwich so I will be back to try more of the menu!
author: Connie Y.

description:
It's really baffling that this place is not 5 Star on Yelp. 
This place is the absolute best for what it is. And what it is, is a tiny hole in the wall next to a bar that gives you best Burgers you've ever had. I've tried pretty much the rest of their menu too but i'm just gonna talk about the Burgers. The burgers are comparable to up scale $$$ restaurants. and its just a tiny hole in the wall that serves them.
author: Kia M.

description: The box burger is definitely my favorite burger in San Francisco. The chicken sandwich is pretty awesome too. And the potato skins. Really I've never had anything less than delicious from here. I highly recommend it.
author: Christopher B.

description:
Housed in a dark alley, you feel like you've found a hidden treasure.. especially with the late night hours. I need to try more of the menu though, but it's a great menu for comfort food.

I had the falafel wrap, which was fried to order, but my order sat (wrong name) so I didn't get to taste the full potential. The falafel itself was a bit on the salty side, but the other ingredients were fresh and tasty.

Garlic fries were nice and crisp. My friend said the fried chicken sandwich would have been better with dark meat.

4 stars for the late night hours.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Kind of disappointed by the Box Burger here after reading all the rave reviews about it.

+Box Burger- cut in half, medium well, but the patty just wasn't an flavorful. it could have used a bit more seasoning but the bun and fixin's made it edible.
+Falafel Wrap- really small and unexciting. My vegetarian husband liked the taste of the bun and fixin's on my burger and we thought (see suggestion)

SUGGESTION: it would be awesome if they could make a falafel burger so Veg heads could enjoy the best of both worlds!

Service:
Our order taker didn't speak any English so we couldn't ask questions about the menu. So, we just pointed and waited 15 minutes for the burger next door at Tempest.

Ambience:
There's nowhere to sit near Box Kitchen, so they tell you to take it next door to Tempest Bar. Good idea except that there are never any tables available, so you are either standing awkwardly or  dodging annoying people who are about to hit you with the cue stick as they play pool.
