Let a girl eat in peace without having to strain my neck every 5 seconds.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
Oh the joys of being able to travel for work.  A mid-week meeting in SF is always pleasant because I will have an opportunity to try some new food spots.

So sitting in my car after my meeting, I had an honestly long debate with myself (I am not crazy I swear) about where to eat.  On my long list of places to try, Box Kitchen just kind of called to me that day and off I went.

Box is tucked away inside the Tempest on tiny Natomas street so it can be a challenge to find.  Once inside, my first thought was total dive, and my face lit up with a smile.  I got to the bar, ordered an Allagash White and proceeded to have another debate of what to eat (not crazy).  Finally, after some serious soul searching, I decided on the Potato Skins and The Tempest Breakfast Sandwich.

Potato skins - HOLY! A must order.  Crispy fried, topped with braised pork belly, cheese, and fried quail egg all sitting atop sauce.  Oh man this was sooo good.  And the salty fried goodness is perfect with beer.

The Tempest - Delicious hand made English muffin? Check.  Fried Egg and Thick cut bacon? Check.  Cheddar and tomato? Check.  Crispy Kale? Ohhh yeah check.  Tomato coulis? Drool.  This is one seriously good breakfast sandwich and is one that is a benchmark breakfast sandwich (even though I had it for lunch).  Definitely a must try.

There are so many things I still want to try on this menu.  I could only fit so much in my stomach.  Box is definitely worth a trip for the food and the beers!
author: Thomas N.

description: A good description for this place is that it is literally hole in the wall food place that makes gourmet taking drunk food. Unless you are eating in the bar next door there is not sitting spots for you to eat, unless you want to stand and eat off the tiny bar next to the door where you order at. The area might seem a little sketch at night to just stand and eat your food sober. While I was ordering there was a lot of drunk people also ordering food which took quite a while. The food also take a while to make but to give the restaurant the benefit of the doubt above their menu does give us a warning asking us to be patient. The food itself is delicious. I had the potato skins which was absolutely delicious if you are a potato lover. The pieces are big filled with tender deliciously marinated pork belly, cheese, a quail egg & amongst other ingredients I was not able to explore because it was quite dark when I got my food. I only finished 2/3 potato skins from my plate and that filled me up a bit. I saw a couple people walk away with the poutine which looked really good. We also ordered the "Box Burger" which is one of the most popular items on the menu according to the chef. The burger was really flavorful and over all very tasty.
author: Teena N.

description:
Had the BBBBBLT with arugula side salad to-go one day for lunch.

Will be going back to try everything else on the menu.

I like this place, makes me like my job more because it's near here.
author: Soop S.

description: This will be our go-to place after my son's orthodontist appointments around the corner.  A hidden gem with good eats.  We ordered the chicken and waffles (my boy went to town on that), fried brussel sprouts, garlic parm fries, and hush puppies.  ALL were delicious!  There was a slight wait, about 15 minutes.  There's no seating either.  So next time I will call ahead and try their boxed burger (the couple in front of us made it look soooo good)
author: Angela K.

description: Great place for a late night diner, has great menu closes late cheers, best of all it closes late
author: Dannie F.

description:
Probably THE BEST burger I have ever had.

The Box Kitchen takes Hole in the Wall very literally. There is no where to sit and eat except for the bar that other reviewers talked about. Tried taking my food in there but who wants to eat inside a bar that reeks of BO and has sticky residue on the tables that you are not quite sure what it is? Definitely take it to go but you better get back quick to wherever you are going to enjoy this meal because it is something that you do not want to let sit for long.

Tip: Do not get the chicken IN Waffles. I know everyone talks about it but it definitely is not their best. Get the burger!!! 

Learned this the hard way... but remember that the neighborhood is very sketchy... My gf was not happy and even the amazing burger did not make up for her disappointment that I led her to a long and dark alley with homeless people asking for change.
author: Eric K.

description: Open until 1am and right next to a bar. I can't exactly complain. The food isn't all greasy, fried fare either, as they have falafel wraps and salads. You want the Box Burger, obviously, but it takes so long to get your food ready. I wouldn't mind the wait, but there are always a bunch of smokers outside of Tempest next door.
author: Danny C.

description: Each time I go to this place I am amazed at the creativity they use in crafting their menu. That creativity translates to both healthy and hearty meal choices that do not let me down. Whether you are grabbing lunch on the go or catching some grub after a prolonged stop at The Tempest, this food hits the spot. All I have to say is, let me get a slow clap for the chef going.
author: W. Daniel C.

description: I'm visiting from LA and thank God I stumbled upon this place!! I got the Tempest and it was AMAZING!!!
author: Nikki G.

description:
If you've gotten very drunk at the bar next door and need something to satisfy those drunchies, this is certainly the place to be. If you're sober though, this place is ok. I came here for dinner and got the chicken in waffles. I loved the idea of it. There's no need to alternate between waffle and chicken. You can just have both with every bite! While it was a great concept, the actual food was a bit of a let down. In terms of flavor, it was nothing special, but the most disappointing part was the portion size. I certainly expect more food for $7 at a fast food place. I was left still hungry after finishing my meal and I had arrived there feeling only mildly hungry. My brother got the box burger. He let me have a bite, and his burger was delicious. This was probably the only real redeeming part of this place.  My friend ordered the fried pickles. We probably shoud've canceled it the moment the guy at the counter needed to check that that was an actual menu item. It tasted like eating deep fried blocks of salt. 

The other downside to this place is that the food is pretty slow at coming out. I waited nearly half an hour for my tiny waffle, and my friend waited even longer for her garlic fries. Even though I was still hungry, I didn't want to order anything else because I didn't want to be stuck waiting forever for more food. Most people wait it out at the bar next door, but since I had someone under 21 with me, we were stuck standing on the street with not even a bench to sit on to ease the wait. In case you've never seen it, it's just a window you order your food out of. There's no seating available.

In terms of price, sides such as garlic fries cost $5. Everything else costs $6-8. Yelp rarely fails me, but I have to assume this place has 4.5 stars because a bunch of drunk people at the bar next door decided to rate it.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Not sure how this place earned 5 stars but it is definitely not worthy of 5 stars. I had  ordered garlic fries ($5), salt and vinegar fries ($6) and tacos barbacoa ($7) so was expecting nothing but goodness. 
Garlic fries were meh. 
Salt and vinegar fries were lacking the "salt and vinegar" and definitely not worth $6. The fries tasted like dehydrated fries. I like my fries crispy on the outside and fluffy inside.
Tacos were the size of the ones you buy from taco trucks aka street tacos and again, not worth $7 for two. You are better off buying the street tacos.
The only valid reason why this place may have earned 5 stars is perhaps its connected to the bar at the corner so hungry drunks only available option for food is Box Kitchen. 
I suppose if you're hungry and it's late night, anything would be good. Shucks, tuna straight from a can would be good.
author: Meuy S.

description:
This is a somewhat hidden gem. The food was outstanding. They are the same owners as Louie Bar that I've been to and they have the same amazing potato skins - with pork belly and an over easy quail egg yum! I had the fried chicken sandwich too and it was great. A slightly different breading but it was juicy and very flavorful. I will be returning. 

My only gripe is they don't have any outdoor seating and the seating in the bar is hard to find.
author: Evan L.

description:
A lot of work related bar crawls begin at Tempest.  And really, when you get down to it, the best part of Tempest is its proximity to Box.  A shady little window just down the block from Tempest's entrance, doesn't suggest "culinary wonders" to you.  But lemme tell you, after a beer or four, a fried chicken sandwich from Box is about the closest thing to perfect as you can get.  Well maybe the brussel sprouts are the closest thing to perfect and the burger is the next most perfect and then the chicken sandwich.  But where does the waffle with fried chicken inside fit in this ranking?  I don't know.  Go try them all and decide for yourself.

As if serving food to drunks after work wasn't saintly enough, I just learned that Box is open during the day - with table service right inside Tempest.  Holy Bejebus!  I took a crew down there today and even in the glaring sobriety of noon the food was great.  We got out with a bill of less than $100 for 9 people.  That's like free for SoMa lunch.
author: Ivan L.

description: Been coming here- sober and not-so-sober- for years. Seriously good eats and a great staff. The burger is so juicy, the fries delicious, and the potato wedges are so tasty! This is not at all bar food but serious mealtime success! and now I want a burger and garlic fries...
author: Ariel B.

description: Must have the box burger ! Went there for my first time and it was absolutely amazing. The service was fast, we only had to wait about 10-15 minutes for our food. Prices are fair for the quality of the burger, if you're around the area and craving a burger I recommend this place.
author: Lizbeth C.

description:
After a house part a couple blocks down, my sorority sis and I wandered over here looking for a hot bite. We came to the right place. Just a couple drunks girls ahead of us on a chilly night, but the braised beef tacos were SO worth the wait and the temp. 

The tacos were hot, and spicy hot. They came out fast and were $7/2 tacos I think. 

I would absolutely return anytime I'm in the neighborhood. Yum, yum, yum!
author: Ashley J.

description: This place is a sweet hole in the wall find. Order at the door and they call your name. People are super chill. Great quality and right next door is tempest if you wanna get a drink. Definitely recommend it for a late night bite.
author: Josh K.

description:
I wish i read the yelp reviews & didn't just purchase what caught me eye..! 

Everyones food at this place looked so good..! 

 But what did i end up getting? 
A basket of pork rinds that taste like they came out of a bag from a gas station.. 

I wish i took the time to see what else they had to offer..! 

If i am back in the area i will give their burger or Fried chicken & waffle a shot that everyone is raving over.. 
At least for future customers i can say, don't get the pork rinds. Just not worth it, no point. You can put lipstick on a pig.. it's still a pig. 
Any way you flavor pork rinds they will always just be that. 

This place is actually what is says though, it's really a box kitchen. There's no seating, nothing. You order your food... grab it & munch as you walk. Almost like a taco truck but it's an actual hole in the wall...
author: Brandon M.

description:
Grrrrrrr!

Yelpers failed me big time on this one.  Food is equivalent in quality, taste and texture to a TGIF or Chili's.

WHY are these ratings so high????

Makes no sense!

The place is kind of dirty-looking and smells like beer.  People working are nice, but do NOT waste your time going here.

Lame.
author: Li J.

description:
If I had to be a food item from Box, it would be one of their perfect fries. Everyone loves fries, but Box's fries are particularly good. They're crispy and flavorful on the surface, providing excellent character, yet full of substance and goodness inside.

Also like Box's fries, I'm yellow on the outside but white within, and I'm constantly covered in garlic.

(Kidding.)

Box also serves some amazing burgers and sharable snacks like buffalo wings and corn dogs. Pair the food with a cheap-ass beer from Tempest and you've got an afternoon.
author: Keane L.

description: I was expecting for my mind to be blown by the food here based upon the reviews. The food really was not anything special and it was in a sketchy location. My husband and I did not feel comfortable at night getting our food here. When our order was up we booked it.
author: Laura L.

description: Honestly... probably the best Brussels sprouts I've ever had. And that's coming from a girl whose family grows sprouts. Ill definitely be back
author: Olivia H.

description: By far one of my favorite burgers in San Francisco.  Top 5th percentile of my life.   Hidden in a dirty seedy looking corner in a not as nice area of SoMa, it may be off putting to some of the more princess-y types but really, get over it!  A literal hole in the wall (you order through a the door), Box serves up the right flavors.  The burger is juicy and with pure beef flavor, topped with really fresh crispy lettuce and tomato.  The cheese is SHARP SHARP SHARP.  The garlic cheese fries were superb.  Would go back again and again.  Very reasonable prices as well.
author: Henry G.

description:
Conveniently located beside Tempest, each dish I've had is amazing (and it wasn't because I was drunk): the burger, garlic fries, potato skins, fried chicken sandwich. Can't go wrong, eat here. 

Last thing I'll mention is that even though there is the odd vegetarian dish sometimes, it's really not fit for vegetarians.
author: Andrew D.

description:
I go here all the time and have had most of the menu. All very good but I'm not a huge fan of the felafel wrap.

The garlic fries are good but a little extreme.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Really, I just need to stop ordering fried chicken sandwiches...  If done correctly, magic! if not, McChicken.  

Standing out on the sidewalk of a rather derelict street, you walk up to a window, the box I suppose.  A curt man asks for ya orda.  Adobo tacos sounded tempting, but still I always hold out hope for a good fried chicken sandwich.  In hindsight, I should have gone with the tacos.  

Dry was my first thought.  8d nets you a average sized sando, where the chicken is maybe a little overcooked, the crust has a little kick to it, the bread is meaningless, as is the cheese (is there cheese?) and a you're thankful for the slaw / light Caesar dressing combo for the WETNESS it provides.   

Perhaps it's worth two extra stars after a few rounds and the nearby, nextdoor riotous Tempest.  Perhaps, perhaps, perhaps...
author: Kevin T.

description:
Wow.  I could say this is the best burger I have ever had.  I could also say this is the best meal I have had in SF.  

It is a window with some guys working in a little kitchen.  You reach it from a crappy little alley that is a tad unpleasant to walk-through at 11pm at night.  But holy crap it is worth it.  Really close to the Intercontinental.  A must-visit if you are staying there.  

Had the burger (could have split one), Garlic fries (feeds 4 easily) and an Elote - grilled corn on the cob.  It is a whole cob in two pieces so you might want to share.  

Definitely awesome.
author: Michael M.

description:
Let's just keep this simple: For $10 (including incredible garlic fries), you will not find a better burger in the city. Full stop.

I see quite a lot of the reviews talk more about the "hipsters" than the food. No, Box isn't the place to go to for ambience--it's a hole in the wall next to a dive bar, for crissakes--but honestly, the food is good enough to outweigh such petty complaints.
author: Jason L.

description:
Box is a brick and mortar food truck. It's a kitchen with a door where you can order and the menu is on a sandwich board outside. There is a narrow built in ledge on the side of the building that perfectly fits 3 regular sized Asian girls and their food. Kudos to my friend Madeline F for finding a place like this. It's next to the super divey Tempest, but don't let the rather unsavory surroundings drive you away.

Highlights:
Their burger. It has an official name to it, rather than "the burger", but there's only one burger on the menu. And it is a delicious burger. The potato bun is slightly oily and the patty wedged between it is just pure beefy succulence. Juicy. Pink. I honestly do not remember the rest of the ingredients in it, I was so enamored with the meat and buns. $8.
Chicken sando: The fried chicken is THICK, and so crispy on the outside, yet tender and white on the inside. There's an amazing texture to it--a contrast of crunchy and soft. I was misinformed at first because I thought it was standalone chicken, but it's part of a burger. No healthy chicken sandwich here. $8.

The garlic fries are smothered in oil and they make you feel good and bad at the same time.

This place is great for a quick dinner before heading to other fun things the night may bring. And for a joint like this you'll be pleasantly surprised that they take CCs. Whoo!
author: Brandy A.

description: It might've been that I ordered wrong, but I ordered the tempest and got an English muffin with an egg and cheese and for an additional chicken fried steak on it. For $11. The steak was a tiny bit of short rib breaded in oats and under cooked so the crust was soft. It was all so little food, I tried to ask at the window of this really what I ordered, since it wasn't like any "chicken fried steak" I've ever had before, and as I was asking, the guy working there laughed in my face and walked away. I frequent tempest next door, but will never get food here again.
author: Michael J.

description:
Stuck.

In the box: www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLsTQrjp8c8

At the Box: Fried chicken sandwich with Caesar coleslaw. Wanted no part of this until I was offered half. Then it stuck to my arteries and my taste buds.

Which was a momentary distraction from the other piece of fried chicken sitting next to a waffle. Biscuit texture. Maple syrup and gravy syrup. So over the top. So good.

$20 for the pair. Eating inside a bar was a priceless bonus.

Recommended by health professionals? No. Recommended by professional yelpers? Yes indeed. You'll be stuck on Box in no time.
author: Jason B.

description:
I've only tried the chicken in waffles w/ sriracha syrup, but god damn.. Amazing! I'd steal this from a toddler's plate in a heartbeat. They probably shouldn't be consuming such rich foods anyway.. Lol 

I'll definitely go back and order this again, as well as try someone else. Brb, I need to go find that toddler..
author: Eduardo R.

description: Cool spot, sat at the bar and had a quick bite. My burger came out in about ten minutes even though they were packed at noon. It also came out medium rare like I asked for it. Some places are so afraid to do that, or just don't have the ability. Good job!
author: Bree V.

description:
I have been here a few times now and everything I have tried has been really tasty. That said, I feel obligated to say that you should first try the burger, the signature dish here. Other of my favorite dishes is the NY steak sandwich, but in general all sandwiches are all good (I haven't yet tried the chicken sandwich, though I've heard from friends that it is one of the best... I'll add my comments once I try it).

They have specials every day, but watch out for Tuesday special... "Braised Short Ribs"

The place has some sort of partnership with the bar next door called Tempest Bar, which I also recommend. Anyways, you should now that during the day the bar will serve you food from Box, but not the same in the evening when you can only order food directly at Box (right next door to the bar).
author: Jorge G.

description:
I think everyone and their beer-chugging grandmother already attested to the goodness of Box, but screw that, I'll chime in too. I'm no boozehound, but once in a blue moon, when I'm at Tempest for whatever reason and I need to fill my belly before quaffing, thank goodness Box is right next door.

Admittedly though, I haven't tried the much-coveted Box Burger. But those buffalo wings... oh man, they kick so hard, they'll sober you up quick (and probably kick you again on the way out...). How about those chicarones? My heart flutters from love and the cholesterol from these delicious, crunchy snacks. Well, sure, you could buy a big bag of them from Safeway for a buck or something, but I bet your intoxicated ass can't make it over there. I remember at some point I was chomping down the garlic fries too. Actually, everyone was.

Screw peanuts and popcorn. Box is THE beer food source for me, even if I have to wait 10 minutes for those flippin' wings.
author: Hannah H.

description:
Did not realize there was a separate Yelp entry for Box, as in the past most people have included their thoughts on the food under Tempest:
http://www.yelp.com/biz/tempest-bar-san-francisco

The food here is awesome.  Everything I've tried there has been delicious, and if I'm to be truthful, a big part of the reason I go to Tempest rather than other bars in the area is because of the food.  Garlic fries or fried pickles with my drinks? Uhm, yes, please.

There's not really 'service' to speak of since it's a food stand, but if you are drinking next door, they will bring your food to you so you don't have to wait outside. 

I feel like some of the menu items are just a tiny bit overpriced, like a meal is maybe a couple of dollars more than I feel it's worth, but there isn't much else open late in the neighborhood, and it's so damned convenient that it's worth it.
author: Heidi M.

description: Ok. l am ride or die for cheeseburgers. And the burger here is in my top 5, easy. Scratch that, top 3. I have my leftovers in my bag right now that I would love to take on a fancy night downtown, but I'm on a train so I figure I should spare everyone on here the torture, plus I'm not trying to get creepy train diseases. Super bomb burger and I can't wait to eat it again. Don't forget the garlic fries either.
author: Jenna H.

description: Love this place! Would absolutely come back. Customer service was great the woman was very friendly and had a smile on her face, great spot for a great late night dinner.
author: Ricki M.

description: It's a good thing this place is connected to a bar because youre going to have to be blacked out drunk to actually enjoy it. $13 for a "pastrami gyro" ?? I wouldnt mind if it was good, but it tasted as horrible as it looked. Also the staff seems to be quite rude, maybe dealing with drunks all night has made them that way? I dont know, never again..
author: H G.

description: This is a hole in the wall next to the Tempest bar that quite randomly has really good food. I've had almost everything on the menu, and gotta say that their burger is one of a kind and always satisfies. No - this isn't a fancy place where you go for the atmosphere, it's the opposite. It's a pretty beat up looking place that serves bomb food on the regular. Get food there eat it at the bar next door (which is a dive for sure).
author: Augusto D.

description:
Delicious burger in true San Francisco style! 

It's late Friday night and I'm walking back from SOMA and I'm hungry. I'm with an out of town friend who suggests "Let's just eat anywhere" Not without checking Yelp I reply. So I see Jon A's review on this great little place that is only 1 mile away. Let's go! 

We walk through the Mission down some sketchy dark streets, down a dark side street and here is this crowd of people gathered around a doorway counter. It looks like the place is built into a garage. There is no seating, it's just a dark street and a window and wow is it ever busy! 

After I ordered I found out you can take your food over to the bar next door and eat. I was told 15 minutes come back, and we ventured next door. The bar was packed, $2 draft and not a seat in the house. We ended up eating in the street. My friend was all weirded out and questioned my choice just after ordering, but after the first bite he shocked. Best burger he has ever had. I loved it too. Totally worth the wait, lack of seating, etc. 

This to me is San Francisco. Excellent food in the weirdest of places and always a wait for something good. I will be back!

-1 star for forgetting my fries then telling me it was another 10 minute wait and to come back. I guess it was busy and loud...
author: Chris S.

description:
Awesome. Not a food truck but a food stand. A hole in the wall. 

The pinnacle of my food stand experience. Great value and amazing flavors. 

The chicken waffle? A staple for any serious foodie. Go visit.

PS. Credit cards accepted.
author: Vinny V.

description: Nice classy burger.  Love the incorporation of Bacon into the chunks vs. strips so you get more bacon taste with every bite.  I do prefer a wider burger rather than tall which are hard to eat without everything squirting out.  I rank burgers at Marlowe and Park Tavern higher (though more pricey there).  Also, wasn't wowed by the fries.  Still, quality ingredients and enjoyable.  Not much of a crowd at 11:30 on Tuesday.  Nice calm place to eat vs. a spot like Super Duper at prime time when you want to step up the quality a bit.
author: Marc S.

description:
The potato skins are amazing- they are crazy flavorful and rich and topped with chunks of pork belly instead of bacon. 

The chicken-in-waffles was ok until I tried the sriracha maple syrup and then it was yummy. By itself the waffles were kinda bland and the chicken too... I don't know... chickeny?

I'm removing a star because of the long wait for food (15+ minutes and there weren't many people there) and the lack of beverages- I get that it's next door to a bar but we were getting our food to go and it would have been nice to get a drink to go with it.
author: Michelle M.

description: I come here at least once a month for lunch and the occasional dinner (from the hole in the wall). Probably tried half the menu and haven't had a bad meal. Bomb food at great prices served at one of my favorite bars. This place is solid.
author: Anthony C.

description: Tried The Tempest. It was good late night snack. I'll go back soon to try something else.
author: Woo J.

description: After having a very mediocre experience at a different bar/food joint, this place definitely left me satisfied. The prices weren't too bad; we ordered two box burgers, mac n cheese balls, and one draft pint. Total was around $30. The burgers were pretty yummy but a bit too on the red side for my liking. It was enjoyable regardless, though I wish the server had asked how we wanted our meat cooked. I would go back here since the food was good, the interior had a nice vibe, and the drinks were cheap.
author: Jane M.

description: After a few drinks with my friends, I had the potato skins with pork belly and it was surprisingly good. Kind of a sketchy environment, but not sketchy flavors! Next time I'm going to try the chicken and waffles.
author: Olivia G.

description:
Awesome burgers!

I tried this place on a suggestion from a friend, and it's literally a hole in the wall right next to a bar. I got the Box Burger with Garlic Fries, and the burger was an awesome combination of bun, juicy beef, and some other stuff (I can't recall at the moment). The garlic fries were awesome too; not too garlicy but seasoned just right. Only negative is that there's no inside seating, and the area is kinda sketch... but would definitely try other items on their menu!
author: Raymond C.

description: The Box burger blew me away! I couldn't even muster enough patience to snap a photo before devouring it. The gentleman explained this was a sauce-less burger which worried me slightly because I typically expect some kind of sauce to enrich the flavor of a burger. Boy was I wrong! Incredibly juicy, no sauce needed! I believe the patty lay on a bed of spinach or arugula and there were shallots under the bun. Biting into it reminded me of the movie Ratatouille where all the flavored heavenly pop together... Just wow! And I've got to say the fries were a hit! I've always had some gripe about fries at this place or that: any garlic ones being too mushy n soggy. These hit the spot! Just crunchy enough on the outside, moist on the inside... The minced garlic complementing them perfectly. Phew, I feel slightly selfish knowing I found this hidden gem on some concerning back alley. I tried the potato skins just for the hell of it, based solely on reviews but not expecting much because that's not something I would typically crave...ever. Thus, I was underwhelmed. Just not my cup of tea... The only part of it I enjoyed were the quail eggs lol. But man, that burger... Deserves every bit of pretentious glory! Cannot WAIT to be back!
author: Jules S.

description:
Absolutely the BEST burger i have ever tired. I go here about once a month, so I've tried pretty much everything on the menu and Im yet to be disappointed. EVERYTHING is always amazing! fresh and flavorful. 

Tip: secret menu: FRIED PICKLES! yum!
author: Yana B.

description:
Bartender told me I had to order the burger my first time there. Good call.  Big fat juicy burger. Not crazy about the spinach and arugula instead of iceberg.  Got the egg on top too but was too well done - like it runny. 
Definitely coming back to try more.
author: Stephen D.

description:
Falafel Wrap - mmmmm
Bolito Misto - MMMMM

I want more.
author: Sarath S.

description: I tried the garlic fries, pastrami gyro, and potato skins. The fries were good, but how do you go wrong with fries, garlic and Parmesan. The pastrami was good enough that I would get it again, but I found the Arugula a bit over powering. The peppercini gave it a nice kick if you like spicy.  By far the potato skins were my favorite. The big chunks of braised pork belly were flavorful while the potato skin complimented the fatness of the park. They were simply stellar and on my list of recommended foods.
author: K Y.

description: I guess the guys didn't like me. They gave me only a quarter of a salad. See photo.
author: Nikita K.

description:
A window that serves food next to the Tempest. 

Cash only. Open until 1am.
I got the burger, and it was fantastic. Can't wait to come back!
author: Beini S.

description: The food is quite decent, now the service unreal! The olderish African American man working the door can shave back on the 'tude! Girl you're welcome we came and ate at your establishment. You don't need to be that sassy at a window. The food was especially delicious but the attitude was low level thinking backwash. I didn't pay for that. But it's okay someone prob has a sad life outside that box. Who am I to judge...but the food was worth it. I can go get the same tude for half the cost down the street. I hate to base my review on this experience but life's not fair
author: Annette S.

description: I'm giving this place 4 stars only because they didn't have the chicken and waffles available! I was devastated! Anyway, I had the box burger .. it was absolutely perfect. Might be my new favorite non fast food burger! Their garlic fries are epic. I don't even really eat fries, and the best ones I've tried before this contain truffle oil.. but these are the best non truffle oil fries I've had! definitely hit the spot.
author: Nicolette P.

description:
Little hidden spot next to a bar called "The Tempest" The place is literally just a counter for you to order at and that`s it. The menu is listed at the sign next to the counter you order at, so all you have to do is wait in line and order from there!

....except the first time I came here the Box wasn`t open, but instead I had to go to the Tempest bar and order from there instead. I won`t say anything about the bar since I`m reviewing Box, but all I gotta say is OH MY GOSH, THE FOOD WAS SOOOOO GOOD!

I had their garlic fries and their buffalo wings. The garlic fries are on point, Very crispy and not too over whelming on the garlic, even cold the fries we`re still amazing. The buffalo wings we`re hot and yummy.. but I didn`t come here for the wings really... I originally came here to get the chicken-n-waffles everyone Yelps and talks about!

I looked here on Yelp first and in my honest FIRST opinion it didn`t look too appetizing to me.. until I tried it! It was served with two small but thick waffles and fried-boneless chicken breast with sauce on the side (I don`t know what the sauce was.. but I think it was thousand island dressing?) The chicken stole my words.. hot, crispy, and, juicy is all I can describe it as! The waffles we`re plain... but once you pour the syrup on them it`s over. Very crispy and brown on the outside, soft inside. I know I want to come back just for it!
author: Johanah I.

description:
These guys (and there affiliated bar are great)!  The Box takes bar food seriously, and have added creative additions to the bar food staples that are designed to get you sitting straight on the stool again.  There's also lighter fare for those so inclined.  While most patrons have probably had too many Tempest Specials to note the difference, the ingredients used in the food are also top notch: Neman ranch beef, fresh artisanal bread delivered every morning...no frozen-patty burgers here.

Also note that during the lunch hour the bar converts to a restaurant, with white table cloths and all, and is served by the Box.

Dear Box, to many more!
author: Zach G.

description:
Box's food is far better than its surroundings dictate, and worth the wait for any level of sobriety. As I approached the door, I saw a guy puking on the other side of the Tempest door. Just hang out and enjoy the show. 

Pro Move: If you want to eat in Tempest, get a table first, then order your drinks. You'll find a lot of people, drunk or not, taking chairs and tables without asking, sometimes without even looking. 

The Box Burger is the real deal. The patty's big, served on a spicy roll, covered in cheese, and layered with a ton of thick, fresh toppings. That alone will be enough for most folks. 

Pro Move: Be prepared to order something else. Inventory at Box runs tight and everything on the menu is solid.

The jalapeno-PBR-corn hush puppies were some of the best I've ever eaten. 

Next morning's Tempest muffin set me off right early next morning. You'll be hard pressed to find a better egg sandwich.
author: Mike H.

description: For a pop-up dive kitchen next to a bar, it's as good as it gets. Their box burger is soo bomb, their garlic parm fries are on point, and pretty much everything else on the menu is consistently tasty. There's really nothing else to say. Keep on doin' whatcha do, Box Kitchen. Huge thumbs up from me.
author: Nate W.

description:
And the award for best food from a dirty dive bar goes to... BOX! I guess it's not technically IN the Tempest, so it's more dive bar-adjacent. Either way, you'll have to walk through a, hrm, shall we say, fragrantly-challenged stretch of Natoma to get to Box. You may (read: will) get accosted by a panhandler, but if you're a kind-hearted person you could just provide them with leftovers. Unfortunately I'm simultaneously heartless and a glutton, so I doubt I will ever have leftovers, because the food is too damn good. 

I had the Bolito Misto sandwich and I was just blown away by how delicious it was. Pork belly and something something something ... I stopped reading after I saw "pork belly." But the bread it was served on was the perfect blend of soft/fluffy with a slight toasted crust, and the vinaigrette or citrus glaze on the pork lent it just the right amount of acidity... 

What the fuck am I talking about, this is a dive bar sando, isn't it? Let's just say that it was the best $8 sandwich you will order from a dutch door that opens up to a urine-soaked alley. I'm really selling you on the experience, I can tell, but hey, if you don't care to brave these, um, elements, then that'll keep the wait shorter for us hardier more adventuresome folk.
author: Mike Q.

description: Box is a hole in the wall at night and the kitchen inside Tempest bar/club during the day. I was eager to try their food based on the amazing reviews. After picking up a late lunch from here, my hypothesis is that the ratings are from people who ate dinner here late at night after clubbing when they were super hungry and everything tasted great. You know what I talking about. There were times when Denny's tasted gourmet after a late night.  I got the chicken and waffles which was good but not great. I was surprised by the wait since there was not once else there.
author: Sunil R.

description:
What was ordered my first time
Adobo tacos - tasted dry and a little bit off
Chicken in waffle- hella good especially with the Siracha syrup
Box burger- fresh tastes heaven 
Falafel- excellent
Beet salad- impressive for a burger joint 
Potato skins- tasted old like the pork was sitting out for a while
Garlic fries- really good!! completes every order

This place is sort of a hit or miss. The best item by far is the box burger. It's everything that's ever promised from the romance of ground beef on the grill. The trick to the best tasting box burger is going there early (4pm-ish) Their portions tend to change at every visit and if you order to-go make sure everything is in the bag. We've ordered the waffles and upon getting home realized there was no syrup. Do order the beet salad although it could use a more generous helping of arugula. Aside from their hit or miss track record my boyfriend, his roommate and I cannot seem to find a reason to stop coming here. The bar next door isn't that bad either.
author: Quincy T.

description:
More like a 3.5 - I'd come back but only because I am so close to this place. 

Pros: Fast, tasty food for cheap-ish prices (though you're also ordering from a door in an alley and have no place to sit except maybe inside Tempest) so frankly, it *should* be cheap.

What we ate:
-Chicken in Waffles: Cute variation by putting the chicken IN the waffle. Makes for a much easier finger food. Good waffle, liked it, but not blown away. Chicken doesn't have much flavor. I prefer Farmerbrown's Little Skillet.
-Burger: Terrific - would get this again, though is it any better than other burgers from a bar/dive joints or from places like Roam, Super Duper? It's on par, but not really better. 
-Hush Pups: Ok, but these are a bit too runny for me. 

Cons: No place to sit, just a little counter to stand and eat. Service w/out a smile. Yes, we kept wondering about items not on the menu, so hey, I understand why you were prob annoyed, but anyway, service is weak.  

Other stuff: Don't come here if you're on a diet. Menu changes.
author: Veronica H.

description: Great late night food when no other place is open. Box burger was great and the fried chicken sandwich is a must try. Pastrami gyro was ok.
author: Reza F.

description:
Food poisoning. Seriously. Do not recommend location. There isn't enough words in the English vernacular to adequately explain how my gastrointestinal tract loathed this eating establishment. 

After having the garlic burger and fries, I got violently ill with a high fever, hives on chest/neck, and promptly vomited said garlic burger and fries. My boyfriend that I was traveling with also had the burger and got violently ill with nearly identical reaction. 

Because of this eating establishment, I spent my last night in San Francisco sick in a hotel bathroom for hours. 

I would like to add that I personally have an iron stomach, and I have not vomited in well over 8 years. And no, on the night on 11/22/2014 I was not inebriated.
author: Nicole H.

description:
What's the one thing that could pull me away from a prime spot for the Tuesday night drag show at Aunt Charlie's? The scuttlebutt on the burger at Box. 

The scuttlebutt was true, and as true as the transformation from bovine to drunk grubbing beef... this was the best burger I've had in SF (No joke. And I burger on about three times a week. Up until now... it was the Prather Ranch burger at Nopa. I know, typical but typical in SF is rare for the rest of the lot.). Granted... I had been drinking champagne since 5pm when my first bite happened 'round midnight. The crunch of the bun crust to the snap of the charred skin to the satin waterbed insides of the burger core, I felt like I was sent through the 36 chambers of flavor. 

At $8, ordered at a dutch door on Natoma (I love Natoma), picked up at a dutch door inside the Tempest bar and chugged with a Boont, I couldn't choreograph a better drunchie dance than that. 

I'm going back before you read this so I can relive the burger -- just this time with more concrete memories.
author: Jon A.

description: I was in San Francisco for a conference and came across this gem! Food was incredible and the service was great. I ordered the sf cheesesteak with fries and it was phenomenal. I highly recommend this place of you are ever in San Francisco.
author: Frankie D.

description: Everything I've gotten from here has made me feel awesome about life. The servings are sometimes a touch smaller than I would like, but the quality of the food for a reasonable price makes up for it. The buttermilk fried chicken sandwich is crispy, juicy, and has a bun that compliments it perfectly. The last time I was here before that was a while back, but I got the potato skins with pork belly and quail eggs and remember feeling pretty fancy about it. The staff is funny and friendly and makes the wait in the usually chilly and dank alley tolerable. Doesn't hurt that it feels a bit like an open secret if you know about this place at all.
author: Adam A.

description: Stumbled upon this place while visiting SF even though it's tucked away in an alley. Ordered the honey buffalo chicken sandwich, at the recommendation of the guy taking my order. I had it to-go, and waited maybe 10min. Sandwich was spot on, sweet, spicy and filling. It was a Tuesday night, but there was a decent crowd getting food & hanging out at the Tempest (next door bar).
author: Tiffany S.

description: James and everyone in the kitchen made amazing food and provided the best service. MUST TRY THIS SPOT OUT! Potato skins, garlic fries, & burgers all amazing!!
author: Maria Erika B.

description: My God. My first meal in SF and this is mindblowing. Something so simple done at such a high calibre, you can tell the food was made with so much care and love. Classic burger with fried onions, and parmesan garlic fries. I'm a firm believer in that a good burger doesn't need to be smothered in sauces. Let the beef and cheese and toppings stand out! Wow, a good start to my SF trip.
author: Samson T.

description:
Where have you been all my life, Box Kitchen? You taste excellent sober; I can't wait to taste you drunk. You're a beacon of light in a falling apart alleyway; you're the hole-in-the-wall that San Francisco needs and deserves. If you're asking "What? Why does a dive bar's outside food window have rave reviews? Why is it open for lunch?" I have no answers to your questions, but you must come and experience Wonderland for yourself.

This is not ordinary dive bar greasy, microwavable food. I came around 7:30PM on a Friday night and they were out of Chicken in Waffles, so I got the Box Burger ($8) with garlic fries (+$2) (the garlic fries are the default fries add-on option to the burger). Little did I know that I had ordered a single-digit-price masterpiece. My friend declared that this was the best burger she had ever had. I've had my decent share of artisan burgers, and for half the price, this one is the real deal. Look at these ingredients (just look at them!!): ground schmitz ranch chuck burger, bacon shallot gastrique, white cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, crispy shallots, potato pepper bun. Gastrique?? Crispy shallots?? In a burger? Real life? Juicy, not too greasy, perfect balance of ingredients, fresh bun (I hate the dry/preserved stuff of fast food joints). I very much enjoy Super Duper's garlic fries, and Box Kitchen tones down the sharpness of the garlic and achieves a crispy exterior coat on their garlic fries.

If you're confused about this place, just come here. You're missing out.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Really wholesome tasting Burger 4/5
Chicken & Waffle 3/5

It's great that the burger isn't gooped with too much sauce and junk like many joints like to do these days with their burgers, sandwiches, and sushi rolls (really? is more mayonnaise really better? this is one shortcut eateries need to stop NOW). The patty has a rough ground so you can really taste the honest beef flavor. 

While the waffle was good, I thought the fried chicken was so-so. Don't get me wrong, for chicken breast, this was one of the juiciest ever. However, the mushy crust places their chicken behind... KFC (sorry, it's true).
author: John H.

description:
Ordered the chicken in waffle was told my wait would be 12mins... 

The waffle with some chicken bits on the side was tasteless and the waffles strips were soggy and limp tasting
author: Stephanie B.

description: Really really awesome burger. If I go back and it's as good or better I might have to up this to 5. Adding words so Yelp lets me post a review and not a stupid tip. Cool blah blah blah blah. Woooooooooooooooooo
author: Rohan S.

description:
One, Stephen Crawford is a boss. Two, Box caters.

Stephen is bringing gourmet to Natoma St. 

The last two smaller events I've thrown, I've gone straight to Stephen for catering. He makes the catering process so simple. He listens well, provides great feedback and creates a menu that you can yay or nay. He is so knowledgeable about food and it's so obvious that food is his passion. Box makes delicious food at such reasonable rates. 5 stars. Boom.

Lastly, the Box Burger. Order it.
author: Rosa L.

description: This is the place to visits for a delicious quality late night meal that will NOT disappoint. We are so delighted to have found this little gem through yelp and they really do have one of the best burgers we have ever had. Although $8 might be a bit much for just the burger and no sides, but trust me, everything about this place is amazing. We also really enjoy the fact that they change their menu frequently but at the same time keep their best items permanent. The neighborhood is very shady, but hey, for food this good at 12am, I'll take my chances.
author: Panamus P.

description: This place is an awesome hole in the wall munchie joint! I definitely recommend trying the fried macaroni n cheese balls, the fries and box burger was good also!
author: Kenneth S.

description:
Ive tried about half the menu - the burger, the potato skins, fried mac and cheese balls, garlic fries and the chicken sandwich. Neither were excellent or bad. But they all seemed to lack that something. Maybe it's because I never went to the bar to get a drink with my food. 

Thinking about the burger makes me gag especially when the 2nd time I ordered it, it was more pink and it had that meat smell/taste ...you know that taste that reminds you you're eating a cow!? ew.  It's not flavorful even with all these things in it. It would drip with juices and piled with stuff ( i guess lettuce) yet there was no flavor. Ketchup didn't seem to help much either. Ive also tried the chicken and waffles. It's more of an appetizer and should be changed to chicken IN waffles so that was a bit disappointing. i also didn't read the description because what else was I to expect when you see the words "chicken and waffles"?! And the syrup was too sweet and spicy, but without the syrup it was bland. Le sigh.
author: Mila B.

description: One of the best burgers and fries I've had in a long time! I got the Box Burger and it was so delicious, and the combination with the garlic fries was phenomenal.. Definitely going there again, but next time I'll take it into the bar next door to get a drink!
author: Nate E.

description: The best burger I've had in San Francisco. The fries are amazingly seasoned as well. Located on an alley next to Tempest, a great dive bar downtown. Get a drink while you wait.
author: Charlie M.

description:
Okay, so you're at Tempest and you just did a round of mystery shots and are halfway through your first pint of PBR.

Stop.

Put your glass down and ask a friend to watch it. Walk out the front door and turn left. Walk about 50 feet down the sidewalk to Eat Box. Order a bunch of finger food for you and your friends. Pay with the cash you got from the ATM at Tempest. Set a timer for 10 minutes and go back to the bar.

Finish your beer, and go get another one. When the timer goes off, head back over to Eat Box and pick up your delicious wings and chicken-waffles and jalapeño-corndogs. Return to the bar, find a seat, and stuff your face.

Carry on drinking, and go ahead and have that third pint of beer, because you've got a base of tasty food down in your stomach to help you deal with it.

Thanks, Eat Box, for all that you do to ensure my drinking nights don't become absolute train wrecks.

(If you're wondering about what's good on the menu, the answer is "everything".)
author: Sam K.

description: Freakin awesome burger and fried Brussel sprouts. Burger was well made - medium rare. Excellent. $10. The Brussel sprouts really complement the burger. Took like 15 minutes but well worth it.
author: Ron P.

description: Literally a hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Very much located in an alleyway :P Tried the chicken in the waffle with a Sriracha maple syrup. Pretty damn good but I found the portion a bit small. Definitely would come back to try more of the menu.
author: Ann V.

description: Box Kitchen has a unique advantage over any other restaurant I've ever reviewed because, with Tempest right next door, I'm certain I've never eaten their food sober. Everything I've ever ordered here was "fucking amazing," but to be fair when I'm drunk I think everything is fucking amazing.
author: Jay S.

description:
Burger... smokey goodness.  

Potato skins with quail eggs and pork belly goodness.

And pork when they have it -- because it is so good it sells out.

That's all you need to order.  Hole in the wall, less than $10 for each item.

Hit up the Tempest while you wait for food!  An alley full of happy surprises ...
author: Mel E.

description: Got our order wrong twice. Undercooked egg sandwich, fries instead of Brussels sprouts, seriously undercooked burger. This place has four stars because people eat there when drunk. Too bad I was too sober to not notice this mess.
author: Ross B.

description: 5 stars for deliciousness but only a window so be prepared to eat standing or back in your car. Great late night eats since they're open late. Tempest DIVE bar is attached if you want to grab a drink with your food. Happy eats!
author: Sabi M.

description: I  really give 3 1/2 !  Had the brisket sandwich ($10); extra for fries, not sure why.  The brisket was quite flavorful, as well as the fries.  The fries could have been less soggy and the brisket was a bit dry.  I love me some gooood bisket!  The guy who takes the orders was really nice.  I wish they sold drinks, but went to The Burlington Coat Factory to buy a Diet Coke! YES!  BURLINGTON COAT FACTORY!  :)  My friend loved his box burger.  We took our food to his car, parked around the corner, and really enjoyed it all.  The best brisket sandwich I have yet to have was at The Pescadero Country Store!  Brissssssket!
author: Delicious B.

description: The burger I got here was delicious -- especially the tomatoes. You know how much burgers' tomatoes are kind of.. bland? These tomatoes, I have no idea where they got them but they taste divine, juicy, and red, unlike any tomatoes I have ever tasted on a burger. The other ingredients were top notch too, but for some reason the tomatoes were the most memorable.
author: Max L.

description: Hands down best cheeseburger in the city. I love cheeseburgers, and have never been so surprised. You seriously have never lived if you haven't tried this cheeseburger. You order from a a hole in the wall next to a bar, and grab a drink while you wait for your food. The bar dinner combination is perfect. It feels so much less pretentious than the rest of the area, so it is the perfect place to shut off after a day of work.
author: Ryan R.

description: Ok stayed at Intercontinental on Howard St. I wanted some other than room service. Great late night food! We could not decide so we purchased corn on the cob, box burger, honey chicken sandwich, potato skins and the garlic fries. Best was the Box Burger. Area was suspect so don't walk by yourself. We left San Fran yesterday and we are still talking about the concert, Crustacean and the Box Burger!
author: Myesha D.

description: This place is an alley that I drive down every night to get home and I never noticed it until I was hangry one night and jumped on Yelp.  OMG, the Box burger and garlic fries were amazing...best burger that I have had in SF.  The burger was juicy, flavorful, and paired nicely with the garlic fries.  As for the service, they were friendly and my order didn't take too long even though it was made to order.
author: T U.

description: So is ok. Good for bar but not all the jazz ppl make it out to be. Great atmosphere  n great prices on drinks. I've had burger which was well cooked. I also have had chicken n waff. That was decent but way over priced for quantity and had BARLEY any chicken. I would consider myself  a foodie n have higher expectations than others.
author: Jozef S.

description: Bacon, Bacon, Bacon, Bacon.  Should I continue? Chicken 'in' waffles (with Siracha Maple syrup).  One of the best burgers I have ever had, top 5 in SF.  The Brussels sprouts, A #1.  How does a walk-up window on an alley behind the Chronicle building have the best food in the city?  Must be Magic (bacon grease).
author: Johannes K.

description:
Above-average bar food, served with an XXL side of IDGAF.

I'd probably add another star if they were a little more consistent in quality, and didn't screw up orders with some regularity. I really enjoyed their chicken sandwiches until they (recently) switched to fatty thigh meat and pointlessly drowning it in hot sauce.
author: Boogee Z.

description:
Warning: long rant/review.

The decent:
1. The food. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't an OMG moment either. The food concept is creative and different-ish (i.e. siracha maple syrup), but that's all it was - different. 

The bad:
1. The wait. 25 minutes for chicken in waffles, garlic fries, and a honey mustard crispy chicken sandwich. The sandwich came out in decent time; less than 10 minutes. The other two orders they forgot about. When we were there, there were 2 customers ahead of us and 2 after us. C'mon now. It's not exactly the dinner rush. And when we asked to have them double check the order, the chicken in waffles had actually been sitting on the counter all along, and they had to quickly pull together the garlic fries.

2. The environment. Literally a hole in the wall. No seating, no tables, nothing. There were cigarette butts EVERYWHERE. You could not avoid stepping on them. And so many people hanging outside of the bar were smoking and spitting at random places on the sidewalk. 
After we placed our order, we had to wait at the sidewalk. I had literally just come off a 2hr commute from Sac to pick up the boyfriend for dinner, so I guess I was tired + hungry and therefore cranky, but when this very intoxicated and loud group of 6 came to stand with the 1 guy in their group who ordered, I got ANNOYED. You're all standing in a close circle. Why are you screaming at each other?! Talking louder does not make you appear to be a cooler person. It just makes you obnoxious. Not only were they loud, but the extremely trashy jokes they threw around about rape were really insensitive. It made me question how they behaved when SOBER.
And maybe we came at a bad time because they were wheeling out their trash bins and emptying compost into the bin. It's not very appetizing to have your trash bins next to the order window, but with such a small "storefront" I guess they have no choice. 

3. The attitude. I understand that when dealing with intoxicated, loud, obnoxious customers, you need to be bruff and stand your ground, but not ALL of your customers have had a drink and/or a smoke. We certainly did not need to be given an attitude over a bag. Yes, we did not ask for it to go, but you did not ask us either so we are both at fault. Just give us a darn bag already. Jeez. It doesn't have to turn into a DEBATE over who did and didn't do something. 

4. The correction. When my boyfriend said "chicken in waffles", I guess the "IN: was not pronounced enough for the guy taking our order. It was not necessary to cut my boyfriend off mid-order and say, "It's chicken IN waffles." Yes, we know. "Chicken IN waffles" is what the sign says, but when we got our order, it was more "waffles with specks of chicken here and there". The sign should be corrected due to its lack of chicken. 

Normally, I go to a place with low Yelp ratings and am pleasantly surprised by it. This is the first time I've gone somewhere with high ratings and ended up so unsatisfied. I really don't see the hype. I guess you'd have to have a drink or two in you before you find it's appeal. 
Honestly, the only reason I'm not giving this place 1 star is because in my annoyance, I found it slightly entertaining when the guy behind the door was arguing with an intoxicated Tempest-goer. I was also amused by the group I found annoying in the first place; their conversation made them look so....brilliant.....*cough*
author: Florence S.

description:
As my BF and I were getting ready to leave the bar Tempest (next door) we decide that we really need to check out this spot especially since I was getting pretty hungry. Trust me, we are so very glad that we did.

I ordered the wings and wieners for my friends, and decided to get the falafel wrap to go. After we got the order, he plops the two baskets down back at the bar for my friends and in between the silence was the cries of "This is SO GOOD!" I admit, I didn't get a chance to taste the wiener which was basically a small corndog with jalapeno but from the happy group, I can tell that they were a huge hit. The wings were different but a fantastic different -- they were a savory and yet sweet teriyaki kind of sauce -- I had a small bite and it was so good. 

The falafel, which I just finished devouring was delicious. I'm not sure what kind of black magic went into it, but I can say that the falafel was chopped making the overall wrap a bit more manageable. Honestly, great food all round and great service.
author: Shauna S.

description: Food was great, service was so so. Had the wings, French fries,breadsticks,and the corn on the cob. Prices range from $6-9. It's really convenient for the time of night but the location was very sketchy.
author: Adam D.

description: Box kitchen is this small hole in the wall place the had an extremely friendly staff. Brittany was an awesome server and so helpful with giving us a list of non tourist things to do while here. Beer nice and cold. Food I had the original burger with garlic fries. The burger was very tall stacked with bacon lettuce fried onion little curly Q,s cheese tomato and special mayo on a potato pepper bun. All was fantastic. As an appetizer we had the fried mac n cheese balls Soo good!!  Our only recommendation would be to ask patrons how they would like their burger cooked. Cooking a burger to well down destroyed it. Fair price. Will be back.
author: Chad C.

description:
Came here for a quick snack...didn't know what to expect.

My brother ordered a couple extra items for himself that I did not try. However, I did try the:
- Garlic Fries -- Made with fresh garlic and so much tastier than the fries that with bits of garlic falling all over the place. The fresh garlic was strong in taste and coated the fries well.
- Pickle Chips -- I had no idea what we were getting. Oh my god, this was so good! Whatever spice he puts on top made it that much better.

I would definitely come here again when I am in the area. The kitchen is in full view while you wait outside for your food. He makes everything right after you order!
author: Anisha G.

description:
Rockin' corndogs and fried pickles. Conveniently located next door to Tempest, so it's perfect for munchies. I'm going back for the chicken, waffle, bacon combo!

Stand outside this place inhaling the smells (of the delicious food, not the SoMA!) and resist ordering something, I dare you.

EDIT: New fav: the falafel. Trust me! Do it!
author: Leigh W.

description:
I talked to the guy working there, and this _is_ just the Tempest's kitchen, open out the back in the evening because its too crazy to order things inside.

But I've never eaten at the Tempest proper, only picked up food at this little magic window, so my review goes here.

Their Falafel is great. So fresh, and crispy. It has a great taste too. Definitely suggested, even for meat eaters.

They had these Fried Brussel Sprouts that were amazing. I can't imagine their Garlic Fries are better than these, so I'll have to try them next time to see.
author: Jason S.

description: The burger is juicy and the garlic fries have the right crisp to them. It's a fantastic late-night spot for food on the go, and you can take it in to the bar next door.
author: Krista J.

description: I've had my share of burger hunt in the city, this has the best burgers hands down in the city. If you know of a better spot inbox me! Lol. Treat your taste buds
author: Wayne T.

description: Great food! Little hole in the wall, got the chicken sandwich, bread awesome, spicy like mayo sauce with coleslaw. Totally will go back for the food. Only disappointment is that it is down a kinda dark street at night, and although it's next to a bar, there seemed to be many homeless people wondering by. I had my 10 year old son with me it was around 9ish and some drunk homeless man kept walking hovering the area taking about very negatively about himself and his race. It was not a good waiting around experience with my son.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Let me start off by saying I don't work here or for the club -- and my review is honest.
Don't waste your time coming to this burger joint unless you came here for a drink at the bar Tempest next door. My guess is most reviewers who came here did so to drink at the bar . Not me -- I read the reviews and went for the Box Burger. 
I was surprised at how bad the oil smelled. The place is a hole in the wall with Mexican cooks . The oil smells and tastes bad and you can literally smell it all over your fries and burger which is soaking with oil . I am not eating here anymore -- the beef for the burger tastes strange . You guys read the other reviews (which were probably written by drunk bar people anyways) , and want to go to this hole in the wall, jump right ahead . I'll be laughing when you realize my review was the honest one.
author: S N.

description:
Not really digging the location but the burger is really good and tastes of high quality beef and deliciousness. Also, the garlic fries are bomb.com (I hate that but I will use it anyway).
However, the chicken in waffle is not a winner, winner, chicken dinner (I hate that as well). I don't know, maybe I got a bad one, but waffle was floppy and had hardly any chicken. I was searching for it with each bite. The syrup had a real kick to it though. I liked that.
I'd go back when I'm down that way again. 
Oh, another thing, they are connected to the bar next door, and you order out a little window that looks directly into the kitchen. There is no where to sit and eat unless you like the nasty, probably puke-covered-then-hosed-off streets, or you could go eat in the bar which I'm sure means you'll have to get a couple drinks. I'd call ahead and pick up. And make sure their credit card machine is working because it wasn't when I went.
author: Karen C.

description: This place is a great little hole in the wall, literally. There are no seats to speak of and you order your food at the door and they call your name out.  The good is really great and satisfying.  I had the salt and vinegar fries and the Chicken sandwich, I was not disappointed.  I only had one complaint my fried who is celiac couldn't be assured of a gluten free meal. All else was amazing.
author: B W.

description:
Secretly the best, cheapest, food in the area. I always like the brussels sprouts. 

Open late and tempest (bar next door) let's you eat inside.
author: Louis H.

description: Definitely a hole in the wall. It's a bit hard to find of you're new to San Francisco. We were craving chicken and waffles and I found this small place right by our hotel. We walked here and it was kind of a shady street. We went here anyway and were so glad we did. The chicken IN waffles did not disappoint. It was actually so delicious. I love the fun spin on the maple syrup with the sriracha sauce. So bold and yummy! The garlic fries were oh so delicious. Perfectly golden and the flavor was so... tasty.
author: Jessica M.

description: Well worth the drive out from Walnut Creek! If your looking for a real hole in the wall this is the place! It is literally a hole in the wall that you order from. The Staff is awesome and really enjoys what they are doing and the food is amazing. I didn't even know what was in my burger but everything just went so well together!
author: William U.

description: Best hole in the wall, ever.  Little pricy without a doubt but it'll fill your late night cravings with incredible,  greasy,  original menu options. It's all great, you can't go wrong here.
author: Brandon N.

description:
nachos - not that great. not the usual nachos you'd expect. 
i had one of the sandwiches..think it was pork with pesto. it was alrite. meat was pretty dry. 
boyfriend had the burger- he said it was good. he also had a bunch of toppings added. 

not a big fan of box and the tempest...pretty strange crowd..
author: Janet Y.

description: Came here and tried the burger with garlic fries. It's one of the few places in the are that cooks it juicy and not dry and well done. I asked for medium rare but it came out as medium. Nonetheless, it was still a very enjoyable burger with some fairly high quality toppings. The garlic fries were delectable although the texture could have been a bit more supple after the initial bite. Overall I would still recommend this place for anyone looking for a casual, fast, inexpensive, and tasty meal.
author: Cory N.

description: The Box has one of the best (if not best) hamburger in San Francisco. BOOM. There, I said it. It's a simple grind and well seasoned - the way it should be. With that said, you don't need to add anything else to this burger, you animal. Unless of course you're having it next door at Tempest (another fantastic spot). In which case you should have it with a whiskey and a beer back.
author: Dianne D.

description: I don't understand the raving reviews about this place. Yes it is cool that it is hidden down an alley. And I have never had a bad meal that was served to me through a window that wasn't fast food. Even the menu sounds pretty good. But nothing tasted good. Between the burger, chicken sandwich, and garlic fries, I would have much rather had the same food from a fast food joint and liked it more.
author: Bradford L.

description: This place was awesome! Great food. We had the honey mustard chicken sandwich, pork tacos, and queso. It was all amazing! Great flavor, and fresh ingredients. I  also thought it was super reasonably priced for San Francisco. Definitely a pretty sketch neighborhood from the looks, but we didn't run into any trouble in the block in a half we walked or while waiting for our food--which was ready super quick.
author: Drew H.

description: Hands down one of the best burgers I have eaten, especially for under $10.  This is a great hangout spot, next to a bar.  There is no seating, this place is definitely a hole-in-the wall, but its got a great atmosphere and the people who hang around are really nice.
author: NinjaJeff S.

description: Really really good food. Service is cold, but the food is very good. Walk up window, hole in the wall. Part of Tempest bar
author: wayz W.

description:
Holy mother of....
Best burger I've ever had.  Bar none.  Keep in mind, though, this is, quite literally, a hole in the wall.  I mean, no seating.  Plan to take your food with you and eat it somewhere else.  But you'll enjoy it!
author: Robb L.

description: Came back multiple times and had pretty much everything else on the menu and it was all amazing. Their burger is absolutely fantastic. It was perfectly cooked and extremely flavorful. The fried chicken sandwich was also delicious. I'd definitely recommend everything on the menu.
author: William L.

description: BEST BAR FOOD EVER. Tempest does it right with their food. Even SFPD recognizes
author: S B.

description: One of my favorite spots in SoMa, if not the city. What they lack in seats - they have none - they make up for in creativity and deliciousness. There are a few excellent menu stalwarts like the Box Burger and Garlic Fries that are always worth a try (or repeat). Better yet are some of the temporary offerings, like the amazing quesadilla with sweet potatoes and avocado. There were other ingredients, too, but I don't think I really need to elaborate after that. Stop by before or after beers in the bar next door, Tempest.
author: Brett B.

description: Food is super tasty, but its in a sketchy back alley. Order the chicken sandwich, bring mace.... oh and a pop if you dont plan to hit the bar. No drinks here.
author: Christie S.

description: Better than expected burger and excellent garlic fries. Burger patty was perfect. Overall a bit fatty but good. Positively surprised, would go again.
author: Olli J.

description: Holy crap, this was good (i.e. the Box Burger). It's the kind of place you want to call a hidden gem, but yet any yuppie or hipster in SF knows about it already. I'm sure the backlash is gestating at a minimum, so here's my part to stem the tide. This is a legitimate contender for the best burger I've had - I can't think of one I like better. I'm from Dallas and I've eaten a ton there - Dallas is a great burger town. This was my first in SF and it pains my right-leaning self to say this trumps all in Dallas. I ate in the dark so couldn't see exactly what was elevating it to these heights, but upon ravaging this sandwich in the course of two city blocks, I inspected the barren box and I do believe I discovered pancetta bits. Cheating? Perhaps, but it's not like there weren't two buns and a beef patty in there too. Young Darryl couldn't imagine saying it, but, at $8 this was a bargain.
author: Darryl R.

description: Great takeout window in a great dive. From Burgers to adobo tacos to falafel....it's all good. Only knock against it is no OrderAhead or EAT24 for pickup orders.
author: Cyrus H.

description: Come here if you're looking for an epic burger! These are the places we need 6 stars for!! Their meat is great quality, vegetables fresh and twist on classic meals incredible! Personally the burger does it for me however their chicken sandwich is also great, and potato skins are awesome. They have falafel for vegetarians.
author: Timothy R.

description: I changed my last review into a 5 star simply because this place has grown to be one of my favorite places in the city for late night grubs. The service is always super friendly because Nevin makes sure of that.
author: Devin W.

description: Bomb ass garlic fries and chicken sandwich! Would love to try the brussell sprouts and chicken IN waffles next time. Thanks for the hook up, cutie!
author: Riza D.

description: Omg those were the most amazing garlic fries I have ever eaten. If you haven't eaten here you must!
author: Kayla D.

description: Their burger is super delicious, and I don't mind paying a little more for the food, as thebar is hella cheap. Can't wait to try their potato skins with quail eggs!
author: Leena T.

description: As good as it gets. Don't walk...run to this amazing hole in the wall. Do it! You'll thank me later. Chicken and Waffles do not disappoint. :)
author: Jessica V.

description: Divine. 100% worth the trek into the semi-sketchy area of 6th street for incredibly delicious food and an awesome bar atmosphere. We split the chicken and waffles (with siracha maple syrup) and cheeseburger. SO GOOD! I'll be back soon :)
author: Eliza D.

description: A little overrated but definitely worth a try. The menu is ecletic and more gourmet than you would expect from a hole in the wall. If you hate hipster trash than stay very far away from this place.
author: Jeremy S.

description: The box burger was delicious. The white cheddar tops it off. Cooked a perfect medium rare. Had it with some really good garlic fries. Eat your burger next door in the bar with a nice cold beer. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Christopher Z.

description:
i get food here when i go to tempest.
burger's decent, love the fries
author: Whitne Y.

description: I was actually really confused about the location because it's right next to this bar/lounge that's next door which was super ghetto.  I thought it was the bar/lounge so I was about to just bounce, but luckily the bouncer told me Box was next door.  The eatery is literally a hole in the wall.  You order from outside the kitchen.  The place looks clean enough though.  Me and my friend ordered garlic fries and a box burger.  I would have to say that the garlic fries are one of the best I've ever had.  They definitely compare to the garlic fries at the ballpark  I didn't really try to the burger  but my friend said it was really good and he's super picky!
author: Steven S.

description: Damn good burger. Nicely medium cooked with bacon and fried onion bits on it. Super juicey for $8. Highly recommend adding the garlic fries for only $2 more. After you get you food head next door to tempest to sit and grab a beer.
author: Philip K.

description: LITERALLY a hole in the wall. So awesome. I had their falafel wrap, it was the best I've had in the city. Hummus, feta, red onions, red and green peppers, taiziki sauce, cucumbers, huge chunk of fresh spinach, and ciracha! DElicious!  I will be coming back next time Im down near Powell
author: Kayla O.

description:
Very very bad customer service
Very bad food
The cashier kept telling us you don't have any manners because we ordered some ketchup
The food was disgusting
author: Nader S.

description:
This would be my first six-star Yelp review. The burger is unbelievably good. It's $8. I'm never eating an expensive burger anywhere else as long as Box is around, it'd be a waste. The Bolito Misto pork belly sandwich, garlic fries, and hush puppies are great too. 

Apparently the new chef arrived a month ago, which explains why there's only been 5-star reviews here since then... 

They're open from 11am-3pm weekdays now, in addition to 5pm-1am every day. Go now, it's going to have hour-long lines soon enough.
author: John K.

description:
man, I can't get enough of this place. damn near every time we go to the city we stop by here to see what new creations are on the menu. one favorite is the home made cracker jacks with BACON! everything is better with bacon... especially cracker jacks. 

finally actually made it into Tempest too, pretty cool bar. I'll be back for sure.
author: Dahled J.

description: Literally a hole in the wall next to the Tempest Bar (You can bring food in). Definitely check out their Chicken & Waffles (Chicken shreds inside the waffle) with spicy maple syrup. The prices are good, and it's a great way to chase that IPA from Tempest.
author: Kevi L.

description: Chicken in a waffle was very different . Garlic fries standard. Brussels sprout was really good. Maybe the best ever . Price is almost same as any restaurant . What is really weird it closes at 1 so it's not really a after club spot . Plenty of street parking if you don't mind parking in a dark alley.
author: Justin I.

description: It would be a shame to rate that amazing burger a mere 4 stars.
author: nick o.

description: Fried chicken sandwich thing was acceptable. Nothing to rave about. Was not a fan of the cabbage they put on it.
author: Lucifer N.

description: ultimate bar food counter window that probably is synergistic with tempest.  typical comfort food with ingredients listed as more upscale than its surroundings.  crispy chicken sandwich and the rest of the menu like a food truck and probably perfect for late night munchies.
author: Rob C.

description: Ate here three times in two days. Really tasty food, cheap, and you can have a drink while you wait, then eat your food in the bar next door. Only problem is that I am physically unable to eat as many Bolito Misto's as I feel they deserve.
author: Jordan F.

description: This place is epic! SO GOOD EVERY TIME! I live a couple blocks away and go here at least once a week! Food is crafted with consistent attention to awesomeness, yumminess, and quality. They really pair all the right things in each meal, too. Recommendations: Box Burger + Garlic Fries (one of the best burgers I've ever had, srsly); Fried Chicken Sando + Garlic Fries (i think this actually is the best friend chicken sandwich I've never had, actually -- really interesting flavors, super moist and tasty chicken, perfectly fried :) ... and the garlic friends are always out of this world. :) Still need to try the baked potatoes w/ quail eggs, but I bet I won't be disappointed. :) The guys who work here are all awesome too!
author: Ashley N.

description:
Has to be one of the best burgers I've ever had.... Tack on an order of garlic fries that were perfect (hot, crispy, garlicky but not overwhelming).

All in cost was $13 and worth every penny.

Tough time deciding - wanted chicken & waffles or the tacos... Lots of good stuff and worth a stop if your staying around the corner at #HotelZetta
author: Jeff D.

description: A small hole in the wall place that serves take-out only next to an awesome bar, what's not to like. The garlic fries and the potato skins were delicious. Granted I was drunk, but I will be back; most likely I'll be drunk so everything should work out just fine.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Best in class cheap eats. The service is great. Most importantly, these guys know their food. Had the garlic fries and burger featuring bacon shallot gastrique. mmm. But the highlight? The Chicken in Waffles with sriracha maple syrup. Spicy, sweet, with waffle, just great, really comforting lol.
