This is a food stand (hole in the wall) in a not so pretty alley behind the mall so there is no seating. You are allowed to eat at the neighboring bar (Tempest) or do what we did...walk 1 block back to Westfield San Francisco and eat at the mall food court.

Wherever you decide to eat it, make sure you come. I will be back...
author: Kamara B.

description: This place was just what the doctor ordered a couple of Saturday's ago after a karaoke bash for a friend. The guy who took our order was very sweet to me. And then our food was ready more quickly than estimated. And THEN, our food was delicious. A+.
author: Sarah B.

description: OH MAN, this place rules. Late night fusion comfort food delieciousness. Love it.
author: Robert M.

description: Great food. Only reason they don't get 5 stars is because I really loved the corndogs they used to sell. Everyone from my company used to go here after work to drink and eat, and after they changed the menu they got rid of a lot of our favorites. We don't go nearly as often anymore. Bring back the corndogs!!
author: Lauren D.

description: it was the best of times and it was the worst of times, when i first discovered this place, to when I actually went. Chicken in waffles sounded legendary and the menu and pictures quickly led to the necessity to try. what was actually there was very plain and lacked complexity. The fries were good but if not frozen aren't they always?. Chicken sandwich is boring with dry bun. The ingredients in all the dishes sound provocative at best but seem no better then more simple and familiar ones. Next too loud bar it was clear this was a satellite kitchen feeding the demand of its drunk patrons. Might go back for  the burger especially if I am at the tempest an need to soak up the booze.
author: Jake C.

description: Next door to the tempest so it is convenient. Good bar food, Chicken and waffle sticks fuck yea. Deep fried corn alright I'll give it a shot, and they take debit/credit cards.
author: Raul R.

description: Decided to give this place a shot since it was the first place that popped up on Yelp. Was already lured in when I saw pork adobo tacos and chicharones on their menu! Nice vibe once you walk into the bar Tempest. I like the whole divey bar look with tagging and stickers everywhere! Once I sat down and saw the whole menu with chicken and waffles, I was set, but was a little bummed when the waitress told me the waffle machine was broke. I still went with pork adobo tacos which were tasty! I would definitely want to check this spot out at night again in the nearest future!!
author: Jayce M.

description: Ok you know I never knew about this place whenever I came to Tempest.  My friends would always message me with something like, "Be there in a sec grabbing food" and then show up with these pretty good wings. By the time I figured you know I should get food and ask them where they got these from, I was a little too out of it to figure the rest out on my own. Finally after coming with some more friends we landed here and all got food before hand and I got to discover a dish which called to me. Chicken IN Waffles. Rather than having to mess around with trying to eat the chicken between to waffles or should I make a sandwich or should I eat them alone ... this was easy, they just put the chicken carnitas in the waffle batter and sliced up the waffle into strips. This was genius in my mind and pretty good too.
author: Greg G.

description: Best garlic fries and box burger of my life! Extremely flaverful and would recommend to everyone!
author: Kob A.

description: I've been here a couple of times and I've never been disappointed.  Everything I've  tried has been unbelievably good.  My friend went on and on about her falafel wrap.  The tacos are hands down a must have,  and those potato skins are to die for.  Yes a small trek through an alley is worth the reward of the best gourmet bar food you will ever eat.
author: Penni T.

description: Slow service and a bit smelly.  Fish sando was excellent.  Garlic fries were above average. Chicerones were mediocre.
author: Brett M.

description: Okay , this burger could easily go for 35 bucks in a primo restaurant. The guys who started the swanky bar next door opened this place for drunk eats. They applied their culinary acumen and the result is our benefit. Nothing price-to-value wise is better. Go for it.
author: Guy H.

description:
Wow.  The only thing I've had is the Box Burger and it was absolutely fabulous, just exPLODING with flavor in every bite and perfectly balanced and pleasing textures.  How do you do that with a burger?  Right up there with the couple of best-ever burgers, ever.

The "salad included" is an outstanding mix of baby spinach, baby kale, and a few other greens all with great flavor; I got the balsamic dressing which was light and tasted superb.

Every ingredient carries its weight, does not overpower, and is there for its specific contribution to the overall experience.  Verging on masterful, for $10!!  At least as far as the burger goes... but other reviewers indicate similar outperformance for the other choices as well.

I walked past Box a bunch of times because people say it's "next to" Tempest.  Well I didn't find anything like a window "next to" Tempest.  It must have been closed (lunch time).  Just go inside Tempest, sit down at a table, and order the food -- it's Box.

And it doesn't hurt that the playlist has Doors, Pink Floyd, Beatles, Stones, Aerosmith, etc.
author: Mike K.

description: This place is about as good as it gets for burgers and I eat hella burgers! The grassfed beef and the made to order nature of the burgers really makes it worth the $. The buns and the greens they put on them (Spinach?) really work and the guy behind the grill is a wizard. I have often tried to cook burgers at home but I can never make a good one. That is why I'm always on the lookout for hella dope burgers and this place is my current go to. Extra cheese please!
author: Linda T.

description: From there chicken n waffles to one of the best burgers I've ever had cooked med rare perfectly! Have a seat at the bar next door for a cheap beer n it's better then the triple dollar restaurant down the street! A must try : )
author: KC S.

description: I was seeking out some place to get some quick food at around 10pm. This place was perfect to say the least. The prices are good and the food is top notch. I got some parmesan chicken wings that were incredible. The helping was big enough for 2 people almost. Very satisfying. I gave these guys a good tip and they were very grateful. You should do the same!
author: Trav C.

description: This review is for the box burger and fries. Amazing! I've gotten it several times and it never disappoints.
author: Erin P.

description: the burger is so juicy and the meat so flavorful, and its medium rare without instructions,  and I think I found guanciale in my burger.    #1 burger.
author: Wakako U.

description: chicken IN your waffle beats chicken on your waffle...not a big chicken & waffles person normally, but these were DELISH. and so were the hush puppies. down side = might have to sit on the side walk to eat or walk and eat, in a not so nice part of SF.. but other than that, yummy food and definitely worth trying!
author: Lisa H.

description: A literal hole in the wall. Had the honey mustard chicken sandwich and a coconut. Expected more, to be honest, from the reviews for this place. The sandwich was decent. Would probably come back and try something else, but was pretty expensive for the back alley soup kitchen vibe. The coconut was perfect.
author: Jay Y.

description: brusselsproutsssssssssss and cheap drinks just a step away hellllllllll yaaaaaaaaaaaa
author: J A.

description: Each time I've eaten here its been delicious, they have a simple menu with amazingly prepared dishes!  Last night, I had the potato skins.  Crispy pork belly on roasted potatoes with Gouda and topped with a quail egg.  The best thing ever!!!!  They were so good I felt compelled to share them with my son and husband, and then had instant remorse when there weren't any more to eat!!!  So delicious!
author: Melissa G.

description: look for the large sign that says "tempest."  very chill environment, lax wait staff, delicious burger!  i got the box burger with bacon, and it was amazing.  everyone else in my group loved their food as well.
author: Mars E.

description: The garlic fries are cooked well, but the fries need more garlic. I also ordered the fried chicken sandwich. The chicken was fried very well and was deliciously crispy. However, the bun was the part I did not like about the meal. It was out of place in the sandwich because it is too thick and dry. The bun made it seem like you just had a mouthful of bread. Aside from that, this restaurant has a very good location.
author: Kevin T.

description: Best chicken and waffles and garlic fries in town!! Small, cozy, and perfectly delectable. A must try if you are in SF
author: Mary D.

description: Chicken bits inside the crispy waffle with crispy chicken skins on top off the waffle partnered with a spicy sweet sriracha syrup!  Unbelievable.
author: KAREN C.
